loans.name: Ayiwiwe Group

texts.fr: AYIWIWE est un groupe de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Florence(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans. Florence est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Florence a arrêté l'école au cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Florence vend depuis trois ans, des ustensiles de cuisine et des bijoux par le système de distribution. Florence s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Florence sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AYIWIWE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
AYIWIWE is a group of three friends. The group’s representative is Florence (whose hand is raised in the photo). Florence is 35 years old and married to a man named Didier. The couple have three dependent children who go to school. Florence lives with her husband and their children. The couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Florence left school at the primary level. In order to deal with some of her responsibilities, she started selling kitchen utensils and jewelry three years ago through the distribution system. She buys her stock in Benin and in Togo. 

Eager to meet her customers’ needs, increase her working capital and strengthen her business, Florence is seeking a first loan from ALIDé together with the other members of AYIWIWE. This credit will help them to better meet customer demand and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 46 years old, married and blessed with six children.  She used to farm crops to earn a living, but now she practices dairy farming.  She has been in the business for over ten years and has employed one person. She also relies on her husband for financial support.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Janet has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business.  She has also learned new farming methods from her group members. She needs a loan of 72,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Marisol; La socia tiene 26 años de edad, La socia es soltera; la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,ella vende joyas en plata como aretes,collares y pulseras,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar joyas como aretes,pulseras y collares.

 La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member's name is Marisol, she is 26 years old and single. The member still works in the business of selling handicrafts, she sells silver jewellery like earrings, necklaces and bracelets. 

Through her business, the member wants to get ahead and expand her jewellery sales business.

The member is asking for the loan to buy jewellery like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

The member is grateful for and values the loan received through this channel and is committed to fulfilling her payments within the established period.

loans.use: to buy jewellery like earrings, bracelets and necklaces.

loans.name: William Israel

texts.es:
William, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación del techo de su vivienda y otra parte para la educación de sus hijos,
Él ha tenido buena experiendia en los préstamos anteriores, le ayudaron mucho pues logro las metas que tenia y pudo sacar adelante a su familia. Su vehiculo esta en buenas condiciones con la reparacion que le realizo, espera continuar de esta manera trabajando con la institucion.
texts.en: William has decided to take out a new loan to invest in the repair of the roof on his home and in his children's education.  He has had a good experience with his previous loans; they helped him a lot as he was able to reach the goals he set and he was able to get his family ahead.  His car is in good condition thanks to the repairs he made on it and he hopes to be able to keep working with this institution.

loans.use: to repair the roof on his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Sandro Alexander

texts.es:
Sandro Alexander en todo un luchador, tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, Sandro es muy carismáticos, en sus tiempos libres disfruta de escuchar música ya que nos comenta que le ayuda despejarse de los problemas o cuando se encuentra de mal humor, le gusta mucho un platillo típico de nuestro país llamado “Ají de Gallina”, (consiste en el pollo desmenuzado el cual se cocina en un aderezo base de ají amarillo licuado, pan humedecido en leche), Sandro solo pudo estudiar hasta quinto de secundaria debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padre y desde joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para poder apoyarlos; pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica Automotriz.

Sandro trabaja conduciendo una mototaxi, realiza esta labor alrededor de 10 horas diarias, con mucho esfuerzo, en especial en esta temporada de verano, donde el calor es muy sofocante,el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy respetuoso con sus clientes y porque hay mucha necesidad de parte de los pobladores por movilizarse.

Sandro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá realizar los trámites para obtener su licencia de conducir, con ello podrá brindarle mayor seguridad a sus clientes y evitar que tengan infracciones de parte de la autoridad policial y así tener más ingresos para ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño:”Tener una mototaxi propia ya que actualmente la que conduce es alquilada”
texts.en:
Sandro Alexander is a fighter.  He is 36 years old and lives in the city of Ica, Peru.  Sandro is very charismatic.  In his free time he enjoys listening to music because, as he tells us, it helps him clear his mind of problems, or when he is in a bad mood.  He very much likes a typical dish of our country called Ají de Gallina [spicy pepper chicken] (shredded chicken cooked in a sauce made of yellow pepper liquefied with milk-soaked bread).  Sandro was only able to study up to the fifth year of secondary school because of his parents' limited economic resources, and from a young age he needed to work to be able to help them, but he would have enjoyed studying auto mechanics.

Sandro works driving a motorcycle taxi.  He does this job about ten hours a day, with great effort, especially in this summer season when the heat is suffocating.  He believes that it is going well for him in his business because he is very respectful with his customers and because there is a lot of need for the residents to get around.

Sandro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their support he will be able to fulfill the procedures to get his driver's license, with which he will be able to give his customers greater security and avoid infractions from the police authorities.  In this way he will have more income to save and achieve his biggest dream, to have his own motorcycle taxi because the one he currently drives is rented.

loans.use: to get his driver's license.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 38 years old, married, and has three children. To earn a living, he grows and sells flowers. He has been in the business for over ten years. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.

George hopes to have a good supply of water on his farm. Hence he has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a water tank and water pump.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and water pumps

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 32-year-old housewife who looks after her household and six children. 

Her husband has been a taxi driver by profession for six years. He works hard to make ends meet. Recently, he repaired the taxi, but the cost incurred is more then they can afford with the current income. 

In order to pay off these expenses, they need funds which is not possible with the current income. Since they are unable to pay for the expenses, Samina has decided to apply for a loan to help her husband pay for the repairs. 

Samina is hopeful that this loan will help them overcome the money shortage. Her husband will be able to pay for the microfinance loan timely in easy installments. 

She is thankful to Kiva and its partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for taxi repairs

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Tharn is now 61 years old and married. She has five children. Tharn and her husband have been raising pigs and selling grocery items. The current business earns her about 77,000KHR per day. 
Tharn is the first cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to seek for a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on buying pig feeds. She hopes to earn more crops and fatten pigs so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Meryem

texts.en:
Meryem is married and a mother of three.  She is using her fourth loan.  She is knitting, making bags ornaments from felt and making a contribution to the family budget.  With the help of the loand she is buying bulks of felt, beads and threads and selling her products from home or on the stands.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Meryem hanım evli ve üç çocuk annesi.  4.kredisini kullanan Meryem Hanım örgü örerek, keçeden çanta ve süs eşyası yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Aldığı krediler ile keçe boncuk ip alarak üretim yapıyor, bu ürünleri evde ve tezgâhta satıyor.

loans.use: to buy felt, beads and thread

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia, a mother of 2, operates a General Store from her home. She sells a variety of products and goods. She has indicated her willingness to relocate due to the rapid expansion of her business. She has been trained in the business development principles of Kraban under the TEACH lending program.

loans.use: Storage Equipment - Refrigerator

loans.name: Maria Guillermina

texts.en:
María is married and her husband cannot continue working because he is ill. Because both of them are elderly, and it is impossible for them to find jobs, their children used to help them with the household expenses. However, when they got married, it was almost impossible for them to continue helping their parents. This is how María came to sell shoes in the town of San Nicolás de los Garza, in the state of Nuevo León.

Her number of clients has increased since she began her business and she has worked hard to provide for herself and her husband. Right now she has many orders for shoes, since the new season is starting, and she doesn’t have sufficient capital to fill them. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of $200.00. Now is the time to help someone who is in need; have no doubts, the power to help is in your hands.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María es una mujer casada, su esposo por motivo de enfermedad no puede seguir trabajando, debido a la edad avanzada de los dos y la imposibilidad de encontrar un empleo, sus hijos los apoyaban con los gastos de la casa y de la alimentación de ellos, pero cuando se casaron les fue casi imposible continuar ayudando a sus padres. De esta manera es como hace tres años, en la localidad de San Nicolás de los Garza del estado de Nuevo León, doña María se dedica a la venta de zapatos.

Los clientes que ella tiene se han incrementado desde que inició y se ha esforzado para conseguir el sustento de ella y de su esposo, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos por la entrada de la nueva temporada y no cuenta con capital suficiente para surtirlos, por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, no lo dudes más, en tus manos está el poder hacerlo.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gulchekhra

texts.en: Gulchekhra M. has no education, and was a housewife for many years. In 1994, she started her business with selling perfume.  Her last loan was used for adding other kinds of goods. When she goes to buy more goods, her children sell at her workplace. Her husband is unemployed, but he helps her with the housework. Now they are reconstructing their house. Her current loan request will be used to install shelves, as she has expanded the assortment of her goods, and she needs to make her workplace more functional.

loans.use: Activity extension

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
“My house has very little protection and I would like to build a wall and install extra protection all around, for the security of my children more than anything, but also to keep anyone from coming in to steal.” I’m asking for $1,000 to build a wall and install extra protection.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa esta muy desprotegida y me gustaría construir una barda y poner protecciones alrededor más que nada por la seguridad de mis hijos y para evitar que alguien pueda entrar a robar”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para levantar una barda y poner protecciones.

loans.use: Build a wall and install extra protection.

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Allahverediyeva Naile. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now she lives in the city of Sumqayit. She is 50 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is a business woman. She sells women's shoes in the market. 

In 2004, Naile borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded her business by buying more shoes. The next time, she borrowed $600 and repaired her business premises which increased the number of clients and her income. She buys her inventory from the Baku Airport wholesale market, making purchasing trips three times a month.

Currently, she needs a $1000 loan. With this loan Naile will to expand her business premises and buy modern styles of men and women's shoes. She believes that this change will increase her monthly income help her provide for necessary family consumption needs. 
Naile thinks this expansion will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months. Naile will repay her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to expand her business of selling modern styles of shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase his stock.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa, 52, is a mother and is separated from her husband. With much effort and dedication she has succeeded in motivating her two children, and thanks to her commitment they are now professionals and independent. Her business in the sale of beverages (sodas, juices and beer) gave her the opportunity to make ends meet and offer her children well-being while they were still in her home.

Ninfa’s wish is to prosper with her small establishment and is requesting a loan to expand and implement her premises. Ninfa promises to repay the loan in a 6-month term and thanks you in advance for your kind collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ninfa D. 52 años D. edad, es madre separada, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado impulsar a sus dos hijos y gracias a su empeño ellos son independientes y profesionales.Su actividad D. venta D. bebidas (gaseosas, jugos y cervezas), le dió la oportunidad D. salir adelante y ofrecerles bienestar a sus hijos menores mientras estaban en su seno familiar.El deseo D. doña Ninfa es prosperar con su pequeño establecimiento y solicita un préstamo para ampliar e implementar sus instalaciones.Doña Ninfa se compromete en reembolsarles el préstamo en un lapso D. seis meses y agradece anticipadamente tu gentil colaboración.

loans.use: Expansion and implementation of her business establishment.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old. He is married and has two small children. His elderly mother and young sister live with him in a rented house. His mother is elderly and sick.

He has a car, and he applied to borrow $1000 to purchase a new engine for it and some spare parts to fix it. He wants to use it as a taxi in order to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new engine

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a 21 year old young lady who's very talented and a hard worker. She learn how to sew from her cousin, Ninfa. Since Delia is a quick learner, she decided to use her skills for a living. She currently has her own workshop where she makes beautiful and artistic vests and sweaters which she then sells at whole prices in the city of Desaguadero.

Due to the sucess of this business, she has been able to contribute to the family financially and help her parents pay for tuition for her younger sibblings. This lovely young lady dreams of one day having the biggest arts/crafts workshop in her native city of Juliaca. In order to satisfy her clients' demands, she decided to purchase sewing machines and hire 2 workers. She realized that this wasn't enough to satisfy demand since she still needs to buy a great quantity and variety of wool. This is why she's requesting your help!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Delia, es una muchacha de 21 años, ella es una afanosa y talentosa joven que aprendió el bello arte de tejer de su prima Ninfa quien muy complacientemente le transmitió sus conocimientos, gracias a su habilidad e interés la llevaron a poner en práctica rápidamente sus conocimientos adquiridos.Actualmente pese a su corta edad cuenta con su propio taller de tejidos en donde elabora hermosas y novedosas chompas y chalecos que luego los distribuye al por mayor en la ciudad de Desaguadero; su desempeño en esta actividad le está permitiendo cubrir los gastos económicos de su familia y apoyar a sus padres en la educación de sus hermanos menores. El deseo de esta adorable muchacha es convertir su taller en una de las más grandes fábricas de tejidos de su ciudad natal Juliaca. Al observar que tenía una gran cantidad de solicitudes decidió comprar máquinas de coser y contratar a dos colaboradores, pero eso no es suficiente para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, requiere adquirir gran variedad de lana para la confección de sus chompas, con ese fin recurre a ti en búsqueda de tu importante ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase basic material for the making of clothing made out of wool

loans.name: Holniyoz.

texts.ru:
Holniyoz A. lives in Yavan. He is 45 years old and is married with 3 children. Holniyoz has a high school education and raises animals for sale that are then used for meat. He purchases animals at the local market, feeds them for 30-40 days and sells them at a profit. He has been in this business for 15 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. In addition, the expansion of the livestock business provides local markets with fresh meat. Holniyoz will use his loan to purchase young sheep and goats. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Акрамов Холниез проживает в городе.Возраст 45 лет . Женат имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит мелко-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо. Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 30-40 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 15 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом.Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых овец и коз. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase goats and sheep

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has always been a very responsible woman. Despite the difficulties she has faced in life, she has never given up on moving forwards with her two children, who are her reason to live. This selfless mother currently lives with her children in a small, rented house in the city of Juliaca, which is where she decided to set up her small grocery store. Thanks to the range of products and, above all, to the good service she offers, she managed to gain a set of regular customers within a very short period of time. Her customers are now asking her to enlarge her store so that she can offer other products such as fruit and vegetables. With this project in mind, Antonia is coming back to ask if you can grant her the loan to turn her project into a reality.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Antonia siempre ha demostrado ser una madre muy responsable, pese a los momentos difíciles que le ha tocado enfrentar en la vida, nunca ha perdido la esperanza de seguir adelante junto a sus 2 hijos quienes son la razón de su vida. Esta Abnegada madre actualmente vive junto a sus hijos en una pequeña casita alquilada en la ciudad de Juliaca, lugar donde decidió abrir e implementar poco a poco su bodeguita de abarrotes, gracias a la variedad de productos que ofrece y sobre todo a la buena atención que brinda en corto tiempo logró obtener asiduos clientes, clientes que ahora le solicitan ampliar su tiendita para ofrecer otros productos como verduras y frutas.Con ese proyecto en mente doña Antonia recurre a ti a fin de solicitarte un préstamo y posibilitar su proyecto.

loans.use: Increase in working capital to expand the range of products.

loans.name: Yajaira Altagracia

texts.en:
Yajaira Altagracia, an ambitious and hard-working woman, lives in the Trinitarios community of San Cristobal, where she runs a small store. She has two daughters and one son, all of them toddlers. Yajaira’s husband works for a construction company.

Yajaira says that two years ago she started a business selling makeup, perfumes, deodorants, body lotions, and the like. Until now, the entrepreneur has run the business from home, but she plans on saving money so that she can rent a store front soon.

With her loan, Yajaira will expand and diversify her stock to attract new clients. The entrepreneur wants to have enough money to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy perfume, makeup, and lotions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy assorted beauty products and perfumes for a small business.

loans.name: Silia

texts.en:
Silia F., 56, is married with seven children.

She has many years of experience in the shop business. She sells to the villagers and public six days per week.

She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD).

SPBD loans are Silia’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer, sacks of sugar, rice and salt, lamp chops and chicken thighs.

loans.name: Ni Putu Dian

texts.id:
Putu Dian is famous in her village as expert in Banten (items for Hindu prayer) although her age is still young. Expertise was obtained from her parents who is also in the business. Initially she only helped her mother, however after marriage she started the business to assist husband's income. With capital limitation, Putu Dian could only prepare these prayer items on daily basis. If there were a big order, usually it is done with her parents and other friends in the surrounding. To bridge the capital limitation, Putu Dian requested a loan to Lempek organization in her village, Lempek was grown by Dinari foundation. From here Putu Dian obtained the additional capital and also several guidance from Dinari Foundation. The loan obtained is used to buy raw materials, like coconut leaves, bamboo and other needs. From this Putu Dian could expand her business and assist in adding family income.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Putu Dian terkenal di desanya sebagi tukang Banten ( sarana persembahyangan umat Hindu ) walaupun usainya masih muda. Pengalaman ini didapat dari orang tuanya yang juga berusaha dagang seperti itu. Pada mulanya hanya sekedar membantu membatu ibunya, tapi setelah menikah mulailah usaha ini ditekuninya sebagai usaha yang dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya. Dengan keterbatasan modalnya maka Putu Dian membuat sarana sembahyang harian saja. Jika ada pesanan untuk persembahyangan skala besar, biasanya dikerjakan bersama orang tuanya dan beberapa temannya yang ada disekitarnya. Untuk mengatasi kekurangan modal usahanya, Putu Dian mengajukan pinjaman dana pada Lembaga Tempek yang ada didesanya yang sudah menjadi Tempek binaan Yayasan Dinari. Dari sinilah Putu Dian mendapatkan modal tambahan dan berbagai pembinaan yang diberikan oleh yayasan Dinari. Pinjaman yang didapatnya digunakan untuk membeli bahan baku, seperti daun kelapa, bambu dan keperluan lainnya. Dari usaha inilah Putu Dian dapat mengembangkan usahnya dan dapat membantu menambah penghasilan dalam keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy raw material (Membeli bahan baku)

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La Señora Vilma, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, vive en la región y  provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, perfumería, pasamanería y artículos de regalos. Ya tiene bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Los Andes Nº 636 donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes, los cuales son mayormente los vecinos del su barrio.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 6  meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, juguetes, sandalias entre otros, y de esa manera surtir bien el negocio y que los clientes encuentren lo que buscan. 

Vilma, a sus 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora, carismática y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando con el negocio porque le gusta lo que hace. Quiere darles una profesión a sus hijos y su meta es comprar una vitrina para poner los productos de regalos y seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Vilma, and associate of the community bank "Las Moralinas", lives in the region and province of San Martin, district of Morales. She sells groceries, perfumes, braids and fringes and gifts. She has been in this business for some time and is doing well. The business is located at her residence, Jr. Los Andes No.636, where her customers come shopping daily. most of whom are her neighbors.

With the loan of USD$275, which she will repay in six months, she will buy basic products such as rice, sacks of sugar, milk, oil. preserves in various sized containers, toys, sandals and others, this way she will stock her store well so that her customers can find what they are looking for.

Vilma, at 38 years of age, is a hard working woman, charismatic and with a great desire to continue her work at her business because she likes what she does. She wants to provide for a profession for her children and her goal is to buy a display case to show her gift products and continue to grow her business.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, oil, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Muth

texts.en:
Muth S., 38, is married and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, with five of her children. She raises ducks for eggs and makes approximately US $1.50 each day. Her husband makes US $1.50 working as a teacher in the school village. (He is pictured in the duck field.) They are also supported by two of their children who are employed as garment factory workers.

Inflation has made prices soar lately in Cambodia, and Muth S. wants to expand her business to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase duck food and raise more ducks. She sees this loan as a great economic opportunity and believes that she can raise her standard of living through her careful investment.

loans.use: To raise more ducks and purchase duck food.

loans.name: Simul

texts.en: Mrs. Simul Y. lives in the Poek village in the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. She is the 39-year-old mother of two children, who are attending the local school. She breeds pigs, and she owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sok Sarom, is a farmer (pictured on the left). The productivity of his land has been affected by poor soil and the plantation is not going well. Thus, Mrs. Simul Y. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the soil to make the crops more productive.

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to improve the soil to make crops more productive

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Kossi est né le 7 février 1975 à Tchekpo dedekpoe, une des villes du Togo.  Il est célibataire et il n’a pas d’enfant.  Il est chauffeur à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Il a commencé ce commerce depuis 2000 et il a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine. 
Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter un autre bus.  Avec ce nouveau véhicule il pourra mieux servir ses passagers et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Kossi A. was born on Februrary 7, 1975 in Tchekpo Dedekpoe, a city in Togo. Unmarried and without children, he is a chauffeur in Agoè, a district north of Lomé, the capital of Togo. He started this business in 2000 and has a lot of experience in this field. The initial loan he is requesting will enable him to buy another bus. With this new vehicle, he'll be able to serve his passengers better and to realize a large profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bus

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave”, del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno. Es casada y madre de 2 hijos que mantiene económicamente. Sonia nos cuenta que es el primer préstamo que solicita y lo hizo para ayudar a su hija. Tiene un mes trabajando con el banco comunal. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cocinas.
Con este préstamo de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará mercadería para vender en navidad.
Sonia desea continuar trabajando para que su hija culmine sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the community bank “Víctor Echave”, in the district, province and department of Puno. She is married and the mother of 2 children whom she supports. Sonia told us that this is her first loan and that she is borrowing in order to help her daughter. She has been a member of the community bank for 1 month. She buys and sells stoves. With this S/. 500 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy merchandise to sell during the holidays. Sonia wants to continue working so that her daughter can finish her university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stoves.

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es: Don Donald, tiene 44 años de edad, casado, y reside en Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua,  su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 11,13 y 14 años de edad,  que estudian, ella trabaja en ventas, el Sr. Donald se desempeña de electricista industrial desde hace veinte años, el inicio como ayudante lo cual con el tiempo adquirió conocimiento y ahora  trabaja por cuenta propia, lo cual sus ingresos son mejores. Con la solicitud que esta haciendo en Afodenic es para invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un muro frontal de su vivienda y la compra del portón principal para estar con un poco de seguridad ante los antisociales, y para poder disfrutar de las mejoras con su familia. Sus planes a corto plazo es captar más clientes y así poder generar mejores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Donald C. is a 44-year-old married man who lives in Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. He and his wife have three children ages 11, 13 and 14 who are still in school. His wife works in retail, while he has been working as an industrial electrician for twenty years. He started out as an apprentice and over time, he was able to acquire skills. He is now self-employed, which means that his income is greater. He will invest the loan that he is requesting from Afodenic in building a protective wall in front of his house and buying the main door so that he can safeguard his family from any delinquents. His short-term goals are to bring in more customers so that the can generate more profits for his family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build protective wall

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.es: La joven emprendedora Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez tiene 25 años, está soltera, tiene un hijo quien tiene la edad de 7 años. Por lo que en estos momentos está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresa ya que en sus planes esta el saber administrar de buena forma su negocio. La actividad económica de la joven Darling es la venta de cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes y pinturas de uñas entre otros. Su sueño es de emprender su propia empresa ya que la experiencia que ha obtenido le ha otorgado la confianza necesaria. El préstamo que solicita es de C$ 6.000 córdobas a un plazo de 6 meses.
texts.en:
Darling Aracely Rodríguez Martínez is a young entrepreneur. She is 25 years old, single and has a seven-year-old son. She is currently studying business administration since she plans on knowing how to manage her business well. Young Darling works selling cosmetics such as powders, creams, perfumes and nail polishes among other things. Her dream is to start her own business since her experience has given her the confidence she needs. She is applying for a loan of 6.000 Córdobas in a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rouen

texts.en:
S. is 30 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has three children; all of them are students. She is married to Duch, 28, who is a local construction foreman with a net income of US$ 3. S. has owned a grocery store for more than two years and she can earn US$ 4 per day.

In her store, she also sells gasoline retail to the commune. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. Recently S. has plans to increase her income from this business. So she is taking a loan of US$ 1000 to buy more products for her store and enlarge her store's building.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store and rebuild her store

loans.name: Bakhadur

texts.en:
Bakhadur A. is a 31-year-old, married father of 2 children. He provides for his family with the revenue generated by the store he owns, where he sells plates and dishes of the oriental style which are very popular among young ladies who are gathering dowry.

He is requesting a loan of $1225 USD for the term of 15 months to increase the stock of goods available at his store. Bakhadur is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and supporting his children's efforts to get good educations. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will ensure the success of his small business.

loans.use: To expand the variety of plates and dishes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. O. is 50 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and cooking utensils like plates, cooking pots, etc. She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more drinks and cooking utensils to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy F. has been engaged in the business of buying and selling beauty products and cosmetics since the past five years. She lives in Pag-asa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She puts on display her fashion products during the market days in her village and in the neighboring town. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her business. As of now, she limits her display only to nearby towns owing to expensive transportation fare. Hence, she plans to buy a multicab to help her move around to other towns to display her stock.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of combs, cosmetics, wallets, hairclips, lotions, mirrors, etc

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: MAGUETTE D. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DANS LA ZONE DE CAMBERENE DEPUIS LONGTEMPS ET OPERE DANS LE DOMAINE DE LA FRIPPERIE.ELLE DESIRE AUGMENTER SON FOND DE ROULEMENT POUR MIEUX DEVELOPPER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Maguette D. has been a member in the Camberene zone for a long time and sells used clothing. She would like to add to her working capital so as to be able to develop her business better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
La señora Yrene C. L. tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
Yrene se dedica a la venta de comida y sandalias, inicio su negocio vendiendo comida en el mercado hace 25 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en el mercado de Bellavista.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Bellavista  II, lo invirtió en la compra de carnes y verduras (carne de carnero, gallina, repollo, cebolla, etc.) para preparar la comida.
El crédito de 500 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sandalias, zapatillas y ropa interior para implementar su puesto de ropa.
Yrene tiene como sueño tener su tienda de ropa  para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Yrene C. L. is 54 years old, and lives in the district of Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school and has one child who depends on her economically. For the past 25 years, Yrene has run a business selling food and sandals in the market in Bellavista. Yrene received her first loan of 300 soles from the community bank Bellavista II, and invested that money in the purchase of meats and vegetables (ram meat, chicken, cabbage, onion, etc.) so that she could prepare meals from those ingredients. She will invest this loan of 500 soles in the purchase of sandals, slippers, and underwear in order to expand the clothing items that she offers. Yrene dreams of having a clothing store in order to keep growing as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of clothing items

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Felly is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Felly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Felly has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Felly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is married to Patricio D., a village farmer, and they are blessed with two children, Cristel and Chrichelle. Brenda believes that by joining the Kiva loan program, she will be able to expand her general store business in her village of Barangay, Manano, Mallig, Isabela. With the income from her store, Brenda is able to help her husband provide for their daily needs at home, especially for their children.

Brenda would like to borrow the amount of 6000 PHP from Kiva partner, ASKI, to have sufficient capital to develop her store and increase her daily income. Her two children are already in college and so Brenda and her husband need to double their efforts to cope with their children's tuition fees and some other needs in school. The couple make big sacrifices and they hope that Kiva lenders will be of great help in terms of their financial needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Catherine's Group

texts.en: A. Catherine is the leader of Khaki group in Jinja. She is 38 years old and a married mother of five children, including two sets of twins. She is a business lady involved in a drug shop business that is located in Lira District. There she employs a nurse to run the business as she buys the necessary drugs twice every month and sends them on a bus. Here in Jinja, she works as an employee in a boat-making workshop. This is her sixth loan and the previous ones have helped in paying school fees and enabling her to save for the future. She needs to buy more drugs for her drug shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her drug shop.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.es:
La señora CRESENCIA J. I., tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir  , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS 
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 6to de Secundaria  , tiene 5 hijos de y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
CRESENCIA se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como: talcos, cremas, colonias, labiales, etc
Su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas productos de belleza .
Este crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá  en la compra de mas productos de belleza y empezará a realizar sus campañas desde la 1era semana de septiembre ya que por motivos  salud dejo de vender.
 CRESENCIA  sueña con incrementar su ventas y comprar vitrinas para colocar los productos en su domicilio y  vender con mayor frecuencia y facilidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Cresencia Jerónimo I. is 50 years old and lives in the District of Porvenir, Province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad - Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas”.

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 6th year of secondary school. She has 5 adult children.

Cresencia sells beauty products such as talcum powders, crèmes, colognes, lipsticks, etc. Her first loan in the amount of 300 soles was used to purchase these products.

She is requesting another loan of 300 soles to purchase additional beauty products in time for the start of her company’s sales promotion that begins the first week of September. Sra. Cresencia is already motivated to sell more products because of health reasons.

She dreams of increasing her sales and purchasing a display case for storing her products at home so that she can sell them more frequently and easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina M. is engage in vending of goods such as under wears, blouses, t-shirts, pants and other goods for both men and women. She has been five years engage in the business. She desires her business to become more profitable for her to provide the needs of her two children who are both studying. Martina is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP7, 000 to have additional capital in purchasing new batch of goods to continuously have profit.

	Martina indulged herself in retailing business because she wanted to help her husband in making profit for their family. Her husband is a wood carver. She is glad because he is also working hard just to support their children’s studies. Their eldest is already studying in college and she needs a lot of money for her tuition fees and allowance. Their youngest child is now in her third year high school and soon she will be entering college. Martina wants to be prepared always for the education of their children and she is dreaming for them to finish their studies. She hopes that all their aspirations will soon be attained with their diligence in working.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y desea que su familia mejore sus condiciones de vida. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, ella considera que en los diez años que tiene como promotora de ventas han mejorado sus ingresos económicos debido a la diversidad de líneas de belleza a las que se integró para ofrecer a las personas variedad de productos con precios accesibles. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los regalos que le otorgan por la cantidad de ventas que tiene cada quincena, pero lo difícil está en realizar las cobranzas a sus clientas para no retrazarse en sus pagos, pues de esto depende la entrega de sus premios. Para un futuro cercano, Susana desea tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus productos de belleza junto a otros objetos para el hogar.  
Con los dos mil soles de crédito que solicita invertirá en la compra de más productos que estén en oferta para incrementar su stock.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Chrech

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrech C., 44, and her husband, Mr. Keo Um, 43, have been married since 1984 and have 5 children: 3 sons and 2 daughters. Four of them have full-time employments and another one attends school. They are living in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chrech and her husband sell fruits in Phnom Penh. The couple wants to expand their business, they will able to earn much income as well. So, Chrech is applying for a loan of US$100 to purchase additional fruits for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits for resale.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.fr: H. Laurence est née en 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est depuis douze ans que Laurence vit à Katagon Agaégon à proximité de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Laurence est mariée à GNONLONFOUN Akim et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Laurence a deux autres enfants à sa charge, en plus de ses deux enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le  couple. Laurence n’a jamais été à l’école ; et il y a douze ans déjà que Laurence mène comme activité, la préparation de l’huile de palme et de la boisson alcoolisée locale communément appelée Sodabi. Laurence fait ses emplettes au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo et à Cotonou. C’est à son domicile et au marché Ouando qu’elle vend ses produits. Laurence a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, deux crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Afin d’augmenter sa production pour mieux servir sa clientèle, Laurence sollicite un troisième crédit. Laurence ambitionne plus tard acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
Laurence H. was born in 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living for twelve years in Katagon Agaégon, near Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is the wife of Akim Gnonlonfoun and the mother of two children who both attend school. Laurence cares for two other children, in addition to her own two children. The parents provide together for their family.

Laurence never went to school. Twelve years ago she began to produce palm oil and sodabi, a local alcoholic drink. Laurence gets her supplies at Ouando market in Porto-Novo and in Cotonou. She sells her products at home and at Ouando market. She received already two loans from Alidé, which she repaid on schedule. Laurence applies for her third loan to increase her production and better serve her customers. Her ambition is to buy later her own plot of land.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Top buy sugar and palm nuts

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty M. S. is a small business owner. She runs a poultry business in Tabata community, Dar es Salaam. She has 800 layers in her poultry cages. She collects ten trays of eggs per day and sells both wholesale and retail. Betty is a married woman with four school children. One is in kindergarten, two are in primary school and one is in secondary school. She meets her daily family demands and pays school fees with her business income. She plans to increase the size of her business by buying more poultry chicks. She needs a loan of 800,000 Tanzanian shillings to boost up the business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ANTONIETA F. Y., tiene  26 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios superiores (incompletos) en educación ya que por falta de recursos económicos dejó los estudios para empezar a trabajar, tiene 1 hijo de 2 años quien depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica  a la venta de pescado frito, ceviche , cervezas y gaseosas en su domicilio por las tardes, ya que en las mañana trabaja en el terminal pesquero de Buenos Aires.
Este es su primer crédito, ella requiere 300.00 nuevos soles que lo utilizará para comprar  platos, cubiertos y vasos para su negocio.
texts.en:
MARIA ANTONIETA F. Y., 26, lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II (Enterprising Women II) communal bank. She didn't quite finish secondary school for lack of funds to pay for studies and started working. She has a two-year-old son who is dependent on her. She sells fried fish, ceviche (raw fish marinated in lemon and garlic), beer and soft drinks in her home in the afternoons; during the mornings she works at the Buenos Aires fishing terminal. This is her first loan; she needs 300 new soles to buy dishes, cutlery and glasses for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dishes, cutlery and glasses.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El señor Marcelo vive en la calle Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. Marcelo genera sus ingresos a través de un puesto de Internet el cual esta situado en su mismo domicilio.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar  un servidor y de esta manera mejorar el servicio para sus clientes y también estabilizar su fuente de trabajo.

Esta es la primera vez que recurre a Impro para solicitar un crédito; el carácter social  del crédito y el análisis de su flujo de caja lo habilitan para que pueda acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives in his parents’ house on Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Marcelo gets his income from an Internet stand, which is located in his own home. The loan he is asking for is to buy a server. That way he can improve service for his customers and also stabilize his source of work. This is the first time he has asked Impro for a loan. His good character and the analysis of his cash flow allow him to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a server for his Internet stand

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
Abduvahob Y. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children. 

Abduvahob has been breeding cattle for more than 12 years. He is trying to improve the breed in order to increase his prices. He invests time and money in the feed and medicines that the animals require. He enjoys this work. Above all, he enjoys getting milk from his cows, which he sells in local markets. 

Abduvahob keeps going thanks to the help and enthusiasm of his children and his wife, who help him care for the animals. Now Abduvahob needs a loan of 3,500 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to purchase more cattle in order to expand his business. With your help this will be possible.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Ngwa

texts.en:
Ngwa S. is a widowed mother of seven currently living in Ntasen, Cameroon.  Ngwa S. is currently requesting her eighth loan from GHAPE.  She has been with GHAPE since 2000 and has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, consistent attendance at meetings and support of her borrowing group.  

With this latest loan, Ngwa S. is hoping to continue the business practices supported by her prior loans.  She has requested 500,000 CFA in order to purchase a few pigs, feed for her pigs, and a fence to keep her livestock.  She will also be using the funds to purchase chickens and feed for her chickens.  She believes that her business will succeed because of her experience working in this industry.  She is confident in the expertise she has gained after years of refining her trade.  

Ngwa S. hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for the various needs of her family.  As the sole provider for her family of eight, Ngwa S. hopes to increase her profits in order to have enough to provide her family with sufficient nourishment and hopefully put some of her funds in savings.  

Ngwa S.’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy pigs, chickens, feed and a fence

loans.name: Martin

texts.es: Don Martin de 54 años de edad es soltero, tiene 4 hijos: Ana Gabriela de 14 años, un par de gemelos de 13 años Paulino y Martin y el menor Darling de 12 años, todos estudiando; Martin trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 20 años como operario de limpieza, esta solicitando su 1er credito para mejorar su casa cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, poniendo perlines para que sean mas duraderos. Espera lograr con el apoyo de kiva para la realizacion de este proyecto, ya que desea llevarlo a cabo antes que llegue el invierno.
texts.en:
Martin, 54, is single and has four children: Ana Gabriela, 14, a pair of 13-year-old twins, Paulino and Martin, and the youngest, Darling, 12. All the children are in school. Martin has worked as a maintenance man for the Juigalpa's Mayor's office for the last 20 years. He is requesting his first loan to replace the roof on his house because it is in poor condition. He wants to install metal sheeting that is longer-lasting. He hopes to have Kiva's support to complete this project because he wants to finish it before Winter arrives.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a new roof.

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en:
Afolabi is 40 years old; she is married with four children who are all doing well in school. She and her husband hope to give their children a better education. Her husband does motor repairs and works very hard to provide for the family. Afolabi sells household items like plates, cups, pots, spoons, plastic buckets, and more. With the income from the business she assists her husband in providing for some basic family needs like food, clothing, school fees etc.

She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more items to sell. Afolabi thanks all lenders for their support

loans.use: To purchase more household items such as plates, cups, pots, spoons, and plastic buckets to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling charcoal

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella A. is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. 

Stella has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation, a Kiva partner). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

She sells baby things, clothes, shoes and bags. She has been in this business for a long time and she hopes to expand her business. Stella is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: S. Delphine est née le 20 Novembre 1976 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à GUEDOU Bertin, Delphine a trois enfants à charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec le couple au quartier Agontinkon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a trois ans que Delphine s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et apporter un appui financier à son mari, Delphine vend des tissus (bazins, hitarget, etc.) ainsi que des costumes par le système de distribution. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo que Delphine se ravitaille. Delphine voudrait rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre aux multiples exigences de sa clientèle. C'est pour cette raison que Delphine sollicite pour une première fois, de prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine S. was born on 20 November 1976 at Ouidah, a historic city in Benin. Married to Bertin Gouedou, Delphine is responsibile for three children, all of whom are educated and live with the couple in the Agontinkon neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Delphine moved to this neighborhood three years ago. The couple work together to take care of the family. In order to take care of her needs and to bring financial support to her husband, Delphine sells typical African-style cloth (such as Bazins, Hitarget) and suits through the distribution system. She stocks up on materials in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and at Lomé in Togo. Delphine would like to increase the level of her activity and respond better to the multiple demands of her clients. It is for this reason that Delphine is soliciting, for the first time, a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cloth

loans.name: Gazwan

texts.en: Gazwan has worked as a van driver for the past 10 years. He is a 36-year-old married man who has three children. He and his family live in the Bekaa Valley. He offers his transportation services in his town and its surroundings. Gazwan has been a microcredit client for seven years and has always paid on time. Today, once again, he is requesting a new loan to carry out maintenance work on his van to increase its safety features and to save money for his children's school tuition.

loans.use: To do mainenance work on his van.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags to sell

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mi esposa y yo nos hemos esforzado mucho para darles a nuestros hijos una buena casa y al parecer lo hemos logrado, pero debido a las intensas lluvias el techo se ha deteriorado un poco y es por eso que solicito su ayuda para poder repararlo asi como también me gustaría colocar una barda en el patio trasero. Agradecería mucho su apoyo
texts.en:
My wife and I have worked hard to give a good home to our children and we seem to have succeeded. But, owing to the heavy rains, the roof has deteriorated a little, and it is for this reason that I am asking for help to be able to repair it. I would also like to put a fence in the back yard. I would be very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair and putting up a fence

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Vivian W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 31 years old, single and has three children whose ages range from 1 to 14. She is a college graduate. She also cares for two siblings. 

For 13 years, she has been selling slippers, underclothes and garments at the Fiamah Market in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 17,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 84,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more slippers, underclothes and garments. She describes herself as a peaceful person. Her goal is to improve her business, make more profit and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more slippers, underclothes and garments

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. M. A. Maria del Pilar vive en camino grande perteneciente al distrito de Tate. Tiene un hijo a su cargo. Es madre soltera y trabaja como operaria de producción en el fundo IQF del Perú desde hace 3 años. La Sra Maria tiene casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. Su sueño es poder terminar su casa y así poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra. M. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Munante A. Maria del Pilar lives on Camino Grande in the Tate district. She has a child to care for. She is a single mother and has worked as a production operator in Peru's IQF farm for 3 years. Maria has her own home, and is working on its finishing touches. She is requesting this loan to finish her home in order to be able to offer her child a better quality of life. Her dream is to finish her home and thus offer her family a better quality of life. Munante is grateful for the support that we can offer her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es comerciante, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende al por menor todos sus productos, como ser: arroz, fideo, azúcar, dulces, refrescos, y otros.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra abarrotes, dulces, galletas, refrescos, y otros)
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde diciembre del 2008, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is a merchant, and has a grocery store in her home where she sells a variety of products at retail, such as: rice, noodles, sugar, candies, and refreshments, along with other items. Her home is located in the Irpavi zone of the city of La Paz. The loan would be designated as working capital (to purchase groceries, candies, cookies, beverages, and other items). She has worked with Impro for a while, since December of 2008, and her history qualifies her as a top client. That is to say, she has fulfilled her payment obligations, which allows her access to additional credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products at wholesale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
" What you plant, you will harvest". That is being said by Dante M., who is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 60 years old. Dante is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Dante owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Dante has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Dante joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Dante has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. He is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Dante from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan J. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in their own ger – a traditional nomadic housing tent. Her husband is a teacher in a middle school while her son goes to a local kindergarten. Bulgan began her shoe trading business in 2009. After two years of hard work, she was able to increase the type and quantity of her products, which she has been selling at a local market called "Ih Buyant".
Bulgan wants to expand her business even further by introducing new product lines from Uvs province, western Mongolia. With these new product lines, she hopes to grow her customer base. She dreams of using her business revenue to own a small retail shop. Bulgan is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase "white-sole boots" at wholesales prices from Uvs province.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.en:
N. Abdumumin is 52 years old. He is married with four children of school age.

Abdumumin is a manufacturer. He produces wooden doors and window frames. His shop is located in his house. By working in the business for eight years, Abdumumin has become a rather experienced master. He now has students to whom he teaches the business.

Because he produces high quality goods at acceptable prices, Abdumumin has many customers. He sells the doors and window frames from his house. There is also a trading place located in the local market.

In general the business is very successful and generates a stable income for his family.

Now, Abdumumin is planning to employ an additional woodworker so he can expand his business. For this reason, he requests 4,500 Somoni.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To employ another worker

loans.name: Kulziga

texts.en:
Kulziga H., 46 years old, lives with her husband and five children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. Her younger two children, aged 17 and 10, both attend a local secondary school, while her husband works as a guard in a kindergarten. Kulziga sells consumer goods at the local market. She also began a small cafe business in 1994 at Turlik market but still has not built a sustainable operation yet. 

Kulziga purchases her products from the local wholesale stores, and her son helps her business during winter months. The business profits have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees. Kulziga, a hardworking and honest person, says, " I want to save more money so that I can establish a new and bigger shop and pay my children's university tuition fees." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan both to purchase more goods at wholesale prices and to help pay for her oldest son's wedding.

loans.use: To purchase more goods at wholesale price

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline N. is twenty-seven years old. She is single and has one child aged eight years old.

Caroline’s business is located at Juja, a very busy business market in Thika, a region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. She has been selling cabbages for the last two years and has provided employment for one employee.

Caroline says that her business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers. Hence, customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Caroline is using her loan of Kes 15,000 to buy more cabbages to meet her customers demand. In the future, she hopes to be a supplier of cabbages in bulk to other towns. She also hopes to purchase a plot and build her own house. She says that she believes she is good in retaining her customers and is willing to really sacrifice her time for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages to sell

loans.name: Alexander Fabricio

texts.es:
Alexander T. Q. tiene 21 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus papas en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. 

Alexander es socio del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Alexander se dedica a criar ganados, en este momento tiene 6 ganados. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en San Miguel y Guaranda cuando estan grandes. 

Solicita el credito para comprar 2 mas terneros. Con el apoyo del préstamo ampliaria los terneros que cria. Su sueno es ser profesional (quiere ser policia). Va a estudiar el proximo ano en la Universidad Bolivar. 

Le gusta jugar el boli y el futbol.
texts.en:
Alexander T. Q., 21, is single and lives with his parents in San Pablo canton, Bolívar province.

He is a member of the Micro enterprising Integration group in San Pablo de Atenas.  It has 14 members total that are in a variety of commercial, business and agricultural activities as means of family support.

Alexander raíces catre.  He currently has six head of cattle.  When they reach development he sells them in San Miguel and in Guaranda.

He is asking for funds to buy two more calves.  With the loan’s help he will increase the number of calves he raises.  

His dream is to become a professional (he wants to be a police officer).  He will enter Bolívar University next year.

He enjoys playing volleyball and soccer.

loans.use: To buy two additional calves.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es: La Sra. Leonarda tiene  34 años vive en la zona del km6 barrio Vajio sur hace 5 años oriunda de departamento Oruro. Su Actividad es confeccionista de ropa por mayor y menor hace 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad en la zona del km6 barrio Vajio sur en su mismo domicilio la señora confecciona para una industria donde entrega semanalmente toda la ropa confeccionada. Su Estado civil  concubina hace 13 años con el señor Ireneo  de actividad chapista en la aduana del municipio de Guarnes, los señores cuentan con 2 hijos una mujercita y un varoncito. La señora se siente muy agradecida con nuestra entidad financiera porque necesitaba comprar una maquina industrial urgente.
texts.en: Señora Leonarda is 34 years old and has lived for the past 5 years in the 6th Kilometer area of South Barrio Vajio in the Department of Oruro.  For the past two years, her main occupation has been wholesale and personal tailoring; conducting her business out of her home.  She sews her clothes for an industry to whom she submits her newly sewn clothes weekly.  She has been involved with the Señor Ireneo for over 13 years, whom is an auto bodyworker for customs in the municipality of Guarnes.  They have two children: a young daughter and a young son.  Señora Leonarda is very grateful for our financial support because she urgently needs to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a un hijo en el caserío La Zaranda, una zona rural del distrito de Pítipo, distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Ferreñafe. La zona se encuentra ubicada a cuarenta y cino minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de viente años a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. El cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo en donde suele sembrar granos como el maíz. Adicionalmente cuenta con algunas cabezas de ganado vacuno de las cuales comercializa la leche que producen.

Actualmente Faustino desea terminar de instalar su cultivo de maíz, por lo que desea terminar de preparar parte de su terreno, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  2000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa realizar su objetivo.

Faustino es una persona que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser alguien trabajador y entregado a su familia. En la zona donde vive, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Faustino is a 54 year old father who lives with his wife and child in the village of La Zaranda, a rural area in the District of Pítipo. This farming district is situated in Ferreñafe Province, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Faustino has worked as a farmer for more than 20 years. He has a small parcel of farmland on which he grows basic grains, such as corn. In addition, he owns a few dairy cows and sells the milk they produce.

At the moment, Faustino wants to finish planting a crop of corn and needs to complete the preparation on part of his land. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can accomplish his goal.

Faustino is a person who has always been known as someone who is a hard worker and dedicates himself to his family. In the area where he lives, the people who know him consider him to be someone who is responsible and trustworthy.

loans.use: Pay expenses related to planting corn

loans.name: Alex Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es la Sr. Alex; el tiene 38 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cuadros, el socio es pintor él se dedica a la pintura ya hace un par de años y a la vez el compra cuadros de otros artistas y lo vende fuera de cusco. 

El  socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como pinceles, pintura de diferentes colores entre otros.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the "Vamos Juntos" communal bank, situated in the district of Cuzco, forming part of the province of Cuzco and the department of Cuzco.
