The partner, Alex, is 38 years old.  He has a live-in partner and two children.  Work for Alex varies every day with his business selling paintings.  He is a painter and has worked at painting for a few years, and at the same time he purchases paintings by other artists and sells them outside Cuzco.

Alex is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials such as paintbrushes and paints in various colours, among other things.

He thanks all those who take part in his dream by this means, and promises to carry out the repayment of his instalments by the deadline set out.

loans.use: The purchase of materials such as paintbrushes and paint in various colours, among other things.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas, de 47 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus seis hijos, de los cuales solo uno es menor y juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. Hace más de 4 años, esta empeñosa mujer se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y de primera necesidad en la tienda instalada en una pieza de su casa. Le gusta mucho su negocio pues es tranquilo, y el horario de atención, es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, le permite realizar sus labores domésticas sin problemas. Cuando debe salir,  su menor hijo le ayuda en la atención o se turnan, o cuando el resto de sus hijos se encuentran disponibles. Además esta muy satisfecha pues obtiene regulares ganancias, ya que su negocio no tiene competencia cercana. Esta muy contenta pues con el tiempo ha logrado surtir muy bien su negocio y ahora puede ofrecer diversidad de productos a sus compradores. Tanbien alquila cuartos en su vivienda lo que le genera ganancias extras. Como es una dama muy empeñosa para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda e implementarla con mayor cantidad de mercadería. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Felicitas tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles, así como gaseosas y cervezas pues por temporada de verano necesita surtir bien su tienda.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 47 years of age, lives in her own home alongside her six children of whom only one is a minor. Together they work every day to get ahead. 

More than four years ago this enterprising woman began selling consumer staples in a store set up in one room of her house. She really enjoys her business because it is peaceful and the store's hours, from 8 in the morning until 9 at night, allow her to complete her household tasks without any problem. Whenever she has to go out her youngest child helps her by waiting on customers, or they take turns, or, when the rest of her children are available. In addition she is very satisfied because she receives regular earnings since the shop has no nearby competition. She is very happy since over time she has been able to stock her business very well and now is able to offer a wide range of products to her buyers. She also rents rooms in her home which generates additional earnings. 

Since she is a very hard-working lady in the future she plans to expand the facilities and stock it with a larger quantity of merchandise. This is her third loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually, as she does not wish to be in any trouble with the people who made this loan possible, a loan that will allow her to keep working in search of progress. Felicitas plans to invest the loan in the purchase of consumable products such as soft drinks and beer since in the summer season she must stock her store well.

loans.use: To purchase beer, soft drinks and other products to stock her store

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús S. Ramírez quiere construir un cuarto en la planta alta de su vivienda ya que es de interés social y es muy pequeña para la familia que esta constituida de 5 personas, los cuales quieren cada uno su propio espacio. Jesús y su hijo trabajan en maquiladora para poder sostener los gastos de la familia.
texts.en: Jesús S. Ramírez would like to construct a fourth floor onto his house.  The house is very small for his family, which is made up of 5 people, all of whom want their own space.  Jesus and his son work at a factory in order to be able to sustain his family's living costs.

loans.use: Construct another floor in their house. Construir en planta alta

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea H. (shown in the photo) and his wife, Mrs. Simut Uon, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. 

They have been selling fish since 2005. They hope to expand their business and to buy vegetables and meat for resale so that they will be able to generate a higher income. Hence, Sophea is asking for his second loan of $400 to provide capital.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Maria Eustaquia

texts.es:
la señora Maria Eustaquia García tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella,   vive con su esposo el señor Bartolome Gutierrez quien se dedica a la agricultura y cria de vacas.
 
la señora Maria elabora pan y tamales desde hace varios años,  sus ventas son ambulantes con los vecinos y amigos de la comunidad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de huevos, harina, manteca, queso, agua, levadura, soda, leña.
con las ganancias desea ahorrar para hacerle una reparacion a la casa.
 
es una persona muy humilde y conocida por vecinos de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Eustaquia G. is 58 years old, married, and doesn’t have any children dependent upon her. She lives with her husband, Bartolome Gutierrez, who works in agriculture and in raising cows.

Maria has made bread and tamales for several years and she makes her sales by foot to her neighbors and friends in the community. She will use the loan for the purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, water, yeast, baking soda, and firewood. With the earnings, she wants to save to make a repair to the house.

She is a very humble person and is well-known by the neighbors in the community.

loans.use: Purchase of eggs, flour, butter, cheese, water, yeast, baking soda, and firewood

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio C. de 39 años, natural del distrito de San Francisco, esta casado con doña Macedonia Quispe  de 37 años de edad,  fruto del gran amor ha logrado tener 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa donde reina la felicidad. Antonio, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Él es campesino, y siempre esta labrando la tierra, posee una parcela en donde siembra: cacao, hojas de coca, café y plátano, en donde los tres primeros son los productos que mayor rentabilidad le da, debido que las empresas acopiadoras son los que más demanda le hace de estos frutos y le dan una buena paga por cada kilogramo. Han transcurrido 20 años y continua trabajando con mucho esmero en esta actividad,  sin embargo debe tener mucha paciencia para poder combatir con los insectos, ya que dañan los frutos que cultiva. En adelante, espera juntar más capital para poder comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el 15avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao, café y sacos de abono para cubrir su parcela.
texts.en: Antonio C. is 39 years old and he is originally from the district of San Francisco. He is married with Mrs. Macedonia Quispe, 37 years old, and the fruit of their great love has been their 3 children. they live together in their own home and in complete happiness. Antonio is someone who looks to succeed, working with great care in his business. He is a farmer and he has always worked the land. He has a parcel of land where he sows cocoa, coca leaves, coffee, and bananas. The three first products are the most profitable given that these products are the most requested by wholesale companies and he gets good remuneration for each kilogram of product.  Twenty years have passed and he continues to work on his business with great care, but he still needs to exercise a great deal of patience when faced with insect plagues that damage the harvest. IN the future he plans on saving enough capital funds to purchase more land. This is his 15th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that he needs to take the responsibility to make his payments on time, and he is ready to do so. He is always up to date with all the agreements that take place at his communal bank. With the three thousand nuevos soles that he requests, he will purchase cocoa and coffee seeds and sacks of fertilizer to distribute over his land.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. 

Zulaika has a business of selling matooke (a local dish made from bananas). She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days a week. Zulaika sells her products from home. Zulaika has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenge for Zulaika is transportation and seasonality. Her goal is to create another branch of her business. 

Zulaika lives in a home that she owns; she does not access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Gabriel Enrique

texts.es:
Gabriel Enrique es un hombre desplazado por la violencia, sin embargo esto no ha sido una dificultad para el ya que desde que llegó a Medellín monto una legumbrería que ha sido el negocio que le ha permitido mantener el sustento de su familia.

El trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana para brindarles a sus clientes verdura fresca y la mejor atención, por esto Gabriel necesita mantener un excelente surtido en su legumbrería no solo para mantener sus clientes sino para ofrecerles mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Gabriel Enrique was displaced by the violence, however this has not stopped him. Since he arrived in Medellín he set up a vegetable shop, and this business has allowed him to support his family. 

He starts work very early in the morning in order to offer his customers fresh vegetables and the best service. For this reason, Gabriel needs to maintain an excellent stock at his vegetable stand, not only to keep his customers but also to offer them a better variety.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables for his vegetable stand

loans.name: 11 Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Bon L. T. (50) is a 53-year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Bon is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 11-Dong Hai (16.02.11 Dong Hai).

Bon is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, she operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for saL.. Bon has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately $146 a month from these activities.

In 2011, Bon joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her 1st loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Bon plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Lan (51) is a 46-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

2.  L. T. Tieu (49) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.

3.  N. T. Tin (54) is a 58-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Bon L. T. (50) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Bon là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 11-Dong Hai (16.02.11 Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán.  Bon thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bon kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2011, Bon đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bon đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. Lan (51) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

2.  L. T. Tieu (49) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3.  N. T. Tin (54) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith, de 32 años, es serena y muy trabajadora. Es madre sola de un hijo de 10 años, con quien vive en una casa alquilada. 

Desde hace 3 años, tiene su bodega y locutorio en un local alquilado, en una avenida céntrica  y muy concurrida.  En este negocio trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana, para atender la venta de cervezas, sobre todo los fines de semana, de donde tiene mayor afluencia y, en esos días vende muy bien, de las que sus utilidades le resultan muy beneficiosas, con las que paga tranquilamente el alquiler de su local, es por ella sola se hace cargo de la educación de su hijo, con el anhelo de que se forje una carrera profesional. El negocio que desarrolla le gusta mucho, a pesar de que a veces lo siento esclavizante e impotente de no poder surtir como ella quisiera. Edith, está muy segura que trabajando arduamente en adelante ampliará su negocio y, de ese modo comprarse su terreno para construir su casa, para brindarle seguridad a su hijo.   

Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta muy contenta de que las lideres, la invitaron a conformar este banco comunal, en gratitud a ello promete no defraudarlas. 

De obtener el crédito que solicita, se abastecerá de gaseosas y cervezas, del mismo proveedor y a menor costo.
texts.en:
Edith, age 32, is a calm and hardworking woman. She is a single mother of a 10 year old son. They live in a rented house.

Three years ago she started a store and call center in a rented location along the main avenue, one of the busiest places in the area. Edith manages her business with the help of her sister, who is in charge of selling beer every weekend. This product sells very well during this time. The profits have been very beneficial because they have helped her comfortably pay the rent for her location. Edith is solely responsible for providing her son with an education because he hopes to pursue a professional career. She enjoys developing her business, but sometimes she feels helpless because she is not able to restock her store as much as she wants. Edith is determined to work hard to expand her business so that she can buy a piece of land for building a house, which will provide her son with security.

This is her first loan with MFP. Edith was pleased that the leaders invited her to join the Communal Bank. To express her gratitude, she promises not to disappoint them. With the loan she requested, she will acquire sodas and beer from her regular distributor at a lower cost.

loans.use: To restock her store with sodas and beer.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Richard est marié père de 3enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 19ans, il âgé de  46ans.
Il débute en 1994 dans la vente des vivres frais, il a bien gérer les deux premiers prêt sans défauts de payement car ses ventes journalière sont comprises entre 75000F et 100000F.
Avec le prêt actuel, elle va se focalisé sur les denrées non périssables tels que : 4cartons d jus en boites, 5cartons de petits pois, 5cartons  de  champignons  en boîte, 2cartons de tomates pelées, 2 cartons de tomates concentrées, 2catons de sardines à huile, 2cartons des saucisses en boîtes, 10paks d’eau minérales.
Ses projets sont :
Vendre plus, faire d’énormes bénéfices pour ouvrir une boucherie parallèle.
Il vient de construire sa maison et il veut améliorer les conditions pour que sa famille y vive en paix.
texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old, married and the father of three children, age 7 to 19. In 1994, he started selling fresh food. His first two loans have been well managed and repaid without default, because his daily sales range from XOF 75'000 to 100'000 (ca US$ 160 to 215).

With this loan, he will focus on non perishable foodstuffs, such as : 4 boxes of canned orange juice, 5 boxes of peas, 5 boxes of canned mushroom, 2 boxes of peeled tomatoes, 2 boxes of tomato concentrate, 2 boxes of oil sardines, 2 boxes of canned sausage, and 10 packs of mineral water.

His projects are to sell more and make a large profit in order to open a butcher shop in parallel. He just built his house and wants to improve it, so that its family can live there in peace.

loans.use: to buy orange juice, peas, canned mushroom, peeled tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 41 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia.

Se dedica a la agricultura casi toda su vida, sus padres le heredaron algunos de sus terrenos y en la actualidad siembra papa, maíz, trigo, cebada entre otros cultivos que junto con su esposo  trabajan arduamente para asegurarse una buena ganancia de sus cosechas y recuperar lo invertido en cada acampana y para que esto sea una realidad siempre trabaja desde las primeras horas de día a verificar el normal crecimiento de las plantas cultivadas , para evitar posibles plagas y fertilizar periódicamente; aunque su mayor dificultad sean los factores climáticos que no son de su control y que en varias oportunidades le ha significado perdidas significativas por lo que su deseo es tener  también un establo ganadero. 

Es su crédito numero 6 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  tener una nueva oportunidad de trabajo en equipo con au banco comunal de la que actualmente integra y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos.

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su siembra.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 41 years and lives with her husband and two children in a house that they own.

She has worked in agriculture for almost her entire life. Her parents left her some of their land and she currently grows potatoes, corn, wheat, barley and other crops. She works hard with her husband to ensure that they have a good harvest. They profit from each product, so in order to make this a reality, she always starts work very early to make sure that the plants are healthy in order to avoid possible pests. She also puts down fertilizer periodically. However, the weather poses the greatest difficulty for her, as it is out of her control and has translated into significant losses on various occasions. As a result, her dream is to also have a barn for cattle.

This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is very happy for this new opportunity to work together with her current communal bank. She promises to make her repayments on time.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of sacks of manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Dios Provee 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Nery is the coordinator of her group, Dios Provee 1 & 2. She lives in the city of La Romana, where the sugar cane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. 

Nery has been working for almost one year. She started her business with her first Esperanza loan, after the program went to her community and some neighbors joined. She had sold animals for a long time, helping her husband. Now Nery has her own business selling goats. She buys them as infants and raises them. She also buys adult goats to sell the meat. Nery is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a dozen goats.

Nery lives with her two children and their father. Her most difficult challenges are to have an improved business, enough money to buy a car, and to reinvest in her business for a prosperous living. Thank you for your support!.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Azucena Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Azucena, ella tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos  aún viven con ella, una de sus hijas que vive en su casa es casada y tiene una pequeña hija, la misma que es el encanto de nuestra amiga. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, todas las mañanas mientras su esposo esta en alta mar ella sale a comprar sus productos a las embarcaciones que llegan de alta mar hasta las playas, para luego llevarlos a vender por toda la localidad y también entrega a comerciantes que llevan el pescado a otros cantones, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00. También realiza trabajos de limpieza de pescado por lo que le pagan un sueldo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y llevarlo a vender. Lleva más de 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir.

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.

En la foto nuestra socia está con su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
The members of the “Crucita” communal bank meet in Portoviejo Canton’s Crucita Parish.  This location is known for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are very popular with national and foreign tourists.  It is called “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

We met Azucena, 67, here.  She’s married and has six children who are already adults but two still live with her.  One of her daughters that still lives with her is married and has a small daughter who is our friend’s joy.  Her husband’s a fisherman.

She is a fish merchant.  Every morning while her husband is out to sea she heads out to the shore to buy her products from the boats that return from the open sea to the beaches and takes them to sell throughout the community; she also sells to merchants that take the fish to other cantons.  She works every day from 5am until 3pm.  She also works cleaning fish and earns a salary for doing this.

This loan is to buy fish to sell.  She’s been in the communal bank for over 8 years and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from Foundation Espier.  Her dream is to continue forward and to enjoy good health.

She appears in the photo with her little granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Rwenkurijo Tutungukye Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Emmanuel has been in a retail business for 4 years now, running it in Bushenyi. The father of 3 owns a farm, too. He says he began his retail enterprise to supplement the profits he was making out of his farming business. Hard work, he asserts, has been pivotal in his progress. He says this business generates monthly sales profits to the sum of 200,000 shillings.

The purchase of more general merchandise and retail commodities such as rice, sugar, soap, etc. is what he is planning to use this Kiva loan for.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, soap, etc. to resell

loans.name: Parmusenke

texts.en:
Parmusenke is 53 years old. He is married and blessed with ten children. He  is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. He has been a good client and this will be his third loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for farming. He is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su madre y hermanos, la venta la realiza desde hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana, de este negocio se ha logrado mantener cubriendo todas las necesidades.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en maíz, este crédito será de mucha ayuda, pues podrá comprar al por mayor los granos básicos para realizar la venta, pues al obtenerla al por mayor también se favorece con mejores precios.
Para maría su objetivo es trabajar lo mayor posible y ahorrar para formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
María sells tortillas.  She’s 31 years old and lives with her mother and siblings.  She’s been selling for the last five years.  She works every day of the week.  The business has made it possible for her to cover all her needs.

At present, she requests a loan to buy corn.  This loan will be of great help to her because she’ll be able to buy the basic grains for her sales at wholesale and being able to get them at wholesale means a better price.  María’s objective is to work as much as possible to save up in order to form her own family.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Herberth

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Herberth; el socio tiene 30 años; el socio es soltero y tiene 1 hijo, de 7 año de edad;  El socio se dedica a prestar servicio de moto car, el socio tiene sus dos unidades de moto car y él maneja una de ellas y la otra la alquila, el socio desea invertir en la compra de repuestos y lubricantes para el mantenimiento de sus s moto car. El solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de repuestos y lubricantes para sus moto car.

El socio se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Herberth, a member of “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”, a Communal Bank located in Yungaqui, a district of the Anta province in the Cusco department.

Herberth is 30 years old, he is single and has a 7-year-old child. He engages in offering services with his motocar*. He owns two motocars, one that he drives and the other one the rents out. He wants to invest in the purchase of spare parts and lubricants to maintain his motocars. He is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of spare parts and lubricants for his motocars.

He is very satisfied with and thankful to the support he will receive through this loan, and he commits to complying with the repayment of his dues according to the agreed schedule.

<cite>*A motocar is a light, three-wheeled passenger vehicle</cite>

loans.use: To buy spare parts and lubricants for his motocars.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 45 years old and married to Martin. They are blessed with three children, ages 18, 15 and 12. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 8,000 which she uses to support her family needs.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will expand by purchasing another farm. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into dairy farming which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008, il est composé de dix huit femmes qui sont parentes, amies et voisines, elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et l'aviculture.


Madame Awa la responsable est âgée de 28 ans, mariée mère de deux enfants, elle a une nièce en charge; elle mène une activité de petit commerce avec une bonne expérience. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite habillée en vert olive avec un pagne multicolore.


Elle achéte des habits pour enfants, parfum.... dans la capitale et revend dans son quartier.


Avec son prêt elle compte renforcer son activité en achetant beaucoup de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et de gagner beaucoup de revenus.


Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir son mari à améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was formed on December 15, 2008. It is made up of 18 women who are relatives, friends and neighbors. They work at small-scale retailing and poultry-raising. 

Madame Awa, the group leader, is 28, married, and the mother of two children. She is also responsible for a niece. She has a good deal of experience in her small-scale retail business. In the photo she is standing on the far right, dressed in olive green with a multicolored print wrap as a skirt. 

She buys clothing for children, perfume, etc. in the capital and sells the merchandise in her neighborhood. With her loan she intends to expand her business by buying a lot of goods so as to respond to the needs of her clientele and earn more income. She helps her husband to support the family and improve living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics destined for resale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La señora Marisol , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijas , él le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que labora en una empresa privada , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus pequeñas para que logren   realizar una carrera profesional , doña Marisol tiene serios problemas con el techo del hogar ya que en tiempos de lluvia la casa que llena de agua ocasionando inundación , lo cual solicita que se le apoyo debido a que su salario no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez todos los materiales que necesita para la inversión del techo . Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marisol lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband and daughters.  Her husband helps her with the household expenses since he works for a private company.  Her plans for the future are to improve her living conditions and always support her daughters in their studies so they succeed in accomplishing professional careers.

Marisol has serious problems with the roof of her house since the house fills with water in the rainy season and causes flooding.  For this reason she is requesting support, given that her salary is not enough to buy all at once the materials she needs to invest in the roof.

She is grateful for the trust that Afodenic places in her through the Kiva funding, so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy zinc for the roof.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has seven children. Her husband is a gardener. She sells soaps and different types of toothpastes at Kukwa by moving from one area to another. Cecilia assists her husband in taking care of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more toothpaste to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 25 years old and married. She has two children.

Mercy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Mercy has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Mercy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a hardworking business woman aged 54. For over five years, she has been selling bananas to earn a living. Hannah has retained her business because of good reputation with her costumers. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business. She expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Clovis

texts.en: Clovis is a 52-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him. His desire is to educate his children up to university level. He has been in the car tire business for ten years. His hardship is limited funds to buy enough supplies. His dream is a wholesale business. Clovis needs money to buy car tires for resale.

loans.use: to buy car tires for resale

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Nicolasa cuenta con 26 años de edad, es casada tiene tres hijos lo cuales dos se encuentra estudiando la  primaria Jaime esta en 4º grado de primaria y Héctor 1º grado y Martin solo tiene dos años de edad, su esposo se llama Silvano se dedica al campo.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende accesorios como aretes, pulseras, collares, pinzas, pasadores, etc. e invirtió su préstamo en la compra de mas accesorios para vender.

Nicolasa pertenece al grupo luchadoras ya que está integrado por puras mujeres y un hombre, ellas se definen como luchadoras y trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas:

Gloria, Obdulia, Julia, Celia, Araceli, Aurelia, T., Marcela, Bertha, José, Carmela, Metodia, Pruvidenci, todos realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de refrescos, productos de campo, frutas y verduras, mercería, pan, carnicería, etc. 

*aunque todos los miembros del grupo estan en la foto 3 no se visiualizan bien, es por ello que se marcaron como ausentes
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 26 years old.  She is married with three children, of whom two attend primary school.  Jaime is in the fourth grade, and Héctor in first grade. Martin is only two years old.  Her husband is called Silvano, and he works in the fields.

Nicolasa works in retailing, selling accessories such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, clips and pins, etc.  She will invest her loan in purchasing more accessories to sell.

Nicolasa belongs to the "Luchadoras" group ("The Strivers"), which is made up of just women and one man.  They define themselves as strivers and hard-workers.  They are: Gloria, Obdulia, Julia, Celia, Araceli, Aurelia, T., Marcela, Bertha, José, Carmela, Metodia, and Pruvidenci.  Each of them has a business of some kind such as selling refreshments; agricultural products; fruits and vegetables; general merchandise; bread; butchers; etc.

* While all the group members are in the photo, three of them aren't easy to see which is why they were labeled as missing from it.

loans.use: to buy more accessories such as earrings, bracelets, necklaces, clips, pins, etc.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 25 years old and married with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling food at a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Myriam Rocio

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo (Portoviejo) se reúne el Banco Comunal San José De Sucre, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes naturales y hermosos, por su gastronomía típica del lugar y por su gente trabajadora y honesta dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Miriam. Tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación  tiene una hija de 11 años de edad que está en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella para ganar algo de dinero por su cuenta y con esto ayudar en el hogar se dedica al comercio, tiene un bazar en su casa en el cual vende de todo un poco (ropa, perfumes, artículos de belleza, bisutería, entre otras cosas de bazar). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja sola ya que su negocio no es muy grande y como lo tiene en su casa no se le hace difícil cumplir con sus labores de ama de casa, compra sus productos en Portoviejo y  las prendas de vestir en su tierra natal Otavalo, lugar al que viaja una vez al mes o su hermana le envía hasta Portoviejo. Ella tiene su negocio por más de 10 años y siempre le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y zapatos ya que se viene la Navidad y los clientes es lo que más compran en esta época del año. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy cumplido. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San José de Sucre" meets In the "24 de Mayo" Canton (Portoviejo), which is known for its natural, beautiful landscape, typical local gastronomy, and its hard working, honest people who work mainly in agriculture and livestock farming.

Here we met Mrs. Miriam, 41, who is married and has an 11-year-old daughter in school.  Her husband is a farmer.

To earn a little money on her own and help out with household expenses, she set up a bazaar in her home where she sells a little bit of everything (clothing, perfumes, beauty products, costume jewelry and other bazaar items).  She works alone every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. since her business is not very big.  This allows her to also take care of her household chores.  She buys products in Portoviejo and clothing in her home town of Otavalo where she travels once a month or her sister sends items to Portoviejo.  Miriam has had her business for over ten years and it has always gone well.

This loan will be used to buy clothing and shoes since Christmas is approaching and customers do most of their shopping at this time of year.  She is a founding member of the communal bank which she likes because everyone is very committed.

Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Alcesido Norberto

texts.es:
Alcesido Norberto tiene 49 años de edad vive en Unión Libre tiene un hijo, vive con la esposa y con el hijo de 14 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Alcesido se dedica a la Agricultura siembra de arroz, maíz hace 26 años de edad, las compras y las ventas lo  hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insumos. Con la ayuda del crédito logrará comprar insumos.
El sueño es poder tener una finca, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer libros.

Con la ayuda del CREDITO ANTERIOR ha podido mejorar el estilo de Vida, la producción ha mejorado, Toda la familia trabaja en conjunto para obtener un poco más de ingresos.
texts.en:
Alcesido Norberto is 49. He is in a common-law marriage and has one 14-year-old child. They live together in the Ventanas canton of the Los Rios province.
The Jerusalen Communal Bank is located in El Caimito, belonging to the Puerto Pechiche parish, in the Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn, rice, and gandul beans.
Alcesido has worked in agriculture sowing rice and corn for over 26 years. He buys and sells in Ventanas.
He is requesting this loan for working in agriculture. He will purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea, and tools. With the support of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs. His dream is to have a farm. He has not had any challenges thus far. In his free time he likes to read books.
With the help of his previous loan, he was able to improve his lifestyle, and his production improved. His whole family works together in order to make a little more income.

loans.use: to work in agriculture; to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, and supplies.

loans.name: Denisse Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el Barrio 15 De Septiembre de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, con un clima cálido, por su gastronomía y por sus innumerables atractivos turísticos, cada 15 días  se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Palabra De Mujer.
  
Aquí conocimos a Denisse, tiene 19 años  de edad, es madre soltera de un niño de  dos años de edad. Vive en casa de sus padres y estudia el primer semestre de Auditoria en una Universidad de Manta. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque le están ayudando mucho con los créditos para salir adelante.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica a su negocio con el cual puede pagar sus estudios y cubrir las necesidades a su hijo. Hace un año atrás solicito un crédito al banco comunal con el cual comenzó su negocio de comidas rápidas en su casa, vende hamburguesas, hot dog, batidos de fruta, tostadas entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días en las tardes y noches, su mamá le ayuda en su negocio cuando esta muy ocupada. En  su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a esto ella esta saliendo adelante con la dura carga de criar a un hijo sola.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The members of the “Palabra De Mujer” communal bank meet every two weeks in the neighborhood known as “15 de Septiembre,” located in the city of Manta, known for its lovely beaches that are visited by tourists year round because of the warm climate, good food, and tourist attractions.

Here we meet Denisse.  She’s 19 years old and the single mother of a two year old boy.  She lives with her parents and is in her first semester of studying to be an auditor at the University of Manta.  She’s been in the communal bank for three cycles and she enjoys it because they’re helping her greatly with the loans that help her get ahead.

Aside from studying, she has a business so that she can pay her education expenses and cover her son’s needs.  She requested a loan through the communal bank a year ago, which allowed her to start her fast food business at home.  She sells hamburgers, hot dogs, fruit smoothies, and tostadas, among other things.  She works every evening and her mother helps her with the business when she gets very busy.

Things are going well for her in her business and thanks to it she’s getting ahead with the task of having to raise her son alone.

She will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her foods.  Her dreams are to finish her education and provide the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: El Copanco (Flat) Group

texts.es:
v El grupo se llama el copanco  se integra de cinco señoras quien cada uno se dedica a diferente actividad.

   La señora quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Jesús y solicito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, royal, entre otros,  para la elaboración de  panes, en donde lleva  trabajando  cuatro meses  formalmente y comenta que le va bien  ya que ha mejorado muchos su ingresos de su hogar.
 
   Quien  la motivo a esta actividad fue su familia para así seguirse a poyando con los ingresos de su casa y tener la más necesaria para sus nietas que vive con ella.
 
   Lo que ella desea es que con su pequeña actividad y el préstamo siga trabajando hasta que dios le preste vida.

   Las personas que integran el en grupo son: Aurora  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos para venderlo destazado, Elena invertirá el préstamo en la compra  y venta de quesos, Margarita  invertirá en la compra y ventas de frutas y verduras y por último la señora  Blanca lidia  quien invertirá el préstamo también en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Copanco.”  It is made up of five women, each of whom makes a living from a different economic activity.

The woman who sat for the interview on behalf of the group is named Jesús.  She asked for a loan so that she can purchase ingredients for making bread.  She needs to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, cheese, Royal brand baking powder, etc.  She has officially been in business for four months, and says that it is going well, since it has greatly improved her household income.

Jesús’s reason for going into business was her family, since she needed to continue supporting them with her income—especially her granddaughters, who live with her.   

Jesús hopes that her small business and the loan will help her to continue working as long as God gives her life.

The other members of the group are: Aurora, who plans to use her share of the loan to purchase chickens to sell for butchering; Helena, who plans to purchase cheese to sell; Margarita, who will purchase fruits and vegetables to sell; and finally, Blanca Lidia, who also plans to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is from a small village in West Georgia. She is 53-years-old and lives with her family: husband – Tamaz and 31-years-old son. Tamaz works as a worker in the village. Irina and her son are involved in family agriculture. They have 8 milk cows and 7 calves. Irina produces various dairy products (cheese, yogurt) and sells them in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Total average monthly income of the family is 1000 Laris. 

Irina requested credit for purchasing feed for livestock for the winter months. She will feed the livestock with high quality natural feed and get high quality milk during the winter months. Irina will sell grown calves in spring and get income. She plans to use the income for further development of family dairy farm. Also part of the income will be used for covering family daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es: Cirila, de 39 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Alberto  de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanta voluntad y entrega han logrado cultivar Cirila y su esposo, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao y café y achiotes, dependerá la calidad y el precio que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es transportar los pesados sacos de los productos hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus granos. Más adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con espacios sin cultivar. Este es el crédito número 01 con MFP, se siente feliz por contar con el apoyo de los financistas ya que gracias al apoyo de ellos esta prosperando. Cirila en esta oportunidad también espera beneficiarse con el crédito por lo cual ella esta dispuesta a devolver puntualmente sus cuotas. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, contratará peones para que le apoyen en el desmonte y cosechas de sus productos.
texts.en:
Cirila, 39, is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home along with her partner Alberto, 40, and their four dear children who are the primary reason for all their efforts. The products that Cirila and her husband have grown successfully with so much willpower and commitment have helped them considerably in their lives' progress. Each morning she begins working on her land since she knows that the care she gives her cocoa, coffee and annatto seedlings will determine the quality and price she obtains for them. What she enjoys most about her work is caring for her crops and she feels very happy when she sees them large and leafy. She has been in this business for 20 years and believes the most difficult part is transporting the heavy sacks of product to the city of San Francisco [Peru], the place where she receives the best prices for her beans and seeds. Down the road she hopes to plant more cocoa plants since she has some uncultivated areas. 

This is her first loan with MFP. She is happy to have the support of the lenders since, thanks to their support, she is prospering. Cirila also hopes to receive a benefit with the loan this time and so she is willing to make her payments punctually. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles she will hire day laborers to help her with clearing the land and harvesting her products.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Migniwanoumide Group

texts.fr: MIGNIWANOUMIDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies d’enfance. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rosaline (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 32 ans. Rosaline est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Sourou. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Rosaline et son mari. Pour cette raison, Rosaline vend des céréales à son domicile et dans un marché du Bénin depuis huit ans. De façon secondaire, Rosaline  vend également des tissus et des bijoux. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rosaline sollicite pour la septième fois, ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIGNIWANOUMIDE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des céréales et des bijoux.

loans.name: Bedardo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Bedardo habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, comerciante desde hace mas de 10 años, ademas es agricultor ya que cosecha Piña en sus tierra, su esposa es su brazo derecho ya que lo apoya en todo.
el solicita su primer crédito ya que necesita invertir en su negocio, el tiene un tramo en el Mercado de Managua, y necesita comprar un camión de Sandia y unos viajes de piña ya que unos clientes a quien el le vende al por mayor quieren mas productos y necesita abastecer para no perder la clientela, con esto el señor Bedardo obtendrá buena ganancia de esta venta y podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Agradece le apoyo que se le ha brindado con este crédito ya que su vida de ahora en adelante cambiara mucho.

loans.use: Compra de Frutas Sandia y Piña

loans.name: Zeynep

texts.en:
Zeynep is married and a mother of four.  She is making a contribution to the family budget by knitting and by selling underwear.  She is using her fourth loan.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of threads and underwear and increased her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Zeynep hanım evli dört çocuk annesi.  Çamaşır satışı ve örgü örerek aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  4. mikro kredisini kullanan Zeynep Hanım çamaşır ve örgü ipi alarak üretip satarak karını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy more yarn and lingerie.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
My name is Martina, I am a businesswoman selling new clothing in the center of my city. I have many years experience in this business and it generates income to cover my family expenses and pay my suppliers. Thanks to this business I can give my children an education. Now I need to supply my business because in this season the sales are highers. Later it will be time for school and I need to have supplies for the season.

Translated from Spanish by Ruth, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Martina, soy comerciante cuento con un negocio de venta de ropa nueva ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y demas compromisos con mis proveedores, gracias a este negocio puedo darles educación a mis hijos, actualmente necesito surtir mi negocio ya que en esta espoca de navidad el volumen de venta es mayor, luego vienen las clases y hay que surtir segun la epoca.

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses, slippers, tennis shoes, childrens suits, t-shirts and pants.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija runs a hairdressing salon. The salon is located in a busy area of Lumo in Dar es Salaam. She has two assistants in her business. On regular days she attends to fifteen to twenty customers.

Hadija thanks all her lenders of her first loan with Kiva. With the loan she was able to stock enough hairdressing materials for her hair salon business. She is now requesting a second loan. With the loan she wants to improve her business by adding comfortable chairs for customers to sit in while in queue, a TV set to entertain customers, and a stock of hairdressing materials. She is in need of USD 550 to implement her plan.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Monserrate

texts.en:
Ms. Monserrate left Ecuador for Venezuela several years ago in search of better employment and new opportunities. In Venezuela, she has learned how to make purses out of leather and other materials. She returned to Ecuador a few years ago to restart her life in her native country. She used $400 of her savings and the skills she learned abroad to establish a new business making purses.

P. is requesting the loan so she may scale up her business and setup a workshop. She wants to invest in raw materials and make purses with new designs that she has created. The loan will help her make more profit and take care of herself and her son, who is currently in school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for production

loans.name: Maria Mauricia

texts.es:
Maria Mauricia is a native of the town of Apodaca in Nuevo León. She is married with 2 small children. Her husband works as a skilled laborer. His salary is very low, however, and now that they have purchased a home, their mortgage payments have greatly reduced the family's budget. Maria is an enterprising woman, however, and decided to launch her own business selling cosmetics in order to help her husband and offer better quality of life to her children.

Maria now needs a loan of $475, which she will invest in the purchase of merchandise. She hopes to increase her sales and further grow her business by incorporating shoe sales into her business. She is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. Decide to support this family. They very much appreciate the opportunity you are offering them to improve their lives and move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Mauricia es originaria de la localidad de Apodaca en Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos pequeños hijos. Su esposo trabaja como operario pero el sueldo que recibe es muy bajo y como han adquirido una casa, el pago de las hipotecas reducía mucho el ingreso familiar, pero Maria es una mujer emprendedora y decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos para ayudar a su esposo y poder ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora Maria necesita de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía y también quiere incorporar la venta de zapatos, con lo que espera incrementar sus ventas y hacer crecer su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Salley

texts.en:
Salley is twenty-six years old with four children. With her husband being unemployed, life is not easy for Salley. She has been running her business for the last five years without capital of her own. Her last loan enabled her to diversify her business.

Salley now sells palm oil but with many family expenses to cater for, she has not been able to build up suficient capital. She desperately needs a loan of US$ 200 to purchase seventy gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil  wholesale for resale

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
María del Rosario is a woman who constantly struggles for her two children. She really wishes and desires that they succeed in life through academics. Since the father of her two children abandoned them, she now has to pull through and support for her family. Therefore, she started to look for another way to improve their income. In her free afternoons, she started to sell beauty products and home goods like duvets through a catalog business. Little by little, she started to build up her clientele until she had a steady customer base and was able to offer a variety of products.

Without a doubt, María thinks that it is necessary to move ahead and find a better future for her children. Thus, she is seeking a loan of $475 which will be repaid in installments over 6 months. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise for product demos; this will enable her to attract more customers to buy her products. With your help, María will be able to grow her business as well as increase possibilities for self-improvement for her two sons.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

María del Rosario es una mujer que lucha constantemente por sus dos hijos que tanto quiere, y desea que salgan adelante en la vida a base de estudios. Debido a que el papá de sus hijos los abandonó y ahora ella es la que tiene que salir adelante, para poder mantener a su familia. Por lo tanto comenzó a buscar un ingreso extra para poder obtener mayores recursos. En las tardes libres comenzó a ofrecer productos de belleza y productos del hogar por catálogo como son los edredones, poco a poco comenzó a hacer clientela, hasta que formó un grupo, hasta que se pudo hacer de un repertorio de productos y clientas que la siguen.

Sin embargo María considera que es necesario seguir adelante y buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos. Por lo tanto, está solicitando un crédito de US $475 y está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero comprará más mercancía para poder programar demostraciones y así poder tener más clientas que le compren los productos. Con tu ayuda María podrá crecer su negocio y así crecer las posibilidades de que se superen los hijos de María.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to offer her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wider variety of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: she needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
The daily work of Felicita is to get herself up very early to prepare what is necessary for her little business, a bird food store.

She started 20 years ago as a traveling salesperson. Little by little the business has been growing thanks to her efforts and persistence. Now her business is located in a stand inside of a market place, which offers her a better sense of security. Thanks to her work she can now offer her kids the opportunity to study, and finish the construction of their home.

Her plan is to buy her stand since she is still renting it, and for that she would need the amount of $1000.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

La labor diaria de Felicita es levantarse desde muy temprano a preparar lo necesario para su pequeño negocio, una tienda de alimentos para aves. Ella empezó hace más de veinte años como vendedora ambulante. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y empeño. Ahora su negocio se ubica en un puesto dentro del mercado, lo que la hace sentirse más segura que antes.Gracias a su trabajo ella puede brindarle estudios a sus hijos y terminar de construir su vivienda. En sus planes esta la compra de su puesto, ya que este es alquilado aún. Para ello, ella necesitaría un monto de $1000.

loans.use: Purchase of a vending stand inside a market place

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel O. is a motorcyclist. He studied his business for a year. He is single and resides in Edo State, Nigeria. He is 35 years old. He studied his business for a year.

Emmanuel has been in business for the past 6 years. He needs the loan of $700 to buy another bike.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and a mother of six children. She is forty four years old and has been selling empty barrels and plastic containers for twenty years. The empty barrels and plastic containers are used to store water in many Ghanaian homes for cooking and drinking.  
Elizabeth wants to use her loan to buy more empty barrels and plastic containers as the raining season has started and customers will need them to harvest rain water for use.
She is a member of the group called Stewards. The group members agree to be mutually responsible for the loans of their peers.

loans.use: to purchase more empty barrels and plastic containers

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is a taxi driver with four children. Three of them are completely independent, the fourth daughter is finishing her IT studies in UMSA and she lives with her parents in El Alto, Zona Villa Exaltación.

The microloan will be used to cover the cost of his daughter´s thesis so she can graduate with a BS in IT and be able to work in her profession.

This is his sixth credit with Impro, the evaluation performed supports the approval of the microcredit.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
This happy and diligent woman is Gladys, loving mother of five dear children, who despite her limited economic resources provides with pleasure post-secondary education for her children. Gladys has a business that buys and sells animals (pigs) from the districts of Huancané and Taraco, which she sells on Sundays in the plaza dominical in the city of Juliaca, Peru. Her beloved husband Raymundo works every day providing transportation as a motorcycle taxi driver for the population of Juliaca. Thanks to the efforts of both they have been building a home and, of most importance, providing well-being and the tools necessary for their children to become successful and be good people in their future lives. Gladys’s hope is to receive a loan that will increase her capital. For this reason she is trying to touch your generous heart in the hopes of receiving a favorable response soon.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta dama alegre y diligente es Gladys, madre amorosa D. cinco queridos hijos, quien pese a sus bajos recursos económicos viene brindándoles con satisfacción estudios superiores a sus retoños, Gladys se dedica al negocio D. compra y venta D. animales (CERDITOS) D. los distritos D. Huancané y Taraco y los venD. los días domingos en la plaza dominical D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, en tanto su querido esposo Raymundo todos los días D. la semana trabaja brindando movilidad en un mototaxi a la población Juliqueña.Gracias al esfuerzo D. ambos vienen construyendo su vivienda y lo más importante brindándoles bienestar y las herramientas necesarias a todos sus hijos para que a futuro puedan alcanzar el éxito en sus vidas y puedan ser hombres D. bien.El deseo D. Gladys es contar con mayor capital D. inversión, para ello espera tocar tu generoso corazón con la esperanza D. recibir pronto una respuesta favorable.

loans.use: To increase her capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of pigs

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa has 7 children: Veronica, 34, sells clothing; Claudia, 32, is a housewife; Carlos, 30, is a bill collector; Guadalupe, 29, is a laborer ; Rosa Isela, 26, is a housewife; Jessica, 24, is a waitress; and Miguel, who is an employee. Rosa started her business to help her husband support their family. Two yers ago she began selling candy, tostadas, pork rinds and sodas, and little by little she has made her business grow to a small grocery store.

Rosa requests a $300 loan to be paid back in 4 months to purchase more merchandise to stock up her store. With your help, Rosa will continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva volunteer

Rosa tiene 7 hijos: Verónica de años 34 venta de ropa, Claudia de 32 hogar, Carlos de 30 años cobrador, Guadalupe de 29 años obrero, Rosa Isela de 26 años hogar, Jessica de 24 años mesera y Miguel empleado. Inicio el negocio ya que no completaba con los gastos de la casa, y vio la manera de apoyar a su esposo de esta manera. Comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo dulces, tostadas, chicharrones y refrescos, poco a poco fue invirtiendo en el negocio hasta establecer su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener bien surtida su tienda. Con tu ayuda Rosa saldrá adelante.

loans.use: purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Fazilat

texts.en:
Fazilat baji is the wife of C. M.Aslam, and she has been living in the city of Raiwind, Pakistan since 1978. She owns a two-room house. Fazilat baji is a housewife, and she states that she prefers to do work around the house and to take care of her children. Indeed, she is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her oldest son completed his education through 10th standard, while the next oldest son completed 8th standard. Her husband, meanwhile, has worked as a driver for the last 30 years. More specifically, he drives his own vehicles (36 seated coasters). At the same time, Fazilat baji’s oldest sons drive the coasters to help their family (i.e., to improve the family's financial situation).

Notably, Fazilat baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to change the tires and bodies of the vehicles used in her husband's business.

loans.use: To repair vehicles used in her husband's business

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
La dama Ana G. G. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su actividad económica de venta de joyas ofreciéndolas en su casa de habitación y en ocasiones ambulantemente en lugares específicos. Con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia el cual necesita de su apoyo por lo que tiene dos pequeños hijos que mantener en su municipio de San Rafael del sur en Managua.

Ceprodel le ha beneficiado grandemente en al compra de las joyas por lo que le ha brindado créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel con el único propósito de obtener un nuevo crédito para la compra de estas joyas y así comercializarlas en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The woman Ana G. G. works very hard at her economic activity of selling jewelry, offering it from her home and occasionally in specific parts of open-air markets. With this business, she has been able to support her family. The family needs her help because there are two small children to maintain in her community of San Rafael del Sur in Managua. CEDPRODEL has hugely assisted her with the purchase of the jewelry because it has provided her with loans that she has used to purchase her products in order to commercialise them. Currently, she has approached CEDPRODEL with this proposition to obtain a new loan for the purchase of this jewelry and so be able to sell it from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich S., 48, is a widow with three children. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. Her other two children are garment factory workers. The family live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Pich is in the business of cutting grass to sell for cows' feed. Now, she is creating a new business of selling fruit. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Sreyloth

texts.en: Mrs. Sreyloth C. was born in 1978 and now lives in Prey Cha Kroav village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study.  She owns a plot of land and cultivates both rice and vegetables. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Ly Sophoung, is employed as a driver. Mrs. Sreyloth C. faces a problem with her production and does not have enough money to support her field. Thus, Mrs. Sreyloth C. requests a loan to hire laborers to prepare the field to grow cassava. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To hire laborers to prepare the field to grow cassava.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is forty-six years old. She is married with four kids:  one of them successfully completed high school; and the other three are still in school. Cecilia enjoys selling and she is motivated to work hard because she dreams of a better future for her kids. She owns and operates grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. However, her progress level is low because of inadequate working capital. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., to increased her profits. She hopes to increase her savings to push the dream of her kids’ education through to completion. She is a member of the community group called ‘Nnowm’ (Song) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Marcela Yolanda tiene 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II y vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, pero no continuó estudiando porque se casó a los 16 años y tiene 2 hijas, una de las cuales depende de ella porque es estudiante.
La socia tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de artículos de belleza que lo hace en su casa y también vende gelatina, marcianos de manera ambulatoria en el complejo arqueológico Chan-Chan.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 que canceló en 4 cuotas hizo una inversión en productos de belleza.
Con este crédito de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas lo invertirá en stock de avon y productos de unique.
Marcela sueña con llegar a ser directora de unique.
texts.en:
Marcela Yolanda is 36 years old and is a member of the Communal Bank "United for a Better Future II". She lives in the district of Florencia de Mora in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad in Peru.

She studied up to grade 12 and then didn't continue because she got married at 16 years of age. She has two daughters, one who still depends on her because she is a student.

Marcela sells beauty products in her home, as well as, gelatin desserts, which she sells by foot around the archeological site of Chan Chan.

With her first loan of 300 Soles ($1 US = 3 Soles), which she repaid in 4 installments, she invested in beauty products. With this loan of 1,200 Soles, which she will repay in 4 installments, she'll invest in Avon and Unique products.

Marcela dreams of becoming director of Unique.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in Avon products

loans.name: Bwanya Group

texts.en:
Nkola operates five radios in different parts of Kinshasa to help people who do not have cell phones communicate with their relatives and friends in different villages. He started his business in 1983. He is well-known in this field and has developed many relationships. His beginning capital was US$ 250. The business was challenging to him at first because he did not know much about running a radio. He also had to navigate renting a place, obtaining legal documents, and determining his employee’s wages. As a beginner in the field, he had to be very careful.

With determination and good management, he succeeded and was gradually able to increase his working capital from his profit and buy four more radios. His business is prospering and makes a profit of about US$ 500 per month. As Nkola has a vision of opening a big wholesale shop to provide business coming from villages, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups named “Bwanya,” meaning “Worthy” in English, last September. He plans to diversify his business with his loans by adding foods such as fresh fish, sacks of corn and miscellaneous other items. Nkola is 56 years old. He is married and the father of eight children between the ages of 10 and 39. Two of them live at home and are in school.

loans.use: To diversify the business by selling foods such as fresh fish, etc.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Group 4 of the Dios es Amor (God is Love) Bank of Hope is now in its second loan cycle. Marilandy V. is the group coordinator. She is married and has 2 children. She and the other group members live in Batey Palmara, a small community, part of Los Alcarrizos, outside Santo Domingo (Dominican Republic´s capital city).

Marilandy´s first loan was used for her fried chicken business. Now for her second loan, Marilandy has started a new venture: a tire-selling business where she can repair and sell second-hand tires. She has found that sometimes people have problems with their tires while passing by her isolated area and there was no one offering that service. She hopes she can establish herself in these two very different markets (food and vehicle repair) in order to build a better future for herself and her family.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase various essentials for their small businesses

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha S. N. is 25 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making about $20 in revenue every day. Her husband is a farmer and earns $2 per day. They have two young children.

Pha S. N. would like to take out a loan so that she can expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To increase inventory at her grocery store

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian E. is married with one child and received schooling through junior high. Vivian has sold fish since 2004. She buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Bantama, in Elmina.

Her husband is also employed, but his sector of employment is as a trader. Vivian uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Vivian will use the loan to help her purchase more fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vivian plans to reinvest to help expand her trade.

loans.use: Purchase more fish for processing and sale.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Ana Lucia tiene 43 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama 14 de Febrero de la Terminal de buses 1 c al sur. Tiene tres hijos de 2,8 y 16 años de edad, su esposo  trabaja de docente da  alumnos de primaria y secundaria. El negocio de la señora Ana Lucia es la venta de ropa que ella misma elabora con su fina costura que hace desde hace cinco años, el cual inicio con dinero propio y ayuda de su esposo el cual siempre la apoyado para que ella salga adelante con sus proyecciones ya que tiene que cubrir las necesidades de su familia. Con este crédito va hacer mejoras a su casa como: reparar el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y hacer divisiones de cuarto para estar cómodos con su familia. Sus planes es poder seguir apoyando  a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Lucia is 43 years old and lives in the "14 de Febrero" neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has three sons aged 2, 8, and 16 years old. Her husband is a teacher for elementary and middle school students. Mrs. Lucia's business is selling clothes, which she herself has sewn for the past five years.
