She began the business with her own money and with help from her husband who has always provided moral support for her to succeed in her projects and help augment the household income. With this loan she will make the following home improvements: repair the roof of the house, which is in poor condition, and create separate rooms to make the family living conditions more comfortable. Her plans are to provide support for her sons to continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof of the house and create separate rooms.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor E. owns one hectare of land in Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. He is 58-years old, married, and has four children. He wants to expand his business. His wife, Erlinda E., is helping him manage their small rice farm. The income that they get from their farm is used to pay for tuition, books and other school expenses of their children. 

Melchor is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will not only increase his yield, but will enable him to provide well for his family.

CEVI has reached out to many farmers to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not only loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and farm necessities

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer O., 30 years old and married with 2 children, has a beauty salon where she makes hair for her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Driving a motorbike taxi is part of 41-year-old Prom C.’s daily routine. He normally gets up in the late morning to pick up passengers and merchandise. He brings his daily income home to meet his hungry family’s needs in the evening. He currently lives with his wife and their two children in a small house in Siem Reap Province. In addition, his wife works selling fish in the market. 
Prom C. has been using his motor for a long time. Recently, he is earning less money than before because his motor is not attractive. Therefore, he has decided to seek a Kiva loan of $1000 in order to buy a new motorbike to replace the existing one. 
He and his wife are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Madina Nalwoga‘S Group

texts.en:
Madina is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 43 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 22, both in school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Madina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells cereals in Owino Market and doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She has been in this business for the last seven years and works six days a week. She sells to an average of thirty people a day and sells to all categories of people. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family.

Madina has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more beans, maize and groundnuts (peanuts). Madina is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more beans, maize and groundnuts

loans.name: Sear

texts.en: Sear R., 50, has been involved in the weaving business, with a typical income of US $3 per day, since 2005, at her village in Takeo province. The Cambodian weaving method requires hard work and a long time to produce the best outputs for competitive prices at markets. R. is married and lives with her husband, who has been a local farmer since 1979.  Her 4 children are all involved in her business as weavers also. Since there is enough labor force in her family with the skill to achieve the goals of her current business, R. wants to take a loan, for the first time, of US $500 from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase more raw silk to produce silk textiles. Her perspective is that she wants to have an additional business of selling groceries when she succeeds with her current business plan.

loans.use: To buy raw silk for weaving.

loans.name: Eba

texts.en: Eba S. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Eba owns and operates a fishing business, primarily fishing and selling seafoods to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Eba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eba is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business to use as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to expand her product offering

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema P.'s main source of income comes from selling cosmetics and clothing products in her community. She is 27 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. Gema has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gema joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Gema is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 8 hijos  (2 a su cargo) Guillermina no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, vive en la comunidad de Urani Marca Kollo. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace años, obtuvo un préstamo  inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  para aumentar a su capital para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para aumentar a su capital para la compra de ganado mayor para engorde, La Sra. Guillermina se ayuda también con su chacra.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Guillermina belongs to the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank, which is located in the Camicachi community, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 49, married, and she has eight children (two still under her care). Guillermina did not have the opportunity to go to school. She lives in the Urani Marco Kollo community. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for years. She used her initial loan for 300 PEN to buy small livestock. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy large livestock to fatten. Guillermina also helps on her farm. Her wish is to keep working. She likes the savings and the talks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana W. is currently in the business of selling bread and tea in the restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock sugar and bread. Twenty-five years old and married to a soldier, Susanna has four children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stocking sugar and bread for sale

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly M., 45 years old, is married woman and mother. Currently, Ly M. stays at home to be responsible of a daily routine: she cares for the children and cooks delicious meal for family. The family’s current expenses is contributed by her husband’s business, he drives a trailer taxi(tuk tuk). This couple has given birth to six children who are single people. Three of their children are employed: one is a taxi driver and two are garment workers. Ly M. hopes to encourage her unemployed daughter to have an occupation as a grocery seller at the market, but she is not money to operate this activities. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan of US$200 which enable to her daughter use to begin selling grocery item. Note: Ly M.'s husband appears in the picture over.

loans.use: To begin selling grocery item

loans.name: Yaye Faty

texts.fr:
Madame Yaye Faty T. vend régulièrement des tissus à Camberene, une banlieue au nord de Dakar et non loin de la mer.  Sa journée de travail commence généralement a 9h et se termine a 17h.  Avec cette crédit, elle envisage élargir son marche, diversifier ses produits et augmenter son revenu  de 50.000 frs par mois.  Elle a deux enfants et elle est mariée. 

Madame T. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit a des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires..  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs.
texts.en:
Ms. Yaye Faty T. regularly sells cloth in Camberene, a suburb in northern Dakar and not far from the ocean. Her workday generally starts at 9:00 AM and ends at 5:00 PM. With this loan, she envisions expanding her market, diversifying her goods, and increasing her revenues of 50,000 francs a month. She has two children and is married. Ms. T. is a beneficiary of the agreement between U-IMCEC and the PDEF (program for child and family development) Seydina Issa Laye. The PDEF seeks to reduce poverty within the community and especially to protect children born of destitute families. Thanks to this cooperation, the parents of these children can take advantage of loans having more flexible terms compared to ordinary loans. Since the agreement's start in December 2008, there have been 120 parents who received financing in amounts ranging from 50,000 to 150,000 francs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha runs a provisions store by the roadside in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Martha has been in business for some years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. Martha wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Serigne Ckeikh Mbacke

texts.fr: Monsieur D. est un frigoriste qui travaille dans la réparation vente de réfrigérateur qu'il achète dans les conteneur en provenance de l'étranger. cette activité lui permet d'avoir quelques revenus pour s'occuper de sa petite famille.ce prêt va entrer dans le renforcement et l'acquisition de nouveaux matériaux  destinés à son travail
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a refrigeration specialist who works in repairing refrigerators, which he buys from the containers arriving from abroad.  This business allows him to have some income to take care of his small family.  This loan is going into bolstering his supplies and equipment and acquiring new ones for his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair and sell refrigerators

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales sólo uno vive con ella. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Por más D. 20 años se ha dedicado a la venta D. verduras en los exteriores del mercado D. Cayaltí. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a la economía D. su hogar ya que su esposo actualmente recibe una pensión D. jubilación que no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares. Ella nos cuenta que empieza desD. muy temprano en la mañana comprando las verduras a los distribuidores mayoristas para luego ofrecérselas a sus clientes durante el día.

Margarita desea comprar más verduras para satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes pero no pueD. comprar algunas variedades debido a que están a un precio muy elevado y el capital con el que cuenta no es suficiente para adquirirlas. Por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más granD. anhelo es ver convertido a su hijo en un buen profesional por lo que desea brindarle un buena educación. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy solidaria con sus familiares y conocidos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 64 years old, married, and has 6 children. Of these only one lives with her. She lives with her family in the Cayalti district, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than 20 years she has been in the business of selling vegetables on the outskirts of the Cayalti market. This endeavor allows her to help her household economy since her husband currently receives a retirement pension which is insufficient for covering the family expenses. She tells us that she starts very early in the morning buying vegetables from the wholesale distributors in order to offer them to her clients during the day.

Margarita wishes to buy more vegetables in order to satisfy the demand from her clients, but she can’t buy some varieties because their price is too high and she lacks sufficient capital to acquire them. This is why she finds herself for the first time applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN.

Her greatest desire is to see her son become a good professional, and so she wishes to proviD. him with a good education. She is a hard-working woman who is very devoted to her family and acquaintances.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in order to expand business

loans.name: Centro De Salud Group

texts.es: El grupo “Centro D. Salud” esta representado por la señora Ines y conformado por 17 miembros los cuales se caracterizan por ser personas que buscan progresar en las distintas actividades que realizan para poder cumplir con sus familias y con sus obligaciones. Entre las actividades que realizan las socias se encuentra la venta D. pan, D. comida, cosméticos, refrescos, empanadas y el resto D. las socias se dedican a al transporte público y como empleadas en empresas varias. En cuanto al entorno competitivo es alto, ya que todos tienen que trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante sus negocios. El crédito lo destinaran a la mejora D. sus negocios y a ala adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas para un mejor trabajo y generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.  Algunas D. las socias ya tienen experiencia trabajando con grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a quien le dan las gracias por la confianza depositada y el apoyo económico que necesitaban para salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Centro D. Salud group is represented by Ines. It is comprised of 17 members who are characterized as being people who look to progress in the different activities they do in order to be able to meet their families’ needs and their obligations. Among the activities that they do you will find selling bread, food, cosmetics, soft drinks, and empanadas. The rest of the members work in public transportation or as employees in various businesses. As far as competition goes, it is high. All of them have to work hard to be able to get ahead in their businesses. The loan is to improve their businesses and to acquire merchandise, supplies, and tools to do better work and generate better income. They do this to give their families a better quality of life. Some of the members already have experience working with communal banks thanks to loans with institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. They are grateful to Agrocapital for having confidence in them and for the economic support they needed to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
A business-minded woman, Emily L., 50 years old, is a mother of three children. She is also a woman of strong faith to overcome all challenges to achieve her dreams. She is married to Eusebio L., a company driver.  She lives in Tanay, in the province of Rizal, Philippines. 

With her faith to get out of poverty, in 1999 she decided to join ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines, for a chance to get start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loan with ASHI, she carefully invested in the sewing business. The profit is what she uses for daily expenses and for her children's education.

Now on her eighth loan, she proposes a loan of PHP 40,000.00 pesos for a broader business. Specifically, the amount will be use to purchase an overlock sewing machine (serger), a high-speed sewing machine, assorted cloth, threads and other supplies. She is very disciplined in using the money that was lent to her in her previous loans from ASHI. 

She still dreams of the best for her family:  to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. During almost 10 years in ASHI, Emily has shown herself to be hard working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true. She hopes that her business will expand so she can save for the future. Now, she is happy seeing that the loans from ASHI change their lives and accommodate their financial means needed to support her family. She wishes ASHI and all lenders all the best and want them to keep on supporting her family and other families who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a serger, a high-speed sewing machine, assorted cloth, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
EL SR. WALTER M. ES UN CLIENTE QUE TIENE COMO OFICIO MECANICO DE VIASION Y SE DEDICA TAMBIEN A LA AGRICULTURA QUE ES LA ACTIVIDA QUE LE BRINDA MAS INGRESOS 
 ES UN CLIENTE MUY ESFORZADO Y EN ESTE CRDITO PRETENDE COMPLETAR CON EL PRESTAMO PARA COMPRAR UN TERRENO PARA LA SIEMBRA DE ARROZ 
 EN LA FOTO APARESE EN SU SENTRO DE LABORES JUNTO A UNO DE LOS AVIONES
texts.en:
Walter is a client who is an airplane mechanic by trade and he also works in agriculture, which is the work that brings him the most income.

He is a very hardworking client who wants this loan to buy a plot of land to grow rice.

In the photo he appears in his workplace along with one of the planes.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Sakha

texts.fr: Madame Sakha F. célibataire et mère d’un enfant âgé de onze ans est une femme de ménage dans une école supérieure depuis presque 2 ans.  Elle est très connue  également dans la vente de produits cosmétiques et habits pour bébés. Cette femme née en 1972  s’approvisionne jusqu’en Mauritanie  et les place à sa clientèle composée même de commerçants et d’amis. Elle souhaite  un financement de 200 000 FCFA pour acheter ses produits, assurer le transport et les frais de douane. Elle ne s’active, dit- elle, que pour satisfaire les besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sakha F. was born in 1972. She's single and the mother of one 11-year-old child. She's been a cleaner in a superior school for almost two years. She's also very well known for selling cosmetics and baby clothing. She gets her supplies in Mauritania, and sells them to her customers, comprising merchants and friends. She's seeking a loan to buy new products, and to pay for transportation and customs taxes. She says she works to support her child.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and baby clothing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a grocery store. He’s 26 years old and single, and he passed the primary level of school.  

The purpose of this loan is to develop and enlarge his store and and to buy groceries, such as canned food and miscellaneous foods, to sell to his customers. He has been working for five years and has raised his income and the income of his parents, as well. This young guy has a lot of ambitions in his life. He can manage to achieve his goal through this profession. He has earned a fine reputation despite his young age. His shop is full of ready-to-eat food and all the neighbors are shopping at his store.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for his shop

loans.name: Sosan's Group

texts.en:
Sosan baji is 52-year-old married lady. She has been a citizen of a city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 25 years. She is a hard-working lady who works in a hospital. Her husband is a janitor in a school and has 20 years' experience. They built their house with their earnings 10 years ago. They have a single daughter and her name is Nazia. She got her education up to 10th standard and then did a beautician course. Seeing her interest in that field, they have decided to open a beauty parlor for her. Therefore they need a loan to buy the required items such as cosmetics and a hair dryer. 

Sosan is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Asia baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and rice for her husband's food-selling business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Sabira baji wants a loan to buy repair tools for her motor workshop.


Note: Sosan baji is seated in front on the left and the other members are helping Asia baji who is seated second on the right, sewing clothes.

loans.use: To start a beauty parlor

loans.name: Christine Jerop

texts.en:
Christine Jerop T., 41, is a single mother of three children.  She is a farmer who plants maize for resale in in Eldoret, Kenya.  Christine has been farming for ten years.  She also sell vegetables to her neighbors, who are her major clients.

Christine was introduced to KADET by an existing client and this will be her second loan. With the loan she plans to work on her farm and plant and harvest more maize for income.

Her goal is to become a better farmer, feed and educate her children and pay their medical bills.

loans.use: Plant and harvest maize.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a widowed woman with nine children between the ages 37 and 30, and eight grandchildren. With the ksh. 30,000 loan, she hopes to purchase cement, sand, stones, and paint to repair houses for renting. She has been in the rental housing business for three years and hopes to install piped water and electricity some day. She also has a small grocery stall where she sells vegetables and food. 

She decided to work with Yehu because she wanted to uplift her family life. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She says that, back when she got married, she used to stay with her husband at his shamba (farm) in the country and would get food easily. Life in the city is different because everything costs money.

loans.use: To purchase cement, sand, stones and paint for repairing her rental house.

loans.name: Gulburak Egenberdieva Group

texts.ru:
Гулбурак 32 года. У нее трое детей, их воспитывает одна, т.к. она несколько лет назад развелась. Двое сыновей учатся в школе, дочь дома. Клиент занимается разведением КРС и МРС, этот кредит она хочет использовать на закуп цемента, чтобы отремонтировать своей дом. Сейчас у нее есть две коровы и два теленка. Также она продает молоко и молочные продукты. 

Айгул, 25, замужем. Ее супруг работает наемным сельскохозяйственным рабочим, а клиент разводит скот. На всю сумму кредита клиент планирует купить МРС. В планах она собирается родить ребенка.

Рустамбеку 35 лет. Его супруга домохозяйка и у него 4 детей. Только старшая дочь учится в школе, остальные все дома. За ними приглядывает их мать. Он занимается животноводством. КЛиент собирается купить одного быка для откорма.

Алтынай, 25. Она пока не замужем. Клиент работает в сельской управе ведущим специалистом. В сельской управе она работает чуть более года, до этого работала учительницей. Клиент планирует кредит потратить на весениий посев.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulburak is 32 years old. She has three children, whom she is raising on her own because she got divorced several years ago. Two of her sons go to school, and the daughter is at home. The client is involved in breeding cattle and small livestock. She wants to use this loan to buy cement in order to repair her house. Currently, Gulburak has two cows and two calves. She also sells milk and dairy products. Aygul is 25 years old, married. Her husband works as an agricultural worker for-hire, and the client breeds livestock. She plans to use the whole sum of the loan to purchase small livestock. She also plans to have a child. Rustambek is 35 years old. His wife is a homemaker, and he has 4 children. Only the oldest daughter goes to school, and the rest stay at home. Their mother looks after them. Rustambek is involved in animal husbandry. The client plans to buy one sheep for fattening. Altynai is 25 years old. She is not married yet. The client works as a specialist at the village administration office. She has been working there for just over a year and previously worked as a teacher. The client plans to spend the loan for the spring sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand T-shirts, adult pants, towels and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
María de 48 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Ella vende waype (en la foto aparecen los retazos con que utiliza para hacer los waype) a las ferreterías (almacén de repuestos, construcción y remodelación de casas) de Guayaquil. 

Antes de comenzar a vender waype, trabajaba en una textilera pero como tenia la frustrante idea de tener su propio negocio ella invirtió sus ahorros comprando retazos y convirtiéndolos en waype. Cada libra de waype los vende a $ 1.80.

Para tener mas producción ella quiere comprar mas retazos de ropa con el préstamo.  En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
María, 48, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (started out as a field where many orchids grew), Guayaquil. She sells waype (rags) to hardware stores, replacement parts shops, construction sites and for home remodeling. (In the photo you can see the remnants she uses to make the waypes). Prior to selling waype, she worked as a textile worker but she was frustrated by the desire to have her own business. She used her savings to buy remnants and turned them into waype. Each pound of waype sells for $1.80. In order to increase production she wants to buy more fabric remnants with the loan. In the future, she’s like to finish building her house and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric remnants.

loans.name: Karolina

texts.es: Karolina, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus esposo Víctor de 33 años y sus 4 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarle un mejor futuro. Sus días los pasa trabajando en sus cultivos, ella es muy dedicada y pone todo su esfuerzo en que sus cultivos tengan la mayor calidad posible, esta actitud ha hecho que sus plantaciones de plátano, café y cacao, sean muy solicitados en el mercado de Pichanaki, que es donde lleva a vender sus productos. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que le gusta cosechar, pero el tener que transportar sus productos le resulta muy pesados los sacos que tiene que cargar. En adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su grupo comunal, en donde es muy apreciada por ser muy alegre y mantiene a las compañeras muy unidas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Karolina, age 30, is a very hard-working and loving mother. She lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband, Víctor, and their four minor children. She wishes to give the children a better life. She spends her days working with her crops. She is very dedicated, and she puts all of her effort into making her crops be of the best possible quality. This attitude has made her banana, coffee, and cacao crops very much in demand in the Pichanaki market. That is where she takes her products to sell them. She has been doing this activity for ten years. She likes to harvest, but having to transport her products is difficult because the bags she has to carry are very heavy. Later, she hopes to buy more land to increase her production. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments, and she has never had problems with her communal bank. She is highly regarded in her communal bank because she is very happy, and she is very united with her colleagues. She will use the 2,000 PEN she is requesting to buy fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Yorng

texts.en: Yorng S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantation. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband produces palm sugar to sell for an income of USD 3 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase stones to manufacture small mills, traditionally used as a kitchen utensil. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because she was not available.

loans.use: To buy stones to manufacture small mills

loans.name: Kiranta Enole

texts.en:
Kiranta Enole S. is 33 years old. She is married to Naseyian Nkurumwa and is the mother of two school-aged children. She has been farming on her own piece of land for the last five years.

Kiranta learned about KADET through an awareness program run by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 50,000 KES to prepare the land and plant wheat. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a larger piece of land. Her future dream is to be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she can do commercial farming. Kiranta believes she is hardworking and only needs the necessary resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: to prepare the land and plant wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase extra slippers to sell

loans.name: Akilimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe AKILIMAYA est  constitué de six femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans,  4 enfants et  vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à KABOILA II,  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur quatrième cycle en collaboration avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des produits alimentaires en générale  tels que la vente d’atiéké  avec MARIAM D.. 
MARIAM D., qui est un des membres du groupe, compte acheter avec son  prêt 8 sacs d’atiéké.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et souvent en Côte d’Ivoire. Elle revend au  marché de Mancourani I et en famille à une clientèle composée  de femmes et hommes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The group named Akilimaya is made up of six married women with an average age of 29. They each have four children and the majority of the members live in polygamous families in Kaboila II, a district of the village of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth loan cycle with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). They wish to fill the demands of their clientele. All their past loans have been successfully repaid. This group of women sell general food products, such as atiéké (granulated casava) with Mariam D.. Mariam D. is a member of the group and with her loan she will purcahse 8 sacks of atiéké. She makes her purchaes in the large market in the city of Sikasso, though she goes to Ivory Coast. She resells her merchandise in the Mancourani I market and to her family. Her clientele is made up of both men and money and she finalizes her sales in cash and often on credit. She hopes to earn 40.000 francs every month, of which a part will be put towards the family's expenses and another part will be reinvested back in to the business. Her ambitions are to increase her working capital to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase atiéké

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from Murang'a town in central Kenya. He has been farming for eighteen years and employs two farmhands. His mixed farm produces bananas, maize and beans which he sells at a local market. He is also employed.

David has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank. He says that, by storing rain water, this will help him save time and energy looking for water and will ensure the survival of his bananas during the dry seasons. His biggest challenge has been poor weather patterns that affects his production.

David is 48 years old and is married with one school-aged child.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes G. G. tiene 60 anos. Es casada y vive con sus hijos en el Cantón de San Pablo en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Mercedes es socia del grupo ¨Integracion Microempresarial¨ de San Pablo de Atenas. Son 14 socios en total, la mayoría que se dedican a diferentes actividades como comercio, negocios, y agricultores como fuente de ingreso a sus familias.

Mercedes se dedica a criar chanchos, pollos, y cuyes. Vende sus cuyes en su casa. Después de engordar sus chanchos, se venden para las fiestas y los Domingos. 

Solicita el crédito para darles comida a sus chanchos y poner un chancearía. Con la ayuda del préstamo va a mejorar la vida de su esposo, ella, y su hijo. 

Su sueno es poder vivir mejor y seguir trabajando en la vida. 

El crédito de la Cooperativa San Jose le ayuda mucho
texts.en:
Mercedes G. G. is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her children in the canton of San Pablo in the province of Bolivar. She has 4 children.

Mercedes is a member of the group "Integracion Microempresarial" (Integrated Microbusinesses) in San Pablo de Atenas. There are 14 members in the group, and they work at different activities such as businesses, trades, and agriculture as a source of income for their families.

Mercedes' work is raising hogs, chickens, and guinea pigs. She sells the guinea pigs from her house. After fattening the hogs, she sells them for parties and Sundays.

She is applying for the loan to buy feed for her hogs and to set up a butcher's shop. With the help of the loan, she is going to improve her life and those of her husband and her son.

Her dream is to be able to live better and continue working in life.

The loan from the San Jose Cooperative helps her a lot.

loans.use: Feed her hogs and set up a butcher's shop.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca tiene 60 años, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de atol los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en el mercado. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 25 años, desde joven ayudándole a vender a su mama que era la que originalmente tenía el negocio. Por lo que diariamente almacena leche para la elaboración de sus deliciosos atoles. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  más mercancía como leche, azúcar, arroz, canela y leña que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus atoles. Su meta es llegar a mejorar las condiciones del negocio y hogar.
texts.en: Francisca is 60 years old, she makes"atol" (a thick, masa based drink)  which she sells as a street vendor at the market. She began this business 25 years ago. Her mother originally had this business and from a young age she would help her mother. She stocks milk daily to make her delicious atoles. This loan will be used to purchase more ingredients such as milk, sugar, rice, cinnamon and wood which are necessary to maker her atoles. Her goal is to be able to improve the conditions of her business and her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda M. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sugarcane farm.  She lives in Zone 3, Barangay Tinongan, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard on her sugarcane farm, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of about $238. 

Merlinda is borrowing 20,000 PHP to use to fund her farming operations. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her sugarcane farm

loans.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Máyela de 34 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la  crianza de cerdos y también administra una tienda, ella vive con sus hijos es madre soltera y tiene 7 hijos de 15, 12, 11, 9, 8, 6 y 5 años de edad, todos dependen de sus ingresos, el negocio inicio con la ayuda de su madre, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos, no tiene horario para realizar el trabajo pero cuenta con experiencia. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y además mercadería para la tienda, con esta inversión ella quiere mejorar la condición de su negocio y proveer a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar, así también con los cerdos ella quiere alimentarlos bien y que al momento de la venta se los compren a buen precio.
Su principal propósito es realizar una buena inversión con el préstamo para recibir ingresos que le ayuden a solventar las necesidades del hogar y de esta manera darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Máyela is 34 yeas old and resides in San Rafael Orient in the department of San Miguel.  She raises pigs and also runs a store.  She is a single mother living with her seven children ages 15, 12, 11, 9, 8, 6 and 5, who all depend on her income.  The business was set up with her mother's help and her children lend a hand at work too.  She has no specific working hours, but has a lot of experience.

She requests a loan to buy pigs and goods for the store.  With this investment she hopes to improve her business and provide her customers with a range of household items.  She also wants to feed her pigs properly to be able to sell them at the best price.

Her main goal for the loan is to be able to invest in goods that will help pay for household needs so she can provide the best care for her children.

loans.use: To buy pigs and store merchandise

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Agbagansi

texts.fr: Elle a 42 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle contribue au foyer  en faisant la vente de céréales et de condiments. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et compte dans cette activité 22 ans d’expérience. Elle revend ensuite à Attiégou. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 20 bols de maïs, 10 tas d’igname, 3 paniers de piments et tomates.
texts.en: She is 42 years old and mother of 2 children.  She contributes to the household by selling cereals and condiments. She stocks up in Lomé and has 22 years of experience in this activity.  She then resells in Attiégou.  She is requesting a loan to buy 20 bowls of corn, 10 piles of yams, 3 baskets of chili peppers and tomatoes.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and condiments

loans.name: Enrique Florentino

texts.es:
Enrique de 49 años, viviendo en una zona en Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento había muchas flores orquídeas) aprendió de su abuelo y padre cuando él era joven hacer ladrillos. Decidió hacer ladrillos no solo para mantener a su hijo sino para seguir con el legado que le dejo su abuelo y padre. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 05h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días elaborando ladrillos con panelon, jaloncillo y herramientas artesanales.  Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para su negocio. Tiene pensado en un futuro expandir su negocio y arreglar su casa para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 49, lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil (an urban neighbourhood, named for the many types of orchids that grew there when the area was first discovered). He learned to make bricks when he was young, taught by his father and grandfather. He decided to go into brick-making not just as a means to support his own son, but also to carry on the legacy of his father and grandfather.  

At present he works from 5.30 am until 5pm every day, making bricks with "panelon" and "jaloncillo" clays, and special tools. To continue with his business, he wants to use the loan to buy tools. He has thoughts of expanding the business in future, and improving his house to give his family a better future.

loans.use: Tools

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four members living in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province. The group has selected Mr. Chin I., a 37-year-old married man, as the group leader. With the loans, they hope to increase their income and improve their family's living. 

Mr. Chin I. is a motorcycle taxi driver.  From this business, he earns a little income to support his family. Currently, his motorbike is broken and he doesn’t have enough money to repair I..  He is requesting a loan to repair his motorbike. He will use the remaider of the loan to pay for medicine. His wife, Mrs. Moeun Channa, is 30 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a little salary to support her family. 

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school and the other is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To repair motorbike

loans.name: Orlando José

texts.es:
Don Orlando José L. trabaja como Higienista en el Mercado Oriental de Managua desde hace 17 años.
Es Acompañado con 4 personas a su cargo, su compañera de vida y un hijo. Su compañera trabaja como ama de casa. Solo cuenta con los ingresos de él.
Este es el crédito número 8 con CEPRODEL los que ha pagado en tiempo y forma ya que es una persona responsable. Este crédito lo necesita para compra de materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Orlando José L. has been working as a hygienist at the oriental market in Managua for 17 years.

He is accompanied by his four dependents, his life partner and his son. His partner works as a housekeeper and only counts with his income. 

This is the 8th loan he has received from field partner CEPRODEL. He has paid his previous loans on time because he is a responsible person. He needs this loan to purchase construction materials.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorena; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, ella vende pantalones, casacas, blusas y chompas, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Entrepreneurs of San Cristobal". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Her name is Lorena. She is 32 years old, married common-law, and the mother of two children. She alternates her daily activities with her clothing business. She sells independently, traveling to various locations, like the city of Puerto Maldonado. She sells pants, shirts, blouses, jackets. She wants to expand and improve her clothing business. She requests a loan to purchase clothing in wholesale. 

She is happy to receive this loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in wholesale.

loans.name: Tunashukuru Group

texts.fr: Karubamba F. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire Tunashukuru, âgée de 38 ans, mariée, mère de 12 enfants qui étudient tous, sauf le cadet. Son marie est un agent de la fonction publique. La cliente  Karubamba F. est  vendeuse des boissons (Fanta, Primus). Elle s’installe dans un dépôt relais. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds propre reçu de son mari. Il ya 4 ans qu’elle est en activité. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, et scolariser ses enfants confortablement. La cliente Karubamba F. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Tunashukuru est constitué de 45 membres.
texts.en: Karubamba F. is an entrepreneur, president of the business group Tunashukuru, 38 years old, married, and the mother of 12 children- all of whom are in school except for the youngest.  Her husband is a civil servant.  Karubamba F. sells beverages (Fanta, Primus).  She has set up shop in a small restaurant in a bus depot.  She started her own business with funds from her husband.  She has been in business for four years.  This new loan will enable her to pay the school fees for her children.  In addition, she hopes to grow her enterprise and educate her children comfortably.  Karubamba F. thanks Hekima for its initiatives dedicated to poor women excluded from formal banks.  The Tunashukuru Group is made up of 45 members.

loans.use: Paying school fees for children

loans.name: Nordo Omar

texts.es:
NORDO OMAR F. S., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA COMO OFICINISTA,  ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE TRES HIJOS Y SOLO UNO  ESTA EN EL COLEGIO.
DON NORDO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, PIEDRA Y PIEDRIN PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR UN CUARTO.
NORDO DICE QUE GRACIAS A LOS FINANCIAMIENTOS OTORGADOS POR CEPRODEL HA VENIDO MEJORANDO SU CASA DE HABITACION Y A BRINDADO MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Nordo Omar F. S. is from Managua and works as an office clerk. He is the father of three children, one of whom is in high school.

Don Nordo visited the offices of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan so that he could invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, and gravel in order to finish building a room. He says that he is grateful for the loans CEPRODEL has provided since they have allowed him to improve his home and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of a room

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 46 years old. Elizabeth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 21 años de edad. Actualmente, Vicente vive en la ciudad imperial de los Incas (Cusco Perú). Vicente junto con su pareja tienen un hijo, él es un padre responsable que dedica a la construcción civil, él es albañil y tiene un año y medio trabajando en la construcción. En esta oportunidad Vicente requiere el préstamo para aumentar el dinero para comprar una maquina mescladora. 

Vicente es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Ana Jarvis III” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Vicente was born in the city of Cusco and he’s 21 years old.  Vicente currently lives in the Imperial City of the Incas (Cusco, Perú).  He and his spouse have a son.  He is a responsible father who works in civil construction; he’s a Bricklayer and has been working in construction for a year and a half.  On this occasion Vicente needs a loan to add to his money in order to buy a cement mixer.

Vicente is a responsible person who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Ana Jarvis III” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to be able to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Lidubina es una señora trabajadora que a sus 66 años quien inicio en Adim con crédito grupal y actualmente va por su segundo crédito individual.  Ella ha trabajado de todo un poco como  vender fritanga (pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, ensaladas, gallo pinto), sopas los domingos (de pollo, de mondongo, de hueso, de queso) y bisutería actualmente. 
B. con el crédito comprara arroz, aceite, pollo, azúcar, además de materiales para la bisutería, actividad que inicio después de participar en un taller. Con ella trabajan dos de sus 7 hijos las cuales se encargan de la comida y ella solo da la sazón. 
El sueño de esta jovial señora sueña en viajar lejos y conocer México.
texts.en:
Lidubina is a hardworking woman who is 66 years old.  Her first loan with Adim was a group loan and this is her second individual loan.  She does a little bit of everything, such as sell fritanga (roasted chicken, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, salads, beans and rice), sell soup on Sundays ( chicken, tripe, bone marrow, and cheese) and make jewelry. 

With this loan she will purchase rice, cooking oil, chicken, sugar, and supplies to make jewelry, an activity she started after attending a workshop.  Two of her 7 children work with her.  They are in charge of the cooking and she does the seasoning.  Her dream of this jovial woman is to travel far and visit Mexico.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, chicken, sugar, and materials for jewelry making.

loans.name: Walberto Rafael

texts.es: Walberto Rangel es un hombre de 32 años que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y tiene una peluquería donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal y profesional a todos sus clientes mediante cortes de cabello, peinados y asesorías sobre el uso y aplicación de productos capilares que él también vende, porque los conoce  muy bien y quiere ofrecer a sus clientes un servicio integral. Aunque walberto inició su negocio de una manera muy informal motilando a sus amigos bajo un frondoso árbol, él ha avanzado mucho, porque una vez visionó su actividad como un negocio,  lo ubicó en un espacio en la vivienda de su madre y en la actualidad ya tiene un local  mas adecuado en ese mismo lugar.  Su meta es continuar ampliándolo y para ello recurre a su credikiva,  que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará productos de peluquería como tintes, gel, laca shampoo, que utiliza como sus   insumos,  como para vender  a los clientes a quien orienta a cerca de cuales productos son apropiados de acuerdo con sus características. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus dos pequeños hijos con mucha educación para que sean unos ciudadanos exitosos en su futuro y tenga grandes posibilidades en el mercado laboral.
texts.en:
Walberto Rangel is 32 years old and lives in Cartagena de Indias.  He has a barber shop where he offers personal and professional improvement services to his customers through haircuts, styling, and applying of hair care products which he also sells.  He is well acquainted with them and wants to offer his customers a comprehensive service.  Even though Walberto started his business informally, motivated by his friends under a leafy tree, he has advanced it greatly because he saw it as a business and located it in a space in his mother’s home.  Now he has a better location in the same place.

His goal is to continue expanding, so he need this Kiva loan.  This will be his first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he will use the money to buy hair products and supplies, such as hair coloring, gel, and shampoo.  He sells these to customers and shows them which are best for them based on their hair.

His dream is to watch his children grow up with lots of education so that can be successful citizens in the future, and so that they will have good opportunities in the labor market.

loans.use: to buy haircare products for his barber shop

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Natividad is the coordinator of her group, Rayo de Luz 1 & 2 (Ray of Light), located in the rural area surrounding La Romana. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her six children, as a single mom, dedicated to work to help them.

Natividad is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business where she makes traditional candies, made with coconut or milk, to sell in her community. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and provide for them.

She started doing her business almost one year ago with some money she saved, and as soon as she began selling, she was invited to become part of the group. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, coconut, etc.

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Senderos está formado por 10 mujeres amables, cordiales y sobre todo muy trabajadoras, que se desempeñan en sus trabajos como en su hogar sin descuidarse de ningún detalle. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que cautiva a propios y extraños por la belleza arquitectónica y natural, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amable y cordial mantienen su cultura y tradición.

La Señora. Eliana vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre y tiene una bebé de 6 meses. Su esposo labora como conserje y mensajero de un colegio de la ciudad, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en el mismo colegio el cual cuidan.
 
La Señora. Eliana hace 6 meses se dedica a la venta de productos Avon y Lébel, productos que vende a sus amigas y conocidas.

Es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, etc. Fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte del banco comunal.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Los niños que están en la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The “Nuevos Senderos” (New Paths) communal bank is composed of ten kind, cordial and, above all, very hard working women who carry out their work like they do in their homes: not missing a single detail.  They live in different parts of the city of Cuenca, a city that captivates natives and foreigners alike with its architectural and natural beauty, its cuisine that captivates visitors’ palates, its kind and cordial inhabitants who maintain their culture and traditions.

Eliana, 22, lives in Cuenca.  She has a spouse and a 6-month-old baby.  Her husband works as a caretaker and messenger at a local school.  They do not own a house; they live at the same school they take care of.

Eliana started selling Avon and L’Bel products six months ago, products that she sells to her friends and acquaintances.

This is the first loan she’s taken out in the communal bank and will invest it in perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.  She was invited to become part of the communal bank by her mother-in-law.

Her dream is to have a house of her own and to study a university career.  

The children that appear in the photo are children of the members.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a hardworking man who is married and has 4 children. Juma is engaged in animal husbandry. He has 5 cattle and 12 sheep. Besides this business, he also cultivates vegetables. Using the profits from the business, he plans to repair his house. 

Juma would like to get a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase sheep and to expand his business.  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana pertenece al grupo “UNIDAS EN EL TRABAJO”  integra el grupo cerca D. un año,  son  9 socias todas tratan D. salir adelante cada una en su negocio respectivo, ella se dedica a la venta D. pan  el cual reparte por varias zonas del distrito ella empezó a trabajar debido a la enfermedad D. su esposo y por sacar adelante a sus  05 hijos  lo que gana no es mucho pero es una ayuda para algunos gastos D. la casa y para terminar la construcción D. su casa  algo que quiere lograr en el tiempo mas corto con su préstamo quiere mejorar su negocio y añadir a la venta D. pan  la venta D. pasteles D. esa manera tener mas clientela y  variedad para ofrecer.

  *Sebastiana es la segunda D. la derecha viste chaleco rosado.
texts.en:
Sebastiana has belonged to the "Unidas en el Trabajo" ["United in Work"] group for about one year. There are 9 members in total and each one tries to get ahead in her own business. Sebastiana sells bread, which she distributes in various zones in the district. She started to work because her husband was ill, and in order to get her 5 children ahead. She does not earn much, but it helps with the household costs and with the termination of their home's construction. She hopes that this will occur soon. With this loan, she wants to improve her business and start selling bread and pastries. This way, she will have more customers and a greater variety to offer.

   *Sebastiana is the second on the right, wearing a pink jacket.

loans.use: to purchase cakes

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 40 years old and lives in the city of Ambato, Ecuador. She is married and has five children aged 25, 21, 18, 12, and 11 years old. Dolores enjoys helping others. Her business is the production of berries. It is currently the low season for berry production and she needs this loan to help her plant more berries for the high season and take care of her current plants with fertilizer. 

Dolores began her business as part of a community development project sponsored by FODEMI and their global partner World Vision International. The project was started five years ago and it interested Dolores so much that she is still investing in it. Four of her children help her with the work. This is Dolores’ first loan and she hopes it will help her increase production and increase her income.

loans.use: cultivate her berry farm

loans.name: Siguitemasson Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SIGUITEMASSON III sont de femmes mariées  qui ont en moyenne 30 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent dans des familles polygames à Koula, l’un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, SANATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Les femmes du groupe SIGUITEMASSON III comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the SIGUITEMASSON III group are married women with an average age of 30 and an average of 5 children, and they live in polygamous families in Koula, one of the villages of the rural commune of Banco, in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region, the 2nd administrative region of Mali.
They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to be able to better organize their activities in the beginning of overwintering. The crops grown are rice and peanuts. They are on their first loan with the institution.
With this loan, Sanata, the woman in the middle of the seated row, hopes to buy agricultural inputs and small farming equipment, and pay for labor and weeding to maintain approximately half a hectare of rice and peanuts
The harvested crops are sold at the markets in Baou, Koula, Banco, and N'Golobougou to a customer base made up of both men and women. The women in the SIGUITEMASSON III group hope to make an average profit of 30,000 FCFA per cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and small farming equipment.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 31 years old, married and has 2 children in school. She operates a cafeteria so as to earn a living for her family. She started her business 2 years ago and has employed one person. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained in business management. This has helped her to run her business well.
Lucy hopes to open a restaurant in the future. She has requested 50,000 KES to buy utensils.

loans.use: to buy utensils

loans.name: Jose Rubén

texts.es: El señor José Rubén se dedica al transporte público de esta misma ciudad desde hace 12 años, trasladando a la gente de un lugar a otro. En este momento el camión donde hace sus rutas necesita mantenimiento por eso quiere un préstamo para comprar las partes que necesita y pagar al mecánico que le hará el trabajo. José Rubén desea tener su unidad en mejores condiciones para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio, de esta manera prevenir un accidente a causa de un problema técnico. El oficio de chofer que el desempeña lo realiza con gusto ya que es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostén familiar.
texts.en: José Rubén has worked in the public transport business in this same city for 12 years, moving people from one place to another. In this moment the bus where he run his routes needs maintenance, which is why he wants a loan to buy the parts that he needs and to pay the mechanic to do the job. José Rubén desires to have his unit in better conditions to offer his customers better service and prevent an accident due to a technical problem. He performs his occupation as a chauffeur with gusto, since it is the only source of income to support the family.

loans.use: to repair his bus.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 31 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages 2 and 6.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has engaged in the business for eleven years.  So far, he has expanded his business and has employed two people.  He decided to leave his previous employment and went into business so that he would earn enough income to meet his family’s demand.

Naftal has been able to increase his business stock with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his shop in the future.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice, soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 40 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Flora requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business and purchasing more bread to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old hardworking business man. For the last three years, he has been managing a retail shop and also supplying bread to earn a living. He has employed two people to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to manage a supermarket.  John is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more bread for resale.

loans.use: buy bread

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité denominado Mujeres luchadoras es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, está integrado por 18 mujeres, las cuales se encuentran actualmente en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se unieron con el propósito de buscar un mejor porvenir para sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Silvina, ella tiene una despensa, la cual explota desde hace ya un buen tiempo, este es el medio principal por el cual ella sustenta a su familia y cubre los gastos que diariamente surgen en la casa. Comenta que tiene buena clientela, lo cual le genera muy buenos ingresos, por lo que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicita su crédito, para la compra de bebidas como ser vinos, whiskys, cervezas, comestibles como ser cárnicos, embutidos pollos, hortalizas, lácteos y otros, para el abastecimiento de su negocio, con lo que podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee, called Mujeres Luchadoras, is from the city of Caaguazú.  It is made up of 18 women who are currently in their sixth loan cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's entrepreneurial women's program.  They got together with the goal of seeking a better future for their families.

One of the members is Silvina.  She has a small grocery store that she has been running for a while now.  It is the main means by which she supports her family and covers her daily household expenses.  She says she has good customers who generate a very good income for her.  For that reason, she wants to keep investing in her business, which is why she is asking for this loan to buy drinks, food products, and other things to stock her store.  This will allow her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase herbs, chickens, cold cuts, meat, dairy products, and drinks

loans.name: Beatriz Virginia

texts.es:
Beatriz Virginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo en edad escolar.  La señora estudio educación superior.

Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanía en bordados.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,700.00 nuevo soles comprará bordados en bayeta y lanas para su respectivo negocio.

Su sueño de la señora es tener una casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los temas respecto al negocio y el compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
Beatriz Virginia is a member of the Communal Bank “Aymaras Juli II” which is located in the District of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 32 years old, single, and has a child who is in school. Sra. Beatriz received her higher education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was in the amount of 300 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling embroidered handicrafts.

With this new loan of 1700 PEN, she will buy embroideries made of cloth and wool for her business. Her dream is to have a house of her own. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the business-related seminars and being able to share with the other members.

loans.use: to buy embroideries made of cloth and wool.

loans.name: Bolamuki Plus Group

texts.en:
Ntunuwe is a leader of a community bank named “Bolamuki Plus.”   It is composed of 20 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to develop their businesses. 

Ntunuwe is 38 years old, married and the mother of four children whose ages vary between 6 and 16.  All of them go to school. 

Ntunuwe’s main activity is selling spices.  She has acquired solid experience and runs her business in the western area of Kinshasa.  Her business brings in a profit of $20 per week.

After learning from her friend about Hope’s loan program, she decided to join one of its groups.

With her next loan she is planning to purchase more spices to increase her inventory to generate additional profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar tiene 24 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 1 hija, vive con la esposa y con la hija de 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Julio se dedica a la Agricultura siembra de maíz, arroz hace 6 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura comprare semillas, fertilizantes, con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar  insumos.
El sueño es poderse compra un carro, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. 
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.

Con el crédito anterior ha podido invertir en la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arroz. la producción ha aumentado, la relación y el estilo de vida de la familia ha mejorado, los ingresos han sido notorios porque puede aportar para el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is 24 years old. He has a common-law wife and one daughter. He lives with his wife and his daughter, age 5, in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Rios province. 

The "JERUSALEN" communal bank is located in the district of El Caimito, which belongs to Puerto Pechiche parish in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of this communal bank work in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas. 

Julio has worked in agriculture for 6 years, growing corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture, buying seeds and fertilizers. The loan will help him buy supplies. 

His dream is to be able to buy a car. He has not faced any kind of problem. In his free time, he likes to play sports. 

With the previous credit, he was able to invest in his corn, bean and rice crops. His production has increased, and his family's relationships and standard of living have improved. The income has been especially important because he can contribute to the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is from the village of Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Chona is married and has two school-aged children.

To make a living, Chona owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Chona has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from these activities.
