Chona is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

In 2010, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost paid for maintenance and repair of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel cuenta con 68 años de edad, es viuda ahora solo tiene la manutención de ella ya que todos sus hijos son independientes solo vive dos nietas ya mayores de edad, ella cuenta con pequeño negocio de refrescos ya tiene 7 años con el negocio e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de refrescos, aguas de bote, jugos, etc. Espera que el préstamo le ayude para incrementar el negocio ya que esta muy contenta porque su negocio esta saliendo adelante.
texts.en: Isabel is 68 years old and only has to support herself since her children are all independent now; she lives just with two adult granddaughters.  She has had a small beverage business for seven years and will use her loan to buy soft-drinks, canned drinks, juices, etc.  She hopes that the loan will help her increase her business since she’s very happy because her business is making progress.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, canned drinks, juice, etc.

loans.name: Yeison Ramiro

texts.es: A sus 20 años, el joven Yeison Ramiro trabaja desde hace un año como vendedor y distribuidor de arepas en una fabrica de su familia donde se elabora y vende a las diferentes tiendas y restaurantes este producto. Con la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar la producción de la fabrica que ha disminuido en los últimos meses por falta de capital de trabajo, el joven Yeison Ramiro necesita de la compra de insumos como maíz, carbón y bolsas con lo cual puedan sus familiares elaborar el producto y él poderlo distribuir. El sueño del joven Yeison Ramiro es ampliar la fabrica y poder generar empleos directos.
texts.en:
Yeison Ramiro is a young 20 year old man working for the last year selling and distributing arepas (Colombian corn tortillas) in a family business where he makes and sells this product to the different stores and restaurants. 

With the hope of improving his sales and increasing the amount of tortillas being made, which has been decreasing in the last months due to the lack of working capital, young Yeison Ramiro needs to buy supplies such as corn, charcoal, and bags with which his relatives can make the food and distribute it. 

The dream that the young Yeison Ramior has is to expand the business and to be able to create direct jobs.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make corn tortillas such as corn

loans.name: Jazmina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Jazmina continua con sus ventas de cosmetico y ropa, lo que tiene varios años comercializando, y logrando la captacion de clientes, es madre soltera de dos hijos estudiantes, y cada dia se esfuerzan para poder lograr mejoras de ingreso para dar lo mejor a sus hijos.
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento, comprara ropa y uniformes escolares para niña y niños ya que comenzara el ingreso a clases, y es buena temporada para las ventas, obteniendo mejores beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Jazmina continues selling cosmetics and clothing which she’s been selling for several years now and has acquired customers.  She’s a single mother of two children who are students.  She strives daily to earn better income to provide the best for her children.

Today, this new loan is to buy clothes and school uniforms for boys and girls because the new school term is starting and it’s a good season for sales thus obtaining better benefits for her family.

loans.use: to buy varied clothes and school uniforms.

loans.name: Neri Eleuteria

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició con el negocio de costura, ahora tiene también la venta de ropa.  Trabaja sola por su cuenta de lunes a domingo de 8 am a 8 pm.  Es casada y es chofer.  Tiene hijos pero no estudian en este momento.  Aspira en un futuro cercano poder tener su propio local para tener su vitrina e incrementar más sus ventas.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de blusas, camisas y otras prendas para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de ropa

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is married woman with three children, two  of whom attend school. She owns a house that  has  no electricity but  has  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and transportation  as her major challenge. Fridah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour and maize for resale . She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, wheat flour and maize for resale

loans.name: Ninfa Roselia

texts.en:
Hi my name is Ninfa Roselia. I am a merchant with a small general store located in my house named \"Pulperia Genesis\", which I have operated for two years. It generates enough income to cover our family expenses and other obligations. Currently, I need a larger variety of products since demand has increased during the holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Hola mi nombre es Ninfa Roselia, soy comerciante cuento con una pulperia, ubicada en mi casa de habitación llamada Pulperia \\\"Genesis\\\" desde hace 2 años, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y otros compromisos, actualmente se necesita un surtido mayor ya que el volumen de venta aumente en la epoca de navidad.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, butter, instant soups, sodas, chicken, dairy products, rice, beans, juices, bread, jams and other products.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en:
Nadir is an honest and hardworking person. He is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Karabag village.
Three years ago he purchased a car and became a taxi driver.
This business is the only source of his income.
Having borrowed $400 he bought spare parts.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to repair his car in order to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.
He wants to repair his car because everyone wants to travel in a smart and comfortable car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 65 year old woman with eight (8) children.  She specializes in the sale of foodstuffs to the public. She started her business 2 years ago. According to her she needs the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Leticia Mayela

texts.es:
I need to buy 2 air conditioning units because the heat is unbearable and it is worse when we are sleeping because of the mosquitoes. I would like my children to be able to sleep calmly and comfortably. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to by two air conditioning units.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de comprar 2 aparatos de aire debido a que el calor es insoportable y en las noches se siente más a la hora de dormir por los moscos, me gustaría que mis hijos duerman tranquilos y cómodos”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para comprar 2 aparatos de aire

loans.use: To purchase two air conditioning units

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
Encarnación G. is 41 years old, single, and lives with her mother and her brother. Her mother owns a small grocery store at the house since a couple of years ago. Encarnación buys and sells garlic, which she sells exclusively to sausage factories in the three cities near her town.

Encarnación wishes to acquire more garlic for this season since it is the season where sausage consumption is the highest. With the loan she is seeking, she plans to buy merchandise for her garlic business and to supply her mother’s grocery store with merchandise such as beer, soda, sugar, coffee, flour, chicken meat, oil, soap, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Encarnación G. tiene 41 años, ella es soltera viven con su madre y un hermano mayor en la casa materna. La Madre tiene una pequeña despensa en la casa desde hace varios años y Encarnación se dedica a la compra y venta de ajos, la venta ella lo realiza exclusivamente a las fábricas de embutidos de tres ciudades aledañas a la suya. Encarnación desea adquirir más ajo para esta temporada de fin de año por ser la época de mayor consumo de embutidos; el crédito que están solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para su venta (ajo) y para surtir la despensa de su madre de mercaderías como cerveza, gaseosa, azúcar, café, harina , pollo, carne, aceite, jabón, etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as garlic, beer, soda, sugar, coffee, flour, chicken meat, oil, soap, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba A. runs a general store in the busy town of Maili Moja, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam, where she sells about everything except the kitchen sink. Habiba established the business in 2005, and is requesting a loan of $350 to purchase additional stock in bulk. She and her husband Swalehe have six children, three of them grown and three under the age of 12.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not credit-worthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: he needs the loan to purchase goods

loans.name: Bahtiyer

texts.en: O. Bahtiyer was born in 1976 in the Asht region of  Tajikistan and he is married and has 2 children. Mr.O. became the client of the MicroInvest in 2008 because a friend told him how it helped him grow his business. He applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan to improve his business. Mr.O. has a home business of raising and selling livestock. He has a large flock and a pedigree bull. He is also a taxi driver. Now Mr.O. requests the loan of 2200 STJ for 8 months to purchase additional livestock.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Radiatu

texts.en:
Radiatu A., who is 30 years old and married, runs a small general store where she sells basic provisions such as rice, milk and spices. She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy a wider variety of goods for her store.

Radiatu is also a member of a lending group called “Nyame Niboa Group” that consists of 10 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy general goods

loans.name: Glenny Mariela

texts.en:
Glenny Mariela is a young entrepreneur and mother of a newborn daughter. Glenny owns and operates an Internet Center in the Itabo community of San Cristobal. The entrepreneur humbly explains that her center just has three computers for the customers. Nonetheless, she plans to use her loan to buy some used computers in order to increase the quality of the service she offers to her customers.

Glenny Mariela says she’ll keep working hard in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Purchase of used computers for an Internet Center

loans.name: Juana Leon

texts.es:
Mrs Juana belongs to the community bank Las Orquídeas, located in the street Alfonso Ugarte Cdra 7, in the district of Calleria, county of Ucayali.

She is 34 years old and has 1 child. Her husband is a carpenter. However, his income is not sufficient for the daily needs of the family. That is why Juana has decided to invest the fist loan of 300 S. she received from Manuela Ramos into a small clothes shop.

At the moment, she has a stand in the market of Bellavista. She arrives there very early in the morning to open the shop and to serve her customers. In the afternoon, she takes care of the household and her little child.

With this loan of 1,700 S that she will reimburse in 4 months she will buy clothes like 1 dozen of shirts, 2 dozens of stockings, underwear, etc. Juana feels more serene with the support that Manuela Ramos provides her through their loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas, ubicado en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Cdra. 7, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali.

Tiene 34 años es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja en madera, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Juana con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta de ropas.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto en el mercado de bellavista, se va muy temprano a su puesto para abrir y atender a sus clientes, por las tardes se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar, y atender a su pequeño hijo.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ropas como: 1 docena de polos, 2 docenas de medias, ropas interiores, biviris, etc. Juana se siente mas tranquila con el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos a través de los prestamos que recibe.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es:
Yudith, is the mother of 3 small sweet children who have become her best work incentive with earnestness she is devoted every day to her agricultural activities which absorb a great portion of her time. That is why we find her happily working at home on the selection of products, hoping that the next season will increase production every day and bring better benefits to her home. She needs seeds and fertilizers to begin a new agricultural cycle, but the cost of fertilizers are increasingly greater and her economic state limits her ability to buy them. And these are the reasons why she is contacting you, to apply for a loan and carry out her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer.

Yudith, es madre de 3 dulces pequeños quienes se han convertido en su mejor aliciente laboral, con ahínco se dedica a diario a sus labores agrícolas, actividad que le absorbe gran cantidad de tiempo. Por esa razón la encontramos trabajando en la selección de sus productos en su hogar donde muy alegremente trabaja, esperando que la próxima temporada pueda incrementar su producción y llevar cada día más y mejores beneficios a su hogar. Ahora requiere de semillas y de abonos para empezar un nuevo ciclo de cultivo pero los costos de los abonos son cada vez mayores y sus posibilidades económicas la limitan a adquirirlos. Y son estas las razones por la cual se contacta con vosotros para solicitar un préstamo y llevar a cabo sus propósitos.

loans.use: Increase in capital to buy compost and fertilizer to improve her crops.

loans.name: Ram Kumari

texts.en:
Ram Kumari S. lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur, with her husband and three sons. Her husband is a taxi driver and owns his own taxi. Her older son passed his SLC (School Leaving Certificate) this year and now he is studying in grade 11. Her other two sons are in secondary school.

Mrs. S. is a cosmetic shopkeeper in the town of Bholdhoka. She also sells different varieties of sandals in her shop. She used her first Kiva loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods. She became the first lady from BPW Patan to clear her first loan from Kiva. Now she is requesting a loan of 20,000 NPR to further expand her business to earn more. Her aim is to upgrade the living standard of her family and to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Begam

texts.en:
Begam bibi is the wife of S. A., and she lives in the city of Riwind, Paksitan. Begam baji is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her sons work in a factory and receive monthly wages, while her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Begam baji is engaged in numerous activities on a daily basis: she sells milk, does household work, and takes care of her children and animals. Her husband, meanwhile, has been driving a tractor for the last 5 years.

Notably, Begam baji successfully repaid three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now, she is applying for another loan in order to buy a buffalo to expand her milk business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her dairy business by purchasing a buffalo

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
This is the second time for Mrs. Suy S. to take out the loan to improve her living conditions. She sells brooms in Kampong Pou Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Kour Srey, is a fisherman who can gather small fish because he does not have enough equipment for fishing. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Suy S., decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat and motor to gather more fish.

Mrs. Suy S. is 39 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is four years old. Previously, Mrs. Suy S. had obtained a loan to buy more raw materials to make brooms to sell, and she had fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and motor to gather more fish.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C., 56, and his second wife, Mrs. Saroun Kun, 37, who live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have two daughters. Thorn also has other four children with his first wife. All of them have full time employment.
 
Mr. Thorn and his wife have been selling vegetables for five years. They buy them from Dem Kor market in Phnom Penh City to later sell at Kor Ky market near their village. 

Mr. Thorn is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying the vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer for carrying the vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan A. lives in Prey Meas village in Takeo Province. She is 56 years old and the mother of four children: two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the younger two attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Touch, are farmers. They own a plot of land where they cultivate both rice and cassavas.

Recently, however, their crops have been poor because of problems with infertile soil. As a result, Mrs. Phan A. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help improve their soil and make their crops more productive. They would also like to purchase a cow for breeding to increase their overall business.

loans.use: To buy fertizers to improve their soil and a cow for breeding

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Francisco M. Q., se dedica a la compra y venta de ladrillos, vive en la zona de Alto Llojeta, zona donde se encuntran las fabricas de ladrillos, el señor realiza la compra de  unos 8000 ladrillos a la semana y los vende en la ciudad de Cochabamba, Bolivia, ciudad situada a unos 400 Km de La Paz, lugar en el cual existe un amplio mercado para este producto. Este es su primer prestamo en EMPRENDER, con el ampliará el negocio. Ayuda con los gastos de la casa y a su vez cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es ama de casa sueñan con mejorar cada vez más su negocio. Es una persona muy responsable, y tiene muy buenas referencias por donde vive.
texts.en:
Señor Francis Monastery Q. purchases and sells bricks. He lives in the area of Alto Llojeta, an area where you will find the brick factories. He purchase approximately 8000 bricks a week and sells them in the city of Cochabamba, Bolivia, a city located some 400 km from La Paz, in which there is a large market for this product. This is his first loan with EMPRENDER, with which he will expand his business. The loan will assist with the cost of the house. He also has the support of his wife, who is a housewife who dreams of improving the business. He is a very responsible person and has good references where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Chhun Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun Hai C. lives in Krodas village in Kampong Cham province. She is 24 years old and the mother of a three-year-old child. Mrs. Chhun Hai C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle because her soil is infertile and produces poor crops. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to  make her crops more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nim Noeun, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar and wine. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Aner Eliu

texts.es: El señor Ener Eliu Sánchez tiene la edad de 24 años habita en Veracruz, Ticuantepe en la capital de Managua,  es soltero, trabaja como guarda de seguridad y a la  vez da mantenimiento de limpieza en la empresa donde labora, vive con su mamá los planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus padres ya que donde habitan esta deteriorado el techo lo cual desea cambiarlo en esta temporada seca, para cuando venga el invierno no mojarse, lo  cual va a comprar laminas de zinc; perlines, golosos, entre otros este es su segundo préstamo en Afodenic y esta contento por sentirse apoyado y beneficiado con estos prestamos los cuales ha podido sastifacer sus necesidades. Sus objetivo a corto plazo es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Aner Eliu Sánchez is 24 years old, lives in Veracruz, Ticuantepe, in the capital of Managua, is single, works as a security guard, and provides cleaning services in the company where he works. He lives with his mother. His plans are to improve the condition of his parents’ lives since the area where they live is deteriorating. They want to change their roof in the dry season so that they won’t get wet in the winter. As a result, they are going to buy sheets of zinc and purlins, among other things. This is his second loan from Afodenic and is happy because he feels supported and benefits from the loan, which has been able to satisfy his needs. His goal in the short-term is to be able to continue improving his life.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to change the roof on his house

loans.name: Ernesto Aquiles

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Masaya, el señor Ernesto C. se dedica muy arduamente a su actividad de sastrería y costura el cual posee en su propia casa de habitación donde es visitado por muchos clientes y además elabora trajes típicos nicaragüenses para venderlos. Es importante destacar que en su negocio no solamente el trabaja ya que posee personas que le trabajan ya que su negocio va en desarrollo y únicamente él no puede llevar a cabo dicho trabajo.

El motive por el cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como lo son hilos, botones, agujas, entre otros. Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia de igual forma a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the city of Masaya Mr. Ernesto C. works very hard as a tailor and dressmaker in his home where he is visited by many customers. He also sews typical Nicaraguan garments to sell. It is important to point out that in his business he is not the only one working, but that he has other people who work for him since his business is developing and he would not be able to carry out the aforementioned work alone. His motivation for seeking out the support of Ceprodel is to be benefited by a loan to buy work materials such as thread, buttons, and needles, among others. With the loan he will be greatly benefited as will his family who depends so much on his support.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials

loans.name: Mok

texts.en: Mok R. is 31 years old and lives with her husband in the Siem Reap province. She is a good housewife, doing house work and cooking for her family members. Her husband is the head of the family and work as a sugar palm seller. On average, he makes US$6 per day. This couple has two school aged children. Mok R. would like to take out a loan to purchase a trailer. The trailer will be attached to a motorbike and will transport coconuts to sell at the market.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Since 2002, Beatrice B. has made a living selling food such as eggs and tomatoes at a local market. She is married and has seven children. When growing up, she received a primary school education. Her husband works as a fisherman. Beatrice helps her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses. She will use her loan to buy additional food to sell to her customers. She hopes to use the increased income made possible by this loan to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Teodora Melida

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce la señora Teodora R. se ha destacado en la actividad de agricultura con el propósito de llevar a cabo el mejoramiento en las condiciones de su habitación. Para mejorar la situación de su hogar ella ha adquirido un panel solar debido a que en la localidad donde ella vive no se tiene energía eléctrica y por medio de este panel solar ella logra alumbrarse por las noches y también permite realizar algunos quehaceres del hogar que requieren de energía eléctrica como lo es el planchar.

La razón por la que ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para el pago del panel solar y de esta manera aprovechar este recurso que le benéficia a diario en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora R. has excelled in agriculture in the municipality of El Sauce. Her goal is to make improvements to her room. To improve her home she has acquired a solar panel. There is no electricity in the area where she lives. By using this panel, she will be able to have light in the evenings. She will also be able to do household chores, like ironing, that require electricity. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to pay for the solar panel. She can then take advantage of this resource that will bring daily benefits to the house where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Косимова Муаззам хочет параллельно получить кредит на закуп сезонного ассортимента товаров. Она продаёт женскую одежду, колготки , носки и нижнее бельё.  Предыдущий займ она потратила на закуп зимнего ассортимента, а сезонного у неё мало. Поэтому она решила съездить в Истаравшан и привести товар. Муаззам хорошо погашает свой кредит и имеет постоянный поток клиентов. Микроинвест рад сотрудничать с такими клиентами , как Косимова Муаззам.
texts.en:
Muazzam K. wants to take out another loan in order to purchase a selection of seasonal goods. She sells women's clothing, stocking, socks and undergarments. She spent the previous loan on the purchase of winter items, but she has little for the current season. Therefore, she decided to go to Istaravshan on a buying trip. Muazzam makes her loan payments on time and has a steady stream of customers. MicroInvest is pleased to work with such clients as Muazzam K..

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's undergarments

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 38 years old and married with no children. He sells groceries. He hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more grocery items to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: Purchase more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Carl

texts.en:
“You have to be willing to sacrifice a lot, to work Saturdays and Sundays, and just be honest and fair,” says Carl.

Carl worked for 20 years in the trucking industry and washed windows on the side for extra money, before deciding to start his own window washing business. Carl manages the business and washes windows–often waking at 3:00 in the morning for early jobs–while his wife helps out with bookkeeping. Carl’s business capacity has doubled in the last few years and could keep growing, but he needs to invest in advertising and hire a full-time employee to meet the high demand. 

A $5,000 loan would help Carl advertise his business online and in real estate brochures, as well as prepare the business to hire a full-time employee. 

Visit http://www.mobilewashingservice.com/

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Carl from  United States

loans.use: Advertising and hiring new employee

loans.name: Nakimera Maxy  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Maxy is the leader of a 5-member group. She is 52 years old, divorced, with five children aged between 25 and 38 years. None of her children goes to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people. Maxy doesn't take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Maxy has a stall in Naalukolongo market selling charcoal and so she doesn't incur any extra transport costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of 25 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both accommodation and business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last nine years.

Maxy has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Maxy is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old and is a married woman with five children. All her children are currently in school. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Margaret prepares and serves pastries like cakes, doughnuts, flour chips, etc. and sells through hawking (going door-to-door). In spite of the challenges she faces, she manages to meet her customers demands by depending on her little resources. She serves her pastries by herself to her customers in the market center. She has been in business for seven and half years now.

Margaret’s only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demands of her customers. She requests a loan support to remain in business. With the loan she believes she can provide for her family and most especially her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a woman with the determination and faith needed to remove her family from poverty. She is 34 years old and the  mother of two children, a girl and a boy. She lives in Antipolo City, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is happily married to Joel, who is a hired laborer and is also her business partner.

To bring greener living for her family, Alma joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines, in 2007. Before her membership in ASHI, she was already reselling live chickens and bath soap. The business brings her income that is sufficient for the needs of her family.

Now she proposes a loan of 10,000 pesos to use as additional capital for her resale business. She is thankful to ASHI and KIVA for the trust and opportunity that they have given to a poor woman like her.

loans.use: As additional capital for her resale business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Barangay 3, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, married and has eleven school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) store. The primary source of income for this business comes from selling a variety of different products, including firewood, in the local community. Emma is just starting this business.

In 2009, Emma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services, and to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Emma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family and support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng C., age 28, is a Tuk Tuk driver. He always brings his passengers to the interesting places around capital in the best territory of Siem Reap Province, such as mountains and Angkor wat Temple. Usually, he gets the highest fees from his customer because he is a skill in attracting to them and is widely known where entertainment locations. He is now married with two young children who are of school-aged. The other source of family income, his wife sells breakfast food to the neighbors in the village. Cheng C. said that he has been using his taxi years ago so his taxi is too old, small, and not attractive. He is therefore requesting a loan in order to replace his old Tuk Tuk.

loans.use: To replace his old Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old married mother of two school-going children. She lives with her family in Gitare Embu. She is a member of a community-based women’s group affiliated to Runyenjes District Hospital.

Elizabeth owns a beauty salon which she started in 2006. She has applied for Kshs 40,000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.en:
Ricarda, 47, from the village of Baculud Amulung, Cagayan. Ricarda, is married to Ruben, who works as a house carpenter in their community. They are blessed with four children: Diana - 20 years old; Angelica - 17 years old and a college student; Cheska Mae - 11 years old, an elementary school student, and Jhairo - 1 year old.

Ricarda earns approximately PHP600 weekly through her dressmaking business, an enterprise she has operated for 10 years. She also does clothing repair for extra income. This enables her to help her husband support their family's needs, especially the education of three of their children. Because she wants to improve her business output, she is hoping to avail financial assistance from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sewing service business

loans.name: Lolita Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. desde el 2004 vende la fruta que este en cosecha como  elotes, sandias, jocotes, mango, coyolito, grocesea. Ella está casada y tienes tres hijos  menores de edad de 14 años, 9 años y 6 meses respectivamente. Los mayores luego de sus clases le ayudan a atender el negocio. 

U. tiene 4 años de estar con Adim en este tiempo ella se asentido bien con la forma de trabajo y desea continuar en este proceso ya que le ayudado a crecer.
texts.en:
Lolita del Socorro U. D. has been selling seasonal fruit since 2004, items such as sweetcorn, watermelon, jocotes (plum-like fruit), mangoes, coyolito and grocea. She is married and has three minor children, 14 years, 9 years and 6 months of age. The older ones help her with her business after they finish school. U. has been with ADIM for four years in which time she has integrated well with the way it functions and wishes to continue the process since it has helped her grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for resale

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame B. est une entrepreneur à Grand Yoff, Dakar.  Elle vend des sachets de jus de fruits (très délicieuses) aux détaillants qui les revendent ambulante ou dans le marchés.  Elle va l'utiliser le crédit de 100.000 CFCA pour acheter une nouvelle machine pour le collage de sachets et aussi remplir son stock des ingrédients.  Son mari est le soutien de famille, mais avec sa petite entreprise, Madame B. peut contribuer aux finances de famille.
texts.en:
Ms. B. is an entrepreneur in Grand Yoff, Dakar. She sells pouches of fruit juice (very delicious) to the retailers who resell them door-to-door or at marketplaces. She is going to use the loan of 100,000 francs CFA to buy a new machine for pouch bonding and also for replenishing her stock of ingredients. Her husband is the breadwinner, but with her small enterprise, Ms. B. can contribute to family finances.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a machine for bonding the pouches

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva M. es una socia dinámica y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, madre de dos menores, Rosalva trabaja en la venta de bebidas refrescantes, actividad que lo realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica al transporte público,. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa. Actualmente Rosalva necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que será utilizado en la compra de gaseosas y néctares. La meta de Rosalva es  ser distribuidora de gaseosas y tener una bodega implementada con todo tipo de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Rosalva M. is a very dynamic and active woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 25 years old and the mother of two young children. Rosalva sells soft drinks from her house. She counts with the support of her husband who works with public transportation. She has been a member of the communal bank “Las Divinas” for two years. The first loan she received of 300 soles was used to buy candies to sell from her house. This time, Rosalva needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be used to purchase soft drinks and juice nectars. Rosalva’s goal is to become a distributor of soft drinks and to have a store with all kinds of food and beverage products.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and juice nectars.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras 1 Group

texts.en:
Dorotea plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling used clothing. She buys large packages of used clothing shipped to the Dominican Republic from the United States and then sells them in her community.

Dorotea is the coordinator of her group, Las Trabajadoras (The Workers), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring Santo Domingo, an urban area where crime is high. Running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her family.

Dorotea is excited to be taking her second loan after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and for savings to build upon her very small base of possessions. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy packages of used clothing in bulk to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
N. Jane is a widow with four grown children. She takes care of her grandchildren and orphans. 

She is a strong and hard-working lady with a bar business selling beers.  She says that she started her business using a loan and the loans still work well for her, except for the debtors that fail to pay. She is able to make 300,000 UGX as a monthly profit and this is due to her available stock and good bookkeeping. 

She needs to become more prosperous and self-sustaining now that she is getting much older. Jane Mary needs a loan to stock more beers that will bring in more profits for the season and the months to come.

loans.use: Stocking more beers for resale.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria sells various breads, sweet breads and regular bread. This business began as an idea in 2001 and today is now is a functioning business. Maria has had previous loans that initially helped her to establish her business and then to improve her bread project. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for her breads: flour, butter, oil, salt etc. Her dream is to continue growing her bakery. It is challenging when employees don’t show up and replacing them is difficult. Maria is not married and has two teenage daughters who are both in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her baking.

loans.name: Ernesto José

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto Gonzáles se dedica a su actividad de taller de electricidad automotriz el que desarrolla en el municipio de Nagarote donde a diario atiende a sus fieles clientes que le visitan con el fin de lograr su satisfacción ya que tiene mucha experiencia en el trabajo de electricidad automotriz.

El señor Ernesto es casado y con dos hijos a su cargo a los que debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para su desarrollo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo del taller con el fin de sacarle el máximo provecho para obtener los ingresos para el pago del colegio de sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Sr. Ernesto Gonzales operates a business in Nagarote repairing auto electrical systems, a business that he started from scratch. He works in the shop every day, tending to his loyal customers who rely on the experience he's gained over the years working on electrical systems.

Sr. Ernesto is married and has two children who he is bound to support and provide for. He is applying for a loan to buy supplies for the shop so that, in turn, he can generate the maximum revenue from it, income that will allow him to pay the school fees of the children that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for auto repair shop.

loans.name: Sulema

texts.es:
La señora Sulema L. ella es maestra de educación y además de ser maestra se dedica al comercio y tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en Esteli.
El tipo  de negocio que tiene es venta de ropa, cosméticos, comida y útiles escolares, este negocio tiene aproximadamente de tenerlo 10 años el cual inicio con ahorro propio y con la ayuda de su esposo.
Sulema va destinar el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares y ropa ya que tiene cerca del negocio dos colegios y varias fabrica procesadora de tabaco el cual el personal que labora es cliente de ella ya que le brinda crédito a un pL. de una semana.
Ella espera que con la compra de compra de útiles escolares y la ropa aumente su inventario de mercadería y así obtener mayores ganancias.
Sulema es casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo ambos en edad escolar y tiene dos empleada.
Este es el primer crédito con Ceprodel y expresa continuar trabajando con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Sulema L. is a teacher but she's also a merchant and has a store in her home in Esteli. She sells clothing, cosmetics, food, and school supplies. She has had this business for 10 years; she started it with her own savings and with help from her husband. Sulema will use the funds to buy school supplies and clothing because she has two schools nearby and several tobacco processing plants, whose employees are customers because she extends one-week's credit to them. She hopes that by stocking school supplies and other merchandise her inventory will be greater and therefore so will her profits. Sulema is married and has two, school-age children under her care; she also has two employees. This is her first loan with Ceprodel and she hopes to continue to collaborate with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and school supplies.

loans.name: Reynaldo Ivan

texts.es:
Reynaldo T. de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y caña cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. Su esposa es empleada domestica con ella tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años.

El inicio trabajando en una pastelería muy conocida en Guayaquil (Pasteles & Compañía). Una vez que el aprendió todo lo que se hace en las pasteleria empezo con un nuevo negocio en su casa. 

Ahora Reynaldo tiene una panadería, vende panes y tambien todo lo que aprendio en la pastelería. Trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 00h00 haciendo panes y tortas. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son los racionamientos de energía.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla y huevos para su panadería. En el futuro quiere tener muchas sucursales.
texts.en:
Reynaldo T. is 29 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and reeds, and receives electricity and water as its only basic services. Reynaldo’s wife works as a housekeeper and they have two children, ages 8 and 5. He started working at a well-known cake shop called “Cakes & Company” in Guayaquil. Once he learned everything, he decided to start his own baking business at home. Now Reynaldo has his own bakery, where he sells bread and everything else he learned how to make at the cake shop. He works from 7am to midnight making breads and cakes. Energy rations are one of the inconveniences he has to face. With this loan, he will buy flour, butter, and eggs for his bakery. In the future, he wants to open more branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, and eggs

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza M. is 36 years of age and married with four children.  All her children go to school. Specioza rents a six room house and  where she stays with her children. She always has three meals a day and her greatest expense is tuition for her children. Specioza raises chickens for a living. She works seven days a week. She normally receives about ten customers a day and most of her clients are men. She sells poultry on a retail basis. She has had this business for over seven years. In addition to rearing chickens, Specioza is also a shop attendant.The main challenge she faces in her poultry business is that it is seasonal. She only sells her hens when they have matured.  Specioza has been a member with MCDT for six years. She chose to work with MCDT because they operate in a simplified way that is easy for anyone to understand. Specioza wants to use this loan to buy more chicken feed and chicks. She also wants to continue expanding on her business until it becomes a farm.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Rajika

texts.en:
Rajika is a 30-year-old married woman living with her two children in the town of Dickwella, Sri Lanka. Her husband is working abroad so Rajika must provide local family support for her children.

Rajika has a tailoring business that she has been running for three years now. She is a very hard worker and an honest woman, which has helped her to expand her business to where it is currently. However, she has plans to improve it for the future and needs some additional capital to do so.

Rajika is seeking a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC. This is actually her second loan for her tailoring business as her first loan of 20,000 LKR was successfully repaid. Ultimately she hopes to expand enough to be able to provide employment for one or two people in the community.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel M. C. tiene 25 años y actualmente vive en Cochabamba en la zona sur, en una Zona conocida como Maica Kenamari, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. 

Maribel  es productora de leche cruda con la cual elabora yogurt y vende este producto en los diferentes mercados locales de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Maribel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda hace más de 6 años. Su esposo trabaja en el sector de mantenimiento de maquinaria en un Taller Industrial ubicado en Cochabamba, esta actividad la realiza por casi 3 años y según sus jefes es una persona trabajadora, puntual y en conclusión un excelente empleado.

Maribel solicita el crédito para poder comprar más vacas lecheras y así poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder agrandar el número de vacas que tiene. El mayor sueño de Maribel es poder incrementar su producción de leche y sus ingresos de forma que junto a su esposo puedan comprar una casa donde vivir solos junto a sus hijos puesto que por el momento viven en casa de la madre de su mujer.
texts.en:
Maribel M. C., 25, lives in the southern part of Cochabamba in an area known as Maica Kenamari with her husband and two children. Maribel is a raw milk producer that she uses to make yoghurt for sale at various Cochabamba markets. Maribel has been a dairy farmer for over 6 years; her husband works as a machine maintenance man at an industrial workshop in Cochabamba, a job he’s had for 3 years. According to his supervisors, he is a hard-working, punctual, excellent employee. Maribel is asking for funds to buy more dairy cows in order to increase earnings and herd size. Her greatest dream is to increase milk production and her income so that, together with her husband, they can buy a house where they can live with their children by themselves; they currently share his wife’s mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aslidin

texts.en:
G. Aslidin is 39 years old. He is married and has 4 children. During the last 11 years Aslidin has been providing transportation services. As a rule he works locally, in his region only. At the same time, together with the help of his wife and children, he raises cattle at his home, which gives additional income to his family. Currently Aslidin’s truck needs repairing. He requests $1000 US Dollars. Aslidin promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone for support. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts necessary for the maintenance of the truck.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
Hajra, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of S. S. and owns a small two-room house where she has been living with her family for over 40 years. A very talented lady, Hajra operates a paranda-making business, an enterprise that helps support her family. (A paranda is used to tie back hair as part of an ornament.) Her husband runs a tailoring center, his stitching famous in the community. He learned this skill at the age of 12 and started his own business 10 years ago.

Hajra is now applying for her second loan from Asasah so her husband can purchase an electric sewing machine that will increase his business efficiency.

Note: In this picture Hajra is showing her paranda.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Fernando Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Fernando Ernesto tiene su negocio que es el  destace de res o ganado vacuno, el realiza la compra de el ganado de contado a diferentes campesinos y sus comarcas, las ventas las realiza de contado y al crédito a diferentes pulperías. El se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que realizar la entrega de estos productos, en algunas circunstancias tiene que mojarse pues el clima no lo detiene a seguir con trabajo.   Además cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa la cual posee una pulpería y a si con ello aumentan los ingresos del hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima para la compra de materia prima necesaria en su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fernando Ernesto’s business is butchering cattle. He buys the cattle for cash from people in different regions. He sells for cash or credit to different grocery stores. He gets up very early because he has to deliver these products. Sometimes he gets wet because the weather does not keep him from getting on with his work. His wife, who has a grocery store, helps him. This helps increase the household income. The loan is to buy the raw material he needs for his business in order to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
Femme commercante de 48 ans,mere de 4 enfants dont l'age varie de 25 ans a 17 ans, elle eleve ses enfants et prend en charge leurs scolarites ,seule depuis plus de 10 ans.
Elle s'est lancee dans la friperie bientot 3 ans, elle s'approvisionne dans les grands depots de la place,et ses recettes varient entre 25000 a 13000f le jour.Des qu'elle va recevoir son pret elle compte acheter Des nouveaux ballots de friperie telle que les ballots de survetements, des pulls..., 
Usant de beaucoup de strategies pour accroitre son activite elle epargne aussi et est tres meticuleuse dans la gestion et sait convaincre les clients pour apprecier ses marchandises.A la longue elle veut elle meme etre grossiste et avec ses revenus construire une maison pour ses enfants et les aider a faire des longues etudes
texts.en:
This female entrepreneur is 48 years old and the mother of four children, from 25 to 17 years of age. For over ten years, she has been raising her children and paying their school fees on her own. It’s been almost three years since she deals in second-hand clothing. She stocks up at the big warehouses locally, and her daily sales add up to anywhere from 25,000 to 130,000 francs. As soon as she receives her loan, she will buy new bundles of second-hand clothing, such as outerwear, pullovers etc. She is using many different strategies to grow her business and also saves her money; she is very careful with managing the business and knows how to work with to get them interested in her wares. Her long-term goal is to become a wholesaler and, with the income obtained, to be able to build a house for her children and to help them continue with their education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bundles of used clothing [for resale]

loans.name: Women In Active-Lugazi Group

texts.en:
M. Prossy is a 50-year-old woman with a sparkly sense of humor. This has helped her strike a chord with most of her clients at her firewood sales business in Mbiko Kasanja-Lugazi. M. Prossy has, over the last 4 years, defied the stereotype that aging people like herself should just rely on their children and grandchildren to survive. Contrary to expectation, she has managed to establish a niche for herself amidst strong competition from other firewood sellers in a region where firewood can easily be obtained from the neighboring mabire forest. At her age, she is surprisingly single but happy with her status saying she is in a position to provide for all her 4 children without the support of a man. That to her matters more than anything else. 

M. Prossy began this business with savings from her teaching job. Hard work is also a factor that she attributes to her success. As she makes progress on the 120,000 UGX she makes in a week, she is also taking a long view. She says she wants to eventually open new business horizons for herself in the near future by opening up a grocery store. She is getting remuneration as a teacher since she is still in active service. With this loan, she is looking at buying more firewood to sell to her increasing clientele to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Cecilia is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2010, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying two new sewing machines

loans.name: Abendowooza Women Development Association-Kampala Group

texts.en: M. Irene, aged 36, has been running her clothes and poultry sales businesses for the last eight years in Lubowa-Kampala. Irene began as a teacher and a politician, and she had always heard the oft-used classroom adage – 'hard work pays'. Irene wanted to use this as a precept in her business and used it she has. Her clothes business brings in 100,000 UGX weekly and she is upbeat about her future business prospects in the wake of getting this loan, which will give her a solid start-up. This married mother of five wants to buy more clothes for resale. She believes that with more clothes sales she will be able to earn more money.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Madame Haoua Traoré  est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants dans une famille monogame au quartier Darsalam de  Ségou   (4ème  région du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle bénéficia d’une solide expérience dans le petit commerce. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida  d’évoluer de ses propres ailes dans le créneau du commerce du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois. Elle mène cette activité depuis 13 ans chez elle-même à domicile. 
Ses ventes sont nombreuses du fait qu’elle est la seule vendeuse de bois de chauffe dans le  quartier. Elle est  sollicitée lors de tous les grands événements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et  funérailles). 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation depuis 30 mois. Tous les  prêts obtenus : 3 solidaires  et 1 individuel  ont tous été bien remboursés. 
Elle est à son 2ème  prêt individuel qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 chargements de camion en bois de chauffe. Elle s’approvisionne à Sanando sur la route de Bamako.
Madame Haoua Traoré vend au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100000FCFA  qui lui permettra de finir sa maison et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (habillements et nourritures).
texts.en:
Haoua Traore is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband and their children as a monogamous family in the Darsalam neighborhood in Segou (4th region in Mali). Not having been to school due to social regions, from an early age she started working in income generating activities alongside her mother, who used to sell cooking condiments. After several years of learning at her side she acquired a lot of experience in small business management, so she decided to start her own business in the trade of firewood and charcoal. This is what she has been doing from her own home for the last 13 years. Her sales are good because she is the only firewood seller in the neighborhood. She is especially sought after when there are major social events (weddings, christenings and funerals). In order to keep her increasingly numerous customer base happy, she is seeking the help of Soro Yiriwaso, which which she has been working for 30 months. She has paid back all loans obtained (3 group loans and 1 individual one). This is her second individual loan, which she will use to buy two truckloads of firewood. She stocks up in Sanando, on the Bamako road. Haoua Traore sells for cash or credit to a mostly female customer base. With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 100000FCFA, which will allow her to finish her house and meet the needs of her family (clothing and food).

Translated from French by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a single woman who has been operating a greengrocer business for over ten years. She sells both wholesale and retail at the market and also from home to her neighbors.

With the Kshs 70,000, Salome wants to purchase a chainsaw to operate a timber-cutting business. She faces the major challenge of transportation in her business.

Salome hopes to open another greengrocer branch in the future. She decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan to sustain her and to improve her living standard. She rents a house with electricity and piped water, her greatest monthly expenses being house rent and food.

loans.use: To purchase a chainsaw for cutting timber for sale

loans.name: Noé

texts.es: Noé T. R. de 27 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajadora, el cual reside en San Juan Opico, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad. Noé se dedica a trabajar como agricultor en una parcela, en la cual también vive junto a su familia. En su terreno él siembra: maíz, frijoles y maicillo, los cuales posteriormente comercializa con sus clientes quienes por años han consumidos los granos básicos que Noé cultiva. Con el fin de poder brindarle una vida mejor a su esposa, quien es ama de casa y se dedica a cuidar a los niños, Noé también trabaja como electricista, lo que le permite contar con ganancias extras. Noé solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda contar con la cantidad de dinero necesaria para invertir en la compra de granos básicos y así mismo abono y otros recursos más los cuales son necesarios para desempeñar un mejor trabajo.
texts.en: Noé T. R. is 27 years old. He is a very hard working young man who lives in San Juan Opico, located in the La Libertad department. He lives there with his wife and two children, aged 1 and 3. Noé works as a farmer on a land parcel, where he lives with his family. He plants corn, bean and maicillo, which he later sells to customers who have consumed the grains tha Noé grows. In order to offer a better life to his wife, who is a housewife and takes care of the children, Noé also works as an electrician. This allows him to have extra income. Noé is asking for a loan from Integral to be able to have enough money to invest in buying basic grains and fertilizer and other resources necessary to do a better job.

loans.use: To buy seed for planting

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V., 31, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. V. sells vegetables, earning an income of about $3.50 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

V. has to spend $65 on food, $3 on electricity and water supplies, and $18 on other necessary expenses every month. V. is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband improve his business

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona S. is a married woman who lives in Purok Nangka, Barangay Sangi, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: an Internet Café and a meal supplies business. Her husband, Alan S., who is 56 years old, works as an Issue Clerk to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 18 to 26 years old. 

Ma. Chona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Chona has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP helped her increase her monthly income to approximately $723, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th cycle loan, she is borrowing 28,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her internet cafe so that she can continue to save up for the future support of their children, so that they can send them to school to finish their studies. Ma. Chona S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the business operations

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


El socio es el Sr. Zenobio; el tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de cuyes y gallinas, el cría en su casa los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en la provincia de Anta, el socia quiere mejorar el negocio de compra y venta de animales. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Zenobio belongs to the “Los Lideres” [The Leaders] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and department of Cusco. Zenobio is 24 years old, lives with a partner, and has one child. 

Zenobio’s business is the buying and selling of hens and guinea pigs. He raises the animals in his home. After they have grown and fattened up, he then sells them at various markets in the province of Anta.

Zenobio wants this loan to buy more animals to improve his business. He is grateful to all who have made this possible, and promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: Buy hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.es: Melchora, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 2 hijos, de los cuales solo se preocupa por la menor pues el mayor trabaja y estudia. Cada día esta empeñosa mujer se despierta muy temprano para empezar con la venta de los  artículos para el hogar (platos, tazas y adornos)  y desempeña esta actividad, desde hace 6 años. Esta muy satisfecha pues con los años ha logrado captar gran cantidad de clientes que le compran seguido pues saben de la calidad y los buenos precios que ofrece su mercadería, y como concede a crédito cobra semanalmente o cada quincena, siempre de acuerdo al trato  con los clientes. Le gusta mucho su actividad, pues mientras vende se entretiene conversando y paseando; además sus hijos también le ayudan, de vez en cuando. Ella tiene muchos planes para el futuro como el de instalar un pequeño bazar, en una zona comercial, pues como ya tiene clientes calcula que le ira muy bien. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiete quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Melchora tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería que necesita para surtir mejor su negocio pues tiene varios pedidos que espera concretar.
texts.en:
Melchora, 45, lives in her own house with her two children.  She only tends to the youngest because her oldest daughter works and goes to school.

This enterprising woman rises very early every morning to start selling items for the home (dishes, cups and decorations).  She has been in this business for 6 years.  She is very satisfied because as time has gone by she has managed to capture a good number of regular customers that buy from her often because they are aware of the quality and good prices of her wares.  Also, because she offers credit and collects weekly or biweekly according to her customers’ agreement.

She enjoys her work very much because while she sells she entertains herself chatting and wandering through town.  Besides, her children help her once in a while.

She has a lot of plans for the future like setting up a small store in a commercial area, for example, because she figures she’ll do well because she already has customers.

This is her 6th loan with MFP and she promises to repay punctually because she does not want to disappoint the people who made contributions that will allow her to stay in business seeking progress.

Melchora plans to use the funds to buy merchandise she needs to better stock her business because she has several pending orders to fill.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her business.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 20 años y vive en compañía de su madre en casa de sus progenitores. Hace más de 6 años se dedica a la venta de verduras como: lechuga, espinaca, cebolla entre otros productos más, en un mercadillo cerca de su casa. Trabaja junto a su madre, quien la ayuda en el negocio, y ambas se van en busca de la mercadería de los mismos productores. Su horario de trabajo va desde muy temprano hasta las 3 de la tarde, tiempo en el que ha logrado acumular buenas ganancias del día; además que le permite tener sus propios ingresos y aportar en la economía de su casa. Magali tiene muchos sueños, es por eso que  trabaja con mucha cautela y seguridad, ya que su fin es tener un puesto más amplio, para así aumentar de mercadería, con mayor variedad de productos. Es el crédito numero 3 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más verduras para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Magali is 20 years old and lives with her mother in her parents' house.  She has been selling vegetables such as lettuce, spinach, onions and others in a street market near her home for more than 6 years.  She works with her mother who helps her in the business. They both go looking for merchandise from the farmers themselves.  Magali works every day from very early in the morning until 3 o'clock in the afternoon by which time she has made good profits for the day.  This work allows her to have her own income and put money towards her household finances.

Magali has a lot of dreams which is why she works very carefully and safely.  Her goal is to have a much bigger stall so that she can increase the amount of merchandise she sells, with a wider range of products.

This is Magali's 3rd loan from MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people she knows.  All the bank's members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  She is grateful to everyone who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to buy more vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: To stock her sales stall with a wider variety of vegetables

loans.name: So's Group

texts.en:
Thirteen members form this village bank loan, located in Krouch village, Kandal province. Mrs. So S., a 41-year-old married woman, has been selected as the village bank president. With the loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' living conditions.
 
Mrs. So S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She faces a problem in that her rice field does not have enough water to support it. So, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crop. As well as farming, she also breeds pigs and poultry. 

Her husband, Mr. Mang Vanna, 43 years old, works as house constructor and also helps on his wife's farm. They have five children; one is a farmer, the others are attending the local village school and also help in their mother's businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Isatu S..  She is married and has two children, aged 3 and 5 years. She has no additional dependents living with her.  In 2000, Isatu S. established her cooking utensils business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself and her family.  Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 250,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan for 3,000,000 SLL to expand her business so that she can generate more profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 320,000 SLL. In the future, Isatu plans to educate her children, improve her business to a higher level; open a wholesale shop to sell to other traders and nearby villagers. She plans to hire workers who will help in the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: el Sr. Edgar es un joven Emprendedor que vive al sur de la ciudad de La Paz, El se dedico en un principio a la reparación de celulares con lo que mantenía y mantiene  sus estudios, uso su primer préstamo para este negocio pero el tiene el sueño de poder aperturar su negocio en sistemas de seguridad, en el cual ya tiene experiencia además de ya haber realizado algunos trabajos en distintas casas y  pequeños negocios, el joven no tuvo problemas de pago por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra material para la instalación de alarmas,  y de esta manera poder ayudar con los gastos de la familia y continuar con sus estudios, es un joven trabajador que esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Edgar is an enterprising young man who lives in the southern part of the city of La Paz. He repairs cell phones, which helps to pay for his studies. He used his first loan for this business , but his dream is to be able to expand his business to security systems, with which he already has experience, having already worked in houses and small business. He didn't have problems with paying the loan back, and that's why he's requesting a new loan for the purchase of materials for installing alarms. With this new business he hopes to help pay the family expenses and continue with his studies. He's a hardworking young man who is thankful to the institution for the help it has provided.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for the installation of alarm systems and cell phone repairs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old divorced woman from Lebanon.  She lives with her parents and three siblings. Eight years ago, she established a tailoring business out of her home to help her father with the family income. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional textiles in order to expand her business operation and earn more profit.

loans.use: to expand her business operation

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Patricia C. R. ella es trabajadora activa de una entidad estatal desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación  Primaria tiene veinte y cinco   años  de trabajar para esta institución  como docente es casada  actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
