Ha tenido  diez créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Patricia C. R. is employed as an Elementary School Teacher in a state institution; she’s been working for this entity for 25 years.  She’s married and has two school age children.  

She’s had 10 CEPRODEL loans that she’s used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, cement, stone, gravel, concrete blocks, etc. for home enlargement and improvement.

Ceprodel loans have been very beneficial in that she’s improved her and her family’s living conditions through them.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia M. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia and her husband own and operate a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a welding business in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase materials and equipment. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials and equipment to be used in the business. This loan will be Cecilia's second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipment for her welding business

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Srey as the group leader. All the members will use their portion of the loan to improve their families' living standards.

Srey, a farmer born in 1981, owns a one-hectare plot of land upon which she grows rice, some allotted for sale with the rest being used to feed her family. Her husband. Daren, a taxi driver, is able to earn some money to help support the family. They have a one-year-old son.

Because the taxi's car wheel requires replacement, Srey is requesting a loan to buy a new wheel, with the rest of the money being used to purchase some piglets to start a breeding business.

loans.use: to buy a new wheel

loans.name: Las Esperanzadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Esperanzadas lo conforman seis mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Anielka Rodríguez, Sheyla L. y Izayana V.. La coordinadora es la señora Anielka Rodríguez  quien comercializa ropa usada desde hace 12 años. Ella vende de manera ambulante en distintas partes del país.  
Ella con el crédito comprará paca de ropa y calzado.
Sheyla L. tiene una pulpería y su meta principal es tener su casa y Izayana V. vende plata desde hace 30 años y su sueño es tener una tienda de variedades.
texts.en:
This group, “Las Esperanzadas” is made up of six hard working, enterprising women who put forth a great amount of effort.  They are Anielka Rodríguez, Sheyla L., and Izayana V..  Anielka Rodríguez is the group’s coordinator and has been selling used clothing for 12 years.  She sells on foot in different areas of the country.  She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and shoes.

Sheyla L. has a small grocery store and her goal is to have a house of her own.  Izayana V. has been selling silver for 30 years and her dream is to have a variety store.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
El Sr. Santos García se dedica al comercio, tiene 4 años de haber iniciado su ventas de golosinas en la caseta de la Escuela “José Trinidad Reyes”  pero debido al problema de educación y falta de clases es que Santos dicidio poner una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “POQUI TODO”.

el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor para surtir su negocio.
Don Santos esta casado y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo, los demás ya se casaron están formando nuevas familias.- también don Santos se dedica a la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) y cuando el realiza trabajo de campo es su esposa es la que atendiende el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos García is a merchant. He started his business selling sweets in the stand at the “José Trinidad Reyes” school, but due to the education problem and the lack of classes, Santos decided to set-up a grocery store in his home. His business operates under the name of “POQUI TODO” Grocery (a little bit of everything).

He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to better stock his business. 

Santos is married and only one of his children is still dependant – the rest are forming their own families. Santos is also involved in agriculture (he sows corn and beans) and when he works in the field his wife is the one who tends to the business.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, milk, cheese, soups, pasta, salsas, salt, spices, eggs, bread, cookies, sodas, candles, matches, batteries, soap, sanitary napkins, toothpaste and toilet paper.

loans.name: Nelsy  Yenibeth

texts.es:
Nelsy, 22 años de edad,casada, es originaria departamento de Esteli, de oficio comerciante ,ella se dedica a vender cosméticos, ropa, utensilios de cocina .
La joven Nelsy dice que el primer préstamo que recibió le ayudo en gran manera ya que pudo aumentar sus ganancias, hizo crece un poco su negocio, con el primer préstamo pudo comprar mas productos, satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, pudo adquirir mas clientes  incluso ahorrar para hacerle mejora de infraestructura a su hogar.  
Ella solicita este préstamo  para comprar nueva mercadería tales  como utensilios de cocina ,ropas ,zapatos, cosméticos en ocasión para el días de las madres pues es una época buena para aumentar sus ventas colocar  mas productos. Ella espera poder agrandar el negocio así mismo mejorar sus ventas, hacer nuevos clientes. Ella desea seguir invirtiendo y ahorrando para seguir prosperando y poder poner una tienda donde venda variedades de productos, lograr una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Nelsy is 22 years old, married, and from Estelí department.  She is a saleswoman who sells cosmetics, clothes and kitchen utensils.

Nelsy says that the first loan she received helped her a lot since she was able to increase her profits and grow her business a little.  With the loan, she was able to buy more products, meet her customers' demands and acquire new customers.  She even managed to save so that she could make some improvements to the infrastructure of her home.

Nelsy is requesting this loan to buy new merchandise such as cooking utensils, clothes, shoes and cosmetics for Mother's Day since this is a good time of year for her to increase her sales and sell more products.  She hopes to be able to expand her business, improve her sales and attract new customers.  She would like to continue investing and saving so that she can continue prospering and set up a store where she will sell a variety of products and achieve better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise such as cooking utensils, clothes, footwear and cosmetics for Mother's Day as this is a good time of year for her to increase her sales

loans.name: Sabitri

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Sabitri.  She is married and has two children aged 13 and 7.  In 2005, she established her grocery business.  Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Sabitri plans to improve the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sack of wheat flour, 30kilos of beans, a sack of rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Los Tulipanes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Giorgina is the coordinator of her group, Los Tulipanes  1 & 2 (tulips). This is a group composed of 15 business women. All of them are working to improve their lives and their familys' also. They live in one of the poorest areas around Santo Domingo city, a large community called Los Alcarrizos, which is located at the north of the city.

Giorgina makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. Giorgina is excited to be seeking her third loan with Esperanza. She successfully paid off her previous loan after using it to make a successful investment in her "Colmado" (a small grocery store, located in neighborhoods where people go to buy mostly daily meals). She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods like rice, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, canned products, sugar, coffee, etc. She provides in her business all the products a family might need to cook.

Giorgina's dreams are to develop herself as businesswoman, with an improved business and sustainable life, together with her family.  She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, cooking oil, canned products, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, American rice, beans, beef, oil, toilet paper, flour, chicken and eggs

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëker Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker est créé le 29 décembre 2010, il est composé de 21 femmes qui sont des amies, leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Alassane est âgée de 28 ans,mariée elle est mère de huit enfants et a en charge sa nièce, elle mène une activité de vente de légumes et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine avec une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ces domaines. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou vert blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle s'approvisionne en légumes et moutons dans la communauté rurale et revend dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira de renforcer son commerce de légumes et d'acheter et moutons pour l'embouche et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari avec les bénéfices obtenus dans les charges de la maison et souhaite augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker est créé le 29 décembre 2010, il est composé de 21 femmes qui sont des amies, leurs principales activités sont le commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Alassane est âgée de 28 ans,mariée elle est mère de huit enfants et a en charge sa nièce, elle mène une activité de vente de légumes et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine avec une bonne expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ces domaines. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en boubou vert blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle s'approvisionne en légumes et moutons dans la communauté rurale et revend dans son village.


Son prêt lui servira de renforcer son commerce de légumes et d'acheter et moutons pour l'embouche et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus.


Elle aide son mari avec les bénéfices obtenus dans les charges de la maison et souhaite augmenter son épargne.

loans.use: Acheter des légumes destinés à la vente.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married to Faith. They are blessed with two children. He has been a bus driver for the past seven years with the monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET. He will use the loan to service the vehicle and renew the p.s.v. insurance cover. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy another bus. His hopes are to educate his children and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To service the vehicle and renew the p.s.v. insurance cover.

loans.name: Williams' Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from a primary school in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This group has come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of 2,900,000 SLL to meet their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, group members repay the loan from their salaries.  

This group’s leader is Williams, who is 50 years old. He was born in Kamboma, a place in eastern Sierra Leone. Williams is married to a teacher and the couple has five children, two of whom are in primary school and three who are in secondary school. Williams is requesting a 1,000,000 SLL loan to buy materials to construct a house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is unmarried and lives with her father. She is 38 years old and is involves in making & selling artificial jewelry. She makes bracelets and neck chains with beads. There is a high demand for these items among women and especially girls. She also sells jewelry in her region by purchasing them from different areas in good quantities.
   
EID (a Muslim occasion) is near and she has a larger number of orders to fulfill. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. With the loan, she will buy jewelry of good designs in a larger quantity and beads of different varieties to be able to meet her orders and earn a profit. She is very talented and has been operating her business for more than a year. She is very confident that an investment will help her earn large profits and improve her business conditions.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Farzana.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and beads

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.es:
Entusiasmo y energía positiva son las palabras que caracterizan a Leonel quien desde hace muchos años se gana la vida siendo comerciante, actualmente tiene un restaurante ubicado en caldas, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabaja diariamente con la ilusión de llegar a tener un mejor futuro, para él y su hermana quien le ayuda con la producción de comida en el restaurante.

Juntos han sacado su negocio adelante, y han luchado con gran positivismo para lograr sus metas, sueñan con abrir otro restaurante donde generar más empleos directos, un negocio que no sólo les brinde estabilidad económica si no que también le brinde la oportunidad de ayudarle a otras personas. Sin embargo hoy tiene un propósito más inmediato, comprar surtido e insumos para su restaurante, así tendrán mejor capacidad de producción, incrementando las ventas, sus ingresos, y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enthusiasm and positive energy are the words that describe Leonel, who has earned his livelihood for many years as a merchant. He currently has a restaurant in Caldas, a town in the Department of Antioquia. Leonel works every day with the intent of having a better future for himself and his sister, who helps him with preparing the food in the restaurant.

Together they have been able to move their business forward. They have strived to achieve their goals with a positive attitude. Leonel dreams of opening another restaurant so that more jobs can be created. He hopes to have a business that not only provides economic stability, but also creates opportunities to help other people. However, today his immediate goal is to buy ingredients and supplies for his restaurant so that he can improve his production capacity, increase his sales, improve his income, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Ronelio

texts.en:
Ronelio, 37, resident in Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Josephine, a house wife and mother to their 4 children. Two study in elementary school while the other two are at home. 

Ronelio is a fish vendor who buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo.  He buys at the local fish port and sells early in the morning using his tricycle. There are many patrons who prefer Ronelio’s products since they are fresh and clean. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales daily.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. He expects a boost in income as he expands his business.  
---------------------------------------------------------

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  Group are composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay their micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish he needed in his business.

loans.name: Yekaterina

texts.ru:
Екатерина старше 65 лет. Она живет и работает в курортном городе Бердянске. Она вдова. Екатерина занимается торговлей женской обуви и одежды, а также головных уборов. С тех пор как Екатерина открыла свою торговую точку, она постоянно стремилась ее развивать и пополняла ассортимент товара. Несмотря на свой преклонный возраст, Екатерина отличается трудоспособностью, физически здорова, постоянно торгует вот уже 15 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет 40 000 гривен. 

Екатерина планирует использовать кредит в 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и удачно его реализовать по ценам ниже обычных рыночных на сегодняшний момент. Прошлой весной Екатерина Юрьевна сделала капитальный ремонт в своем доме, установила кондиционер, приобрела компьютер для внука, поклеила обои в доме, отреставрировала наружную часть западной стороны дома.

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Yekaterina is older than 65 years old.  She lives and works in the resort town of Berdyansk.  She is a widow.  Yekaterina is involved in sales of women's shoes and clothing and also hats.  Since Yekaterina opened her retail outlet, she has always tried to grow and expand the merchandise assortment.  Despite her age, Yekaterina stands out for her hard work; she is physically healthy and has been working in this business consistently for 15 years.  Currently, her revolving capital amounts to 40,000 hryvnia.  Yekaterina plans to use the 12,000 hryvnia loan to expand the merchandise assortment and successfully sell it at prices lower than usual current market prices.  Last spring, Yekaterina Yur'evna made major repairs to her house, installed an air conditioner, bought a computer for her grandson, replaced wallpaper in her home and repaired an outer west-facing side of her house.

loans.use: to expand merchandise assortment

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 31-year-old married man with three children and he rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in buying and selling coffee for five years. He started with UGX 500,000 and now has UGX 8,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is unpredictable coffee price changes and his vision is to have a capital of UGX 50,000,000, and to educate his children. Julius needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 35 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Fe, que se encuentra en Los Chiles en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta comunidad se encuentra en una zona montañosa y está cerca de la frontera norte del país. Las actividades comerciales principales son la ganadería y la agricultura, especialmente el cultivo de granos básicos, caña de azúcar y naranjas.

Guillermo trabaja como secretario de la empresa desde hace unos meses y este es el medio por el cual genera ingresos para su familia.  Ha crecido de manera significativa, los vecinos de la comunidad lo han apoyado mucho y ahora es capaz de salir adelante.

Guillermo espera obtener un microcrédito de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una computadora y un escritorio. La adquisición de estos insumos tiene gran sacrificio y exige más trabajo. Sin embargo, su deseo de convertirse en un exitoso microempresario y mejorar la condición de vida de su familia lo motiva a seguir adelante con gran cuidado y dedicación.

Guillermo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 150 organizaciones socios de EDESA en Costa Rica. Es su primer préstamo y con esto
texts.en:
Guillermo is 35 years old and lives with his family in the community of Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles in the province of Alajuela. This community is in a mountainous zone and is close the the northern border of the country. The main commercial activities are cattle ranching and farming, especially growing basic grains, sugar cane and oranges.

Guillermo has worked as a clerk for a business for a few months and this is how he earns income for his family. He has grown significantly and the neighbors have supported him a lot and now he is capable of getting ahead.  

Guillermo hopes to obtain a microloan of 600,000.00 (six hundred thousand colones) to buy a computer and a desk. Acquiring these will mean a big sacrifice and require a lot of work. Nonetheless, he wants to be a successful micro-businessman and improve his family's quallity of life. This motivates him to get ahead with a lot of care and dedication. 

Guillermo is a member of the Manantial de Santa Fe communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan .

loans.use: to buy a computer and a desk.

loans.name: Imara B Group

texts.en:
Epuret is the facilitator of the Imara B group. Epuret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Epuret takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access to fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Epuret had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Epuret was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Epuret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Epuret will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Imara B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Epuret and her group appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sinoko B Shg Group

texts.en:
Rogers is the facilitator of the Sinoko B SHG group. Rogers and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rogers takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Rogers had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Rogers was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rogers and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Rogers will buy a piece of land and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sinoko B SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Rogers is pictured with his group members. The field officer is at the far left and one member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Gladis Natividad

texts.es:
Gladis de 31 años, empezó su negocio con la ayuda de una hermana quien le prestó un dinero para ponerse su negocio.

Realiza su trabaja solo todos los días sin horas fijas. Gracias a Dios no ha tenido ninguna dificultad en su negocio.

Esta felizmente unida con su esposo y tienen 4 hijos de 14, 11, 8 y 4 años que estudian en instituciones fiscales.

Su meta es poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gladis is 31 years old. She began her business with the help of a sister who loaned her money in order to put it into her business.

She works alone every day without fixed hours. Thanks to God, she has not had any problems in her business.

She is happily married and they have 4 children who are 14, 11, 8 and 4 years old who are studying in public schools.

Her goal is to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Herminia works hard to support her family.  She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Herminia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing/fish vending business.

Herminia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor  Antonio es  trabajador , se dedica a la venta  de libros  desde hace  siete meses , le gusta mucho leer y escribir ayudar a  su esposa en lo que necesite y tener hijos ya que  no puede tener  .
Esta felizmente casado con  la señora Araceli una señora  trabajadora humilde creativa y alegre.
Don  Toño como mas bien la conocen sus compañeros  también se dedica al mantenimiento de motocicletas desde hace  tres meses, el nos cuenta que es un buen negocio ya que le dedica la tarde a su taller de motocicletas.
Don Toño pidió el préstamo para la comprar de  libros para la venta y refacciones para motocicletas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por apoyar a las personas trabajadoras y  con deseos de ayudar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Antonio is hard-working and has been selling books for seven months.  He enjoys reading, writing, and helping his wife when she needs him.  He would like to have children but they cannot have any.  He is happily married to Araceli whom he describes as hard-working, humble, creative, and happy.
Don Toño, as he is better known to his friends, has also been repairing motorcycles for three months.  He tells us that it is a good business because he spends the afternoon in his motorcycle workshop. He is requesting the loan to purchase books for re-sale and spare parts for motorcycles.  He thanks the foundation for their support of hard-working people and willingness to help others.

loans.use: to purchase books for re-sale.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella tiene su negocio de panadería la cual elabora: pan francés, pan dulce, no tiene un horario establecido el oficio lo aprendió gracias al apoyo de su madre quien  siempre se ha dedicado al mismo negocio el cual ya tiene experiencia.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la materia prima que necesita como: harina, manteca, huevos, levadura y azúcar al tener la materia prima disponible para elaborar los productos y atender mejor a la clientela y de esa forma podrá mejorar los ingresos.
L a aspiración de Nelly es tener éxito en su negocio mejorar en su clientela y cubrir otros lugares repartiendo el pan cada día y ayudarles a sus hijos con los estudios para que se superen y tengan éxito en la vida.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her husband and their children. She has a business selling bread that she makes: French bread and sweet bread. She doesn’t have a set schedule. She learned this livelihood from her mother, who has always worked in this business and has experience.

She will use the loan to buy the ingredients she needs, such as: flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, and sugar. She will have the ingredients available to make her products and therefore tend better to her customers and she will be able to improve her income.

Nelly’s aspiration is to have success in her business, improve her customer base, reach other places by distributing bread every day, and help her children with their studies so that they can excel and be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, and sugar

loans.name: Matilñde Del Pilar

texts.es: Matilde del Pilar tiene 56 años de edad , ella es propietaria de un negocio en el cual no está solicitando el crédito para el negocio si no para acondicionar su vivienda donde habita que es su mayor sueño de acondicionar. El crédito que está solicitando es para construcción de un dormitorio lo cual comprara perlines, cemento, zic entre otros equipo para la construcción.
texts.en: Matilde del Pilar is 56 years old. She owns a shop but she is not requesting a loan for her activity, but to improve the house where she lives, as this is her greatest dream. The loan she is requesting will be used to have a bedroom built: she will buy purlins, cement, zinc and other construction materials.

loans.use: To buy purlins, cement and zinc.

loans.name: Margarita Irene

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que ella es madre y padre para él; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Margarita no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Margarita trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Margarita se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, como cosméticos, perfumes, esmaltes de uñas, desodorantes, cremas y otros, de esta manera Margarita tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Margarita, 51, lives in the city of Pisco with her son who she loves and is her main reason for living. 

She is a very hard working, kind and enthusiastic person who devotes all her efforts to getting her son ahead in life since she a single parent. 

Unfortunately due to a lack of economic resources, and because she had to work from when she was very young, Margarita could not study Business Administration as she had wanted. 

In her spare time she likes to play sports and sometimes she will cook a delicious meal of rice and seafood to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with a lof of effort and dedication Margarita has a small business selling beauty products. She works every day for approximately ten hours and believes it is going well due to her experience and because she treats her customers well. 

Margarita is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help given she can buy more merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, nail polish, deodorant, creams etc.. This way her business is better stocked and she can take care of more customers. 

She can keep working and striving to achieve her big dream of owning her own home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen  is 47 years old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Parveen ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 7 children. She wants to grow her business so she requested a Murabaha loan of 35000 PKR,  to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sarah would like to buy  vegetable seedlings to plant in her farm.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan runs a business selling women’s clothing and shoes in the local market. He decided to start his own business because he believes it is the only way to sustain a family in the present economic situation in Ukraine. He has been in this business for five years now and sees about $1,000 in gross revenue per month. Ivan is very focused and determined. He is grateful for the loans he has received from “Nadiya Ukraine” that have helped the expansion of his business. Last year Ivan opened two new vending facilities which have promoted solid growth in his sales. Ivan is requesting a loan of $500 for several reasons. He is planning to re-supply his inventory and purchase seasonal items which he can get at wholesale prices. It will also give him the resources to open another vending kiosk. The loan will be beneficial for Ivan’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for Ivan and his family.

Іван займається бізнесом з продажу жіночого одягу та взуття на місцевому ринку. Він вирішив почати власний бізнес, тому що вважає це єдиною можливістю забезпечувати родину в тих економічних обставинах, які на сьогоднішній день склалися в України. Іван займається цим бізнесом вже 5 років, його щомісячний дохід складає приблизно 1000 доларів. Іван – дуже цілеспрямований та наполегливий. Він цінує доступність кредитних послуг від „Надії України”, які сприяли розширенню його бізнесу. Минулого року Іван відкрив дві нових торгових точки, що, в свою чергу, прискорило розвиток торгівлі. Іван просить про позику в 500 доларів через декілька причин. Він хоче поповнити асортимент товарів, придбати сезонний одяг за оптовими цінами. До того ж він планує використати отримані кошти для того, щоб відкрити ще один кіоск. Позика допоможе бізнесу Івана залишатися конкурентноспроможним та сприятиме подальшому росту торгівлі, що, в свою чергу, збільшить прибутки Івана та покращить фінансове становище його рідних.

loans.use: To increase his stock

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Mr. Joel I., a LAPO Client of distinguished features, cherishes talking about LAPO loans, and the poor in Nigeria. Especially the impact of LAPO loans in his life and his family's life for the past 8 years.  He is bent on loyalty to LAPO, and ensures that repayment is 100%.  He is requesting a loan of $800 to increase his goods.

loans.use:
To buy more building materials & 
molding blocks

loans.name: Sakinahon

texts.ru:
Sakinahon sells chocolate and caramel candies. Her place of business is located in the central market of Isfara. Candy sales are going well and bring steady profits. Sakinahon is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband is in Russia and sends money to support the family. Profits from sales supplement Sakinahon’s family budget.

Sakinahon’s workday starts early in the morning and continues through late evening. She works without weekends. Early on her business was small and fit on a small counter. Now her business has grown and takes up a large counter. Half a year ago Sakinahon got a loan from MLF MicroInvest and increased her selection of caramels. Now Sakinahon would like to get a new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Ассортимент товаров Сакины составляют конфеты – шоколадные и карамели. Ее торговое место расположено на центральном рынке города Исфары. Торговля конфетами идет хорошо и приносит стабильную прибыль. Сакина замужем, ей 39 лет и у нее трое детей. Муж находится в России и присылает денег для содержания семьи. Прибыль от торговли дополняет семейный бюджет Сакины. Ее рабочий день начинается рано утром и продолжается до позднего вечера, и работает она без выходных. Раньше ее бизнес был маленьким и помещался на маленьком прилавке. Сейчас бизнес развился и занимает большой прилавок. Полгода назад Сакина получила займ в Микроинвест и увеличила ассортимент карамелей. Сейчас она собирается получить новый займ.

loans.use: For the further expansion of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Additional Stocks of Fuel Products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a taxicab

loans.name: Asunta's Group

texts.es:
Águeda, Asunta and Felicitas are associates of the Enthusiasts Communal Bank. Águeda is 70 years old and has 4 children and a grocery store in her own house located in the City of Cumana. Águeda has run this business since 1987. On the other hand, Asunta is 50 years old and has 6 children. She buys firewood in Vilcashuamán and sells it on Las Malvinas Avenue. Previously she was a washerwoman and sold food. Felicitas is 42 years old and has 3 children. Her business is to buy and to sell cochinilla (a red dye) and tara (a powder used in tanning). She goes to the fairs and communities to buy the cochinilla and resells it to the wholesalers. During the carnival, in February, she prepares a liquor of seven seeds that is maD. with corn, wheat, beans, arveja (a legume), goosefoot (an herb), kiwicha (a grain grown in the Andes) and chickpea. She sells this liquor in the stadiums where the carnival extras are organized.

Águeda, Asunta and Felicitas tell us that in their Communal Bank they are all like sisters. They have learned to save. With the loans they buy with cash and no longer have to pay surcharges like before when they bought with credit. Their loans of 400 soles, 800 soles and 400 soles will be invested in the purchase of tara, cochinilla, carbonated water, milk, noodles, firewood, and cereals.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Águeda, Asunta y Felicitas son socias del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Águeda tiene 70 años y 4 hijos, y tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su propia casa ubicada en la Ciudad D. Cumana. Águeda realiza este negocio desD. 1987. Por otro lado Asunta tiene 50 años y 6 hijos. Ella compra leña en Vilcashuamán y la venD. en la Av. Las Malvinas. Anteriormente ella era lavandera y vendía comida. Felicitas tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, y su negocio es comprar y vender cochinilla, tara. Ella va a las ferias y comunidades a comprar la cochinilla y lo revenD. a los mayoristas. Durante el carnaval, en febrero, ella prepara chicha D. siete semillas, que está hecha a base D. maíz, trigo, haba, arveja, quinua, kiwicha y garbanzo. VenD. esta chicha en los estadios donD. se organizan las comparsas D. carnaval.

Águeda, Asunta y Felicitas nos cuentan que en su Banco Comunal todas son como hermanas y aprendieron a ahorrar y con los préstamos compran al contado y ya no tienen que pagar recargos como antes cuando compraban al crédito. Sus préstamos son D. 400 soles, 800 soles y 400 soles que lo invertirán en la compra D. tara, cochinilla, gaseosa, leche, fideo, leña, cereales. Los sueños D. Águeda, Asunta, Felicitas son tener casa propia y D. material noble, educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y que su negocio aumente.

loans.use: Purchase of tara (a powder used in tanning), cochinilla (a red dye), carbonated water, milk, noodles, firewood and cereals.

loans.name: Nuru's Utulivu Group

texts.en:
Nuru, age 32, is married with 3 children (ages 6, 3, and 2). She sells medicine for a living and began this business in 2002. She works from 7am to 10pm daily, and now makes a monthly profit of about $325 from this business.

Nuru hopes to take out a loan to buy more inventory to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses in food and general items sales.

loans.use: To buy medicine inventory

loans.name: Ntinda East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Betty N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to boost business. Betty is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Betty makes approximately UGX 49000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Betty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 600000 in order to invest in her retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Betty is joined in her small group by Maria K., Aisha N., Betty N., and Sarah K.. Maria K. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy broiler mash. Aisha N. is currently operating a business in trading produce and wants a loan to add more capital to the business. Betty N. operates a business of running a retail shop and wants to add more capital to the business. Sarah K. is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan to buy broiler mash.

loans.use: Increase stock in retail shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 37 year old Fatuma J.. She is single with two children, ages 16 and 21.

In 1997, Fatuma established a printing and stationary business. She now requires a loan to purchase printer cartridges and paper. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional printer cartridges and paper.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Ms. Maria is 25 years old and she lives with her parents and brothers. She owns a convenience store located next to her house which she runs along with her 35 year-old sister, Rosa.

This business has been in existence for over a year at the same location. Maria and her sister are hairdressers and, besides the convenience store, they also own a small hair parlor. They take turns serving their customers whom, at many times, are exclusive clients that want to be served by Maria or her sister.

Maria wishes to continue her graduate studies, and that is why she keeps working hard and saving money so she will have enough to pay for an education. She is aware that a college degree will bring about better opportunities in life.

Maria has received a merchandise purchase offer at a very good price. She wishes to obtain a credit line that would allow her to buy this merchandise pack which includes: flour, olive oil, canned goods, household items among others.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

La señorita Maria tiene 25 años, vive en casa de sus padres, junto con sus dos hermanos, ella posee una despensa al lado de su casa la cual la administra con su hermana Rosa quien tiene 35 años.

Este negocio lleva más de un año de funcionamiento en dicho lugar, además de la despensa, María y su hermana son peluqueras, por lo que además de la tienda poseen una pequeña peluquería la cual se turnan para atender, en muchos casos ellas ya poseen clientas exclusivas que desean ser atendidas por María o por su hermana.

Maria desea seguir estudiando y cursar una carrera universitaria, para lo que ella se sacrifica día a día trabajando y ahorrando para obtener los rubros suficientes para sus estudios, ella sabe que un titulo universitario le brindará mayores oportunidades en la vida.

María ha recibido una buena propuesta de compra de mercaderías a un buen precio, por lo que ella esta muy deseosa de adquirir un crédito con el que podrá comprar este lote de mercaderías que incluye: harina, aceite, productos enlatados, artículos para el hogar, entre otras cosas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as, flour, olive oil, canned goods, household items and others.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena belongs to the Mujeres Talentosas (“Talented Women’s”) Communal Bank. Her business is located at Jr. Martir Olaya 113 in the District of Callería, in the Department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and has 6 children; she and her husband are separated. Lorena received her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos, which she used to buy clothing to sell.

Right now she is continuing with her business of selling clothing, and constantly tries to keep up with the latest fashions so that she can offer her customers the most recent clothes and accessories. Lorena spends her mornings looking after her children and her home. In the afternoons she goes out to purchase and sell more clothing so that she can have capital and generate more income, and thus be able to continue expanding her business.

Lorena will use this loan of 2,000 Soles ($750) to buy polo shirts, shoes, lingerie, trousers, wristwatches, cosmetics, etc. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Lorena is very happy with the help she has gotten from Manuela Ramos, since this is a very generous loan she is receiving. She is grateful for this opportunity to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lorena pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Martir Olaya 113, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años, es madre de 6 hijos, es separada, Lorena con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la compra y venta de mercadería.

En la actualidad continua con su negocio de venta de mercadería, viaja constantemente para traer las ultimas novedades y así ofrecer a sus clientes lo ultimo de la moda y accesorios, por las mañanas se dedica a atender su hogar y sus hijos y en las tardes sale a vender y cobrar, para así tener capital y generar mas ingresos y poder seguir creciendo con su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: polos, zapatos, lencería, pantalones, relojes, cosméticos, etc.

Lorena se siente muy feliz en Manuela Ramos, por que es un apoyo grande que recibe, gracias a eso puede salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Aimiti Gafa's Group

texts.en:
This group is from Satupaitea Pitonuu, one of the mostly populated villages in the island of Savaii. The members of the group will be producing traditional Samoan tapa (designed bark cloth). This is the group's first loan and because the members have not had access to this kind of financial support before. Each of them will be taking WST 750 ($305) to their families to start up their small businesses. This is a new start for them and they are willing to run on their own in order to get profit to help out their families.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools for making tapa

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
I have the need to expand my house, since it is very small and we would like to live more comfortably. I would like to construct an additional room and expand the bathroom in the back part of my house. We have a certain quantity of construction material that was purchased with part of my wages. Because I earn little, I am requesting a loan of $500 from you to construct the room and bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo la necesidad de ampliar mi casa, ya que esta muy pequeña y para mayor comodidad deseo realizar un cuarto mas y agrandar un baño en la parte de atrás de mi casa, contamos con cierta cantidad de material para la construcción, que se compro con una parte de mi sueldo pues es poco lo que gano, es por ello que solicito de ustedes la cantidad de $500.00 dlls. Para poder elaborar dicho cuarto y baño.

loans.use: To construct a room and a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Thi Mung

texts.vi: Chị Mung tham gia Quỹ tình thương năm 2004. Với số vốn vay ở vòng vốn đầu tiên là  2.000.000 đ chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư  vào mua giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi tại trang trại của gia đình.Với kinh nghiệm nhiều năm làm dự án chăn nuôi đến nay công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất  phát triển. Ngoài diện tích vườn, ao của gia đình, vợ chồng chị Mung còn mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để đầu tư đấu thầu thêm 2 mẫu ao thả cá. Vốn là người phụ nữ tháo vát với mong muốn cuộc sống của gia đình ngày càng được caỉ thiện nên hàng ngày chị Mung và con trai còn đi bán thịt lợn tại các chợ tại thành phố Hà Nội. Hàng tháng công việc buôn bán thịt lợn cũng đem lại nguồn thu nhập đáng kể cho gia đình chị. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay thêm 18.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi phát triển kinh tế gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Mung joined the TYM Fund in 2004. She borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND and used it to purchase animal feed and livestock to raise at home. Thank to her experiences from many years raising livestock, her business is now very developed. Beside utilising the family's garden and pond area, she obtained loans to buy more pond area to raise fish. As an active woman, Mrs. Mung wants to improve her family's standard of living, so everyday she also sells pork in various markets in Ha Noi city with her son. This business is also a significant source of income for her family. This time, she would like to borrow 18,000,000VND (1,100USD) to invest in raising livestock to further improve her family's financial situation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Padonhiwa

texts.fr:
Née à Badou en 1969, dame P. Padonhiwa est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle réside avec son mari dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Depuis l’année 2000, elle prépare et vend de la boisson locale fabriquée à base du mil. Cette boisson tant appréciée par les natifs du nord du Togo nécessite une technique de préparation. Etant donné qu’elle avait vécu au nord avant de revenir à Lomé en 2000 elle maîtrise bien cette préparation.
Elle sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de mil et 7 fagots de bois pouvant lui permettre de poursuivre son activité et aider la famille.
texts.en:
Born in Badou in 1968, Mrs. Padonhiwa P. is married and the mother of four children. She lives with her husband in the Agoé neighborhood in Lomé. Since the year 2000, she's been preparing and selling a local beverage made out of millet. This beverage is much appreciated by natives of Togo and requires a specific technique to be prepared. Since Mrs. P. lived in the north prior to coming back to Lomé in 2000, she masters this preparation very well. She's seeking this first loan to buy 3 sacks of millet and 7 bundles of firewood to enable her to pursue his business and help her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy millet and firewood

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Khom S., 58, and her husband, Mr. Lun Phoeng, 58, live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four daughters; three of them are married and live outside the family home. The youngest daughter weaves silk at home.

Mrs. Khom S. has been a silk weaver since she was 12 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband spins thread for neighbors to get extra income. He has been farming since he was young.

Mrs. Khom is requesting a loan of $600 to build a fence for her house and purchase silk materials for her daughter's weaving of silk.

loans.use: To build a fence for the house and purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del centro poblado de Chimbo, del distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 2 hijos que dependen de ella, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de productos veterinarios y también  la ayuda a criar animales para engorde. Con el préstamo  que recibió de S/.  500.00 nuevos soles inicio con este negocio y compro ganado ovino. Tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad cuenta con ganado vacuno y ovino que vende para pagar al Banco.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprara productos veterinarios.
 
Celia manifiesta que con el préstamo de Manuela Ramos pudo iniciar un negocio ya que otro Bancos no dan esa facilidad.
texts.en:
Celia belongs to the Espiritu Santo ["Holy Spirit"] community bank in Chimbo, a town in the Peruvian "provincia" of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 2 dependent children. Her husband sells veterinary products and also raises livestock for sale. With her first loan of S/.500 [500 Peruvian soles], she started her livestock business and bought sheep to raise. She's worked with Manuela Ramos for two years.

She now depends on sales of cattle and sheep to repay the bank.

With this loan of S/1,200, to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy veterinary products.

Celia says that the loan from Manuela Ramos allowed her to start her business and gave her a chance that she couldn't get from other banks.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy veterinary products for livestock business.

loans.name: Sen's Group

texts.en: The loan to the group, which consists of six people, is located in Trapaing Thmat Village in Kampong Cham Province. The group has chosen Mr. Sen C. to be its leader.. He is a farmer who earns his living cultivating rice on a small piece of land. In addition to growing rice, he is raising four cows. Since the cow breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow. His wife, Mrs. Keov Ny, helps him with the businesses. Mr. Sen C. is 47 years old and does not have any children.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy one more cow for breeding.

loans.name: Chear

texts.en: Chear K., 37 years old and married with one child, lives with his wife in Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, where he typically earns $9 per day working at the local market as a butcher. His wife works as vegetable seller at the same place and contributes all of her wages to the household. Their child is a student at the nearby school. This couple hopes to use part of the loan to purchase a cow to expand the butcher business.

loans.use: To expand the butcher business.

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
A sus cuarenta y nueve años, Hercilia ha trabajado en casi todo. Siempre que ha tenido la oportunidad ha trabajado, no sabe decirle “no” a cualquier propuesta de trabajo, pues las condiciones en las que vive ella y su familia no le permiten rechazar cualquier ingreso de dinero a la economía del hogar.

Por ahora, ella se decía a vende los fines de semana, anticucho por el mercado en un pequeño puesto ambulante. Trabajo que viene realizando desde hace tres años. Paralelamente, desde hace un par de años, también vende papel higiénico por los mercados, ofreciendo no solo a los clientes si no también a los comerciantes. Hace algunos meses abandono la venta de kerosene pues el precio de este ha subido, por lo que las compras bajaron y ya no le era un negocio rentable.

Por otro lado, algunos días a la semana ayuda a en el negocio de su hermano, quien maneja una pastelería. Es así como comenzó a trabajar hace quince años. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción civil. Ambos ayudan en los gastos de la casa y en la manutención de sus dos hijas, de quince y trece años.

En sus planes se encuentra el terminar de construir su casa y  poner una licorería o tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
texts.en:
At 49 years old, Hercilia has worked in almost every type of job. She has never said “no” to any type of job offer since the conditions that her and her family live in do not allow them to pass up any type of opportunity to earn income for their home On the weekends, she sells anticucho (pieces of grilled, skewered meat sold in Peru) in a small stall in the local market. She has been doing this for the past three years. At the same time, she also sells toilet paper in the markets--she sells to individual customers and to businesses. Up until a few months ago she also sold kerosene but the price went up too much and the demand went down so it was not longer a profitable activity. Additionally, she also helps out in her brother’s bakery several days a week. That is how she first started working more than 15 years ago. Her husband works in civil construction. They both help pay for household expenses and for the care of their two daughters, who are 15 and 13 years old. Her future plans are to finish building her house and eventually open a liquor or grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase merchandise

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is a 37-year-old man who lives in Beirut (the capital of Lebanon) with his wife and their child. Mansour has owned a snack restaurant for four years. He does sandwiches, hot and cold beverages, and also “narguileh” (also known as “shisha” in Egypt). The nargileh is an ancient tradition enjoyed by the people of the Middle East. A tall (or short) water pipe is used to smoke fruit flavored tobacco. Nargileh is enjoyed in cafes across the Middle East, and is beginning to gain popularity in the US, European nations, and other countries.

Mansour has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his snack restaurant. This is the first time that Mansour has requested a loan.

Mansour is special in his work because he is known for his good sandwiches. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building networking. Mansour decided on doing his business because he always wanted to open a restaurant and work on his own, and because he has experience in the business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his snack restaurant

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo Jarol quien es chef y sus dos pequeños hijos; Jarol y Luana, en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican al negocio de la cocina desde hace 11 años, pues tienen un restaurante, el cual administran los dos y donde trabajan juntos, aveces también la ayuda su madre, haciendo que el negocio sea cada vez más productivo. A ellos les gusta mucho el negocio de la cocina porque tienen muy buena sazón y les gusta ver la satisfacción en el rostro de sus clientes, los cuales en su mayoría se van muy contentos despues de haber degustado los deliciosos platillos que preparan. Pero la mayoría de las veces es muy sacrificado su trabajo y suelen terminar a altas horas de la noche, felizmente son muy unidos y esperan generar buenos ingresos para la educacion de sus hijos y de su familia. En el futuro les gustaría tener una cadena de restaurantes y así poder gozar de una mejor estabilidad económica. Ana se encuentra en su tercer préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en los pagos, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más mesas para expandir su negocio, además arreglará la fachada y comprará algunos utensilios de cocina.
texts.en:
Ana is 27 years old and lives with her husband Jarol, who is a chef. They have 2 small children, Jarol and Luana, and live in their own home. They have both worked in the food business for the past 11 years. They have a restaurant that they manage and work in together. Sometimes Ana’s mother helps too, which makes the business even more productive. They like working in the restaurant because they make good food and enjoy seeing the satisfaction on their customers’ faces. The majority of their customers leave feeling content after having enjoyed one of the delicious meals that they prepare. But they also have to sacrifice a lot for their jobs and usually finish working very late at night. Happily, they are very united and hope to earn a good enough salary to pay for their children’s educations. In the future they would like to open a restaurant chain in order to enjoy more economic stability. This is Ana’s 3rd loan with MFP and she has always been on time with her payments. With this loan she will buy more tables to expand her restaurant. She will also make improvements to the outside of the restaurant and purchase some kitchen utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tables and restaurant supplies

loans.name: Djemanguelen Group

texts.fr:
Le six femmes du groupe Djemanguelen ont en  moyenne de 49 ans,  4 enfants et vivent toutes  dans le quartier Bamanankin du village de Togo (4ème région administrative du Mali) dans des foyers polygames. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et de voisinage et font la transformation vente des graines de néré en sounbala et la vente du bois de chauffe.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé les six premiers prêts solidaires, ce groupe est à son septième prêt de groupe qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 800 kg de graines de néré. Elles s’approvisionnent  hebdomadairement au grand marché de Ségou, ces graines sont transformées en sounbala qui est un condiment très prisé et utilisé dans les sauces africaines. Le sounbala est obtenu à partir des graines de néré qui sont décortiquées, lavées et longuement cuites, ensuite pilées, lavées plusieurs fois  pour  être débarrassées de leurs épluches et de tout corps étranger ; cuites de nouveau et  fermées hermétiquement dans un vase sans rouille pendant deux jours  puis  broyées, mises en boules, passées à la vapeur et séchées. Le sounbala est ainsi prêt pour la consommation et la vente. Elles vendent au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes à domicile, en ambulant au village et au grand marché de Ségou.
Elles envisagent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000FCFA qu’elles comptent utiliser pour le remboursement du prêt et la participation aux évènements sociaux (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles). 
Elles ont pour ambitions la construction d’une maison en usage  d’habitation dont la toiture est en tôle
texts.en:
The six women of the Djemanguelen group have an average age of 49 with 4 children and live in the Bamanankin district of the village of Togo (fourth administrative region of Mali) in polygamous households. They met each other because of ties of marriage and neighborhood and they transform néré seeds into "sounbala" (a condiment) and sell firewood.

They are on their seventh solidarity loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first six. They intend to use this loan to buy 800 kg of néré seeds. They buy their supplies weekly in the big open-air market of Ségou. These seeds are transformed into "sounbala", a condiment much esteemed and used in African sauces. Sounbala is made out of néré seeds are hulled, washed and cooked for a long time, then pounded and washed several times to get rid of their peels and any foreign matter. Then they are cooked again and hermetically sealed in a rust-free container for two days, then stirred, shaped into balls, steamed and dried. The resulting sounbala is ready for consumption and sale. They sell for cash and credit to a clientele composed mainly of women, out of their homes, walking around the village, and in the big open-air market of the town of Ségou.

They hope to make a monthly average profit of 17,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and participate in community events (marriages, baptisms, and funerals). Their ambition is to be able to build a house to live in with a corrugated iron roof.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of néré seeds

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Señor Edgar C. tiene 30 años de edades y es soltero.  Edgar es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguà y vive con sus padres en casa propia.

Edgar  se  iniciò al trabajo independiente desde muy joven. Empezó a trabajar en una fabrica de calzados como costurero. Trabajó en la fabrica por mas de 3 años y de apoco fue ahorrando para poder empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia. Su  familia se dedica a la venta  ambulante de artesania y tal es  asì que al  reunir un capital importante decidiò acompañar a su padre por  sus recorridos  por  su  zona de trabajo para conseguir sus  propios clientes. Actualmente ya tiene su propia clientela formada y cada día va aumentando de clientes y  su  microempresa esta  en crecimiento constante.
    
Con el  crédito desea comprar  hilo y color.
texts.en:
Señor Edgar C. is 30 years old and single. Edgar comes from the city of Carapeguà and lives with his parents in their own house. He started working for himself at a young age. He started working in a shoe factory as a tailor. He worked there for over three years and he was gradually saving up so that he could begin to work for himself. His family works at peddling artisan crafts, and the way that is, in order to raise a good amount of capital, he decided to go with his father through the streets of the zone where he works in order to get his own clients. Currently he has his own customers lined up and every day he is adding more. His micro-business is constantly growing. With this loan he intends to buy thread and color.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Threads and Color

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Modou T. est un mareyeur il travaille dans le quai de pêche de Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar. Il évolue dans le secteur de la pêche de plus de deux (2) ans. Chaque jour il achète le poisson des pécheurs pour le revendre aux usines de poissonnerie .Avec les revenus tirés de son activité, il entretien sa femme, ses enfants et ses parents.  A trente quatre (34) ans il n’a jamais eu de prêts. Il sollicite un prêt pour renforcer  et soutenir son activité  pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle plus nombreuse.
texts.en:
Modou T. is a fish wholesaler. He works on the fishing pier in the coastal city of Mbour, located 70 km from Dakar. He has been improving in the fish sector for over two years. Each day, he buys fish from fishermen to sell to fish factories. With the revenues derived from his work, he takes care of his wife, children, and parents. He is 34 years old and has never had a loan. He’s requesting a loan to bolster his business in order to satisfy the demands of his bigger customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa Thị Đậu was born in 1959. There are four people in her family: her husband, two sons, and herself.  They have a bazaar at home. In addition, she breeds pigs and poultry. They have a monthly income of about 3.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND ($350 USD) to buy goods to sell in their bazaar. 

Hoa Thị Đậu is the group leader of this loan group. There are three other Fund participants:

Mười Thị Trịnh was born in 1949. She sells noodle soup every morning in her  village. She also makes wine to sell. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to buy rice.
 
Xuyến Thị Đỗ was born in 1977. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to expand her bazaar.

Huyên Thị Phùng was born in 1974. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND ($285 USD) to buy Coca Cola, beer, and other items to sell in her bazaar.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is forty-five years old and married with six children, three sons and three daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer and Elizabeth trades in food stuffs – cassava, plantain and yams. She sells from a table top at the market square and also supplies other retailers and food vendors. She needs a loan to buy yams in bulk. Elizabeth has been in business for ten years. She wants to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des articles de mercerie, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de produits de beauté, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. Sa clientèle grandit et pour mieux les satisfaire, elle veut agrandir son stock par l’achat de 10 tissus, 3 cartons de boutons et divers articles de mercerie et des produits de beauté raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de wages un crédit
texts.en:
This young woman is unmarried, and to meet her own needs, she started a business selling dressmaking items. She has also added the sale of cosmetics to her business. She supplies herself at the grand market in Lomé. Her clientele is growing and to better satisfy her customers, she would like to enlarge her stock by buying 10 sets of fabric, 3 boxes of buttons, and various other dressmaking items and cosmetics. For this reason, she is seeking a loan through Wages, one of Kiva's field partners.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Arcelle

texts.en:
Arcelle G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 34, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arcelle owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Arcelle recently started this business.

In 2008, Arcelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arcelle repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which she used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell. Arcelle is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Matias

texts.en: Matias H. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Matias owns and operates a business running a food stall, selling alacarte (grilled meat) like chicken feet, wings, pork and other items in the local community. Matias is just starting this business. In 2009, Matias joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his children and to supplement his family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy S. is from the village of Gingoog, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 16 years.

In 2009, Juvy joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku L. is 20 years old and married to a businessman. She has two school-going children. Kaku sells beer and cooking oil from home and is requesting a loan to open a bar at the nearby market. With the extra profits from her loan, Kaku hopes to build a store for selling foodstuffs such as rice, beans, etc.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bar at the nearby market

loans.name: Khin

texts.en: Two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Khin K. and her husband, who are standing on their farm field. This couple cultivates variety kinds of crop to earn a living. They both are parents of two children; one of whom is working away from home, while other one attends school and works on the farm. To help alleviate the hard physical labor on the farm, Khin K. will be used her loan to buy a pair of water buffalo which she will use to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To buy a pair of water buffalo which she will use to plow the farmland

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, a responsible 40-year-old married mother of five children, has her children's needs and welfare at heart. Currently, two children have completed school and are working while her other three are still in school. Comfort is a trader selling used clothes, popular with many people, and thus she has many customers. However, due to only a small amount of working capital, she can barely sell enough to make a reasonable profit; therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more bales of used clothes in order to increase her income to better meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: We Hope To God Group

texts.en: Mariatu M., Fatmata K., Mariama M. K., Hawa J., and Falilatu J. chose an inspiring name for their newly-formed loan group, We Hope to God. These borrowers wish to expand their businesses, increase their income, and improve their standard of living thanks to a loan of 2.5 million leone (SLL) from SMT and Kiva lenders.
