Mariatu is the group leader. She is a 30-year-old single mother of two children, both of whom are currently enrolled in school. Mariatu has sold clothes, rubber, shoes, and other assorted goods for 5 years, and will use her share of the group loan to expand her inventory.

loans.use: Expand inventory of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Willy Carlos

texts.es:
Willy tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a su madre y cinco hermanos en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años trabaja como pintor de vehículos, el nos comenta que un amigo fue el que le enseñó esta actividad y desde entonces trabaja eventualmente pintando buses y autos. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza en sus gastos personales y en el apoyo a la economía de su familia.

Hace dos años, juntando el dinero de sus ahorros, adquirió una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros) con la que se gana el sustento durante las temporadas en que no trabaja como pintor. El aún no termina de pagar este vehículo, por lo que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para terminar de pagarla y darle el mantenimiento que requiere debido al tiempo de uso.

Su sueño es poder comprar otra mototaxi para seguir adelante y apoyar a su familia. El es un joven optimista, trabajador y constante. En la fotografía aparece luego de su jornada de trabajo como pintor.
texts.en:
. Willy, 22, is single and lives with is mother and five siblings in the city of Chiclayo. For the last five years he has worked painting cars. He tells us that a friend taught him this skill and, since then, he gets occasional jobs painting cars and buses. What he earns he uses for his personal expensses and to help with family expenses. Two years ago, using all his savings, he acquired a mototaxi (three-wheeled, motorized vehicle, used to transport passengers and cargo) with which he earns his keep when he isn't painting vehicles. He hasn't paid off this vehicle yet so he is requesting financing from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 new soles to pay it off and do some service maintenance that it needs due to its time in use. His dream is to be able to buy another mototaxi so that he can continue to help support his family. He is an optimistic, steady and hard-working young man. In the photo he appears at the end of one of his work days as a car painter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish paying off and service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suena Y Metas 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Lina is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza because Esperanza can help supply her "fantasy". To explain: she plans to use this loan to invest in her business which is called a "fantasia" (or fantasy). The reason for the name is that these stores usually supply things that women and girls like such as stationary, clothing, underwear and other desirable items. With this loan, Lina will be looking to supply her store with blouses, women's pants and high heels. She will use the profit to supply her store. Her long-term goal is to earn enough profit to purchase a vehicle to move her merchandise. She thanks you all for your support.

Lina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con Suena y Metas ("Women with Goals and Dreams"), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring the capital, Santo Domingo – an area plagued by crime where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and their three children.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and women's shoes

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: K. Akouavi est née le 20 Mai 1953 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mariée à OGOULOLA Louis, un maçon,  Akouavi est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Akouavi a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses enfants. Akouavi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environs 6 ans que Akouavi vit dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Akouavi n’a fait que le cours primaire. Akouavi vend depuis plus de 5 ans, des produits divers (conserves, savons, bougies, pâtes alimentaires, petits pois, piles, sardines, huile d’arachide, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Akouavi s’approvisionne. Akouavi a obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l’a bien remboursé. Akouavi désire augmenter son capital afin de compléter le stock de ses produits. C’est la raison pour laquelle Akouavi sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Akouavi was born on May 20, 1953 in Ouidah, a historic city of Benin.  She is married to OGOULOLA Louis, a mason, and is the mother of two children who are both in school.  She has another child to support in addition to her own.  She lives together with her children and husband in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living in this district for about six years.  The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered.  Akouavi has attended only primary school.  For five years, she has been selling various goods (canned foods, soaps, candles, pasta, peas, batteries, sardines, peanut oil, etc.) in her store in her home.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up.  She once obtained a loan from ALIDé and has repaid it.  She would like to augment her capital in order to round out her stock of goods.  This is the reason why she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 2 boxes of canned tomatoes, a box of soap, 2 boxes of pasta, 1 container of peanut oil

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: El señor Feliciano R. Pérez es casado con la señora Amada Aguilera y son un matrimonio muy sólido y responsable, anteriormente solicitaron un crédito para la inversión en la compra de mercancía para su negocio, donde elaboran y venden pan de dulce, ya que tiene un historial crediticio excelente están tramitando nuevamente para la inversión en la compra de materia prima tales como harina, azúcar, entre otros. Ya que en esta temporada es muy buena para la venta, porque todas las familias desean saborear de un delicioso pan de dulce suavecito y recién horneado.
texts.en:
Feliciano R. Pérez is married to Amada Aguilera. They form a solid and responsible marriage. A previous loan that they used to buy merchandise for their business, which is a bakery-they produce sweet bread, provided them with an excellent credit history. This new funding will be used to buy basic ingredients, like flour and sugar, among others, since this is a high-sales season because all the families want to enjoy delicious, sweet, freshly-baked bread.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro Barrante M., tiene la edad de 26 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 5 y 1 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una moto para poder trasladarse al trabajo, ya que por el lugar donde vive el acceso al transporte público a  veces es difícil. Este transporte le va a permitir llegar puntual a su trabajo y de esta manera dar mayor rendimiento laboral. 
Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro tener una mejor estabilidad en su trabajo y así poder brindarle a sus hijos y esposa una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Alejandro Barrante M., 26, is married and has two children, who are his first priority in life. They are 5 and 1 years old, respectively. He needs funding to buy a motorcycle so he can get to work; public transport where he lives is very difficult. Having his own means of transportation will allow him to get to work on time so that he can be a better employee. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is happy with the terms offered. He hopes to have better work stability in the future so that he can provide his wife and children with a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
El señor Dionisio vive en casa propia con su esposa e hijos en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como constructor.

El crédito que solicita es para instalar una pensión (es un pequeño restaurante donde sirve almuerzo y cena a clientes seguros que pagan por el total de un mes) para su esposa, ya que construyo su casa y habilito una tienda para que su esposa colabore con los ingresos de la familia.

Es cliente de Impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo que puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Dionisio lives in his own house with his wife and children in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. He works as a builder. The loan he requests is for installing a 'pensión' (a small restaurant which serves breakfast and supper to subscribing customers who pay by the month), for his wife. He has already built his house and equipped it with a store, so that his wife can contribute to the family income. He is a client of IMPRO and has a very good history of making payments, and for that reason he can have access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR INSTALLATION OF  A SMALL RESTAURANT FOR HIS WIFE

loans.name: Brenda Carolina

texts.es: la sra. Brenda Carolina P. se dedica al transporte de materiales de construccion, tiene mas de 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, esta actividad la realiza comprando los materiales y los lleva a los lugares en donde estan construyendo, Brenda nos comentaba que su vehiculo lo han ido mejorando poco a poco ya que es el alma de su trabajo, pero ahorita necesita mantenimiento y cambio de llantas, gracias a este negocio ella junto con su esposo han logrado salir adelante y poder cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Brenda Carolina P. transports construction materials. She has been working in the transportation business for over 8 years. She purchases construction materials and then brings them to the construction sites. Her truck is the heart and soul of her business.

Brenda has been making improvements on her vehicle little by little, but it currently requires maintenance and a tire change. Thanks to her business, she and her husband have managed to improve their lives and are able to pay for their household expenditures.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires and replacement parts for vehicle repair

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is a LAPO client. She is a fashion designer, and she also sells sarongs, ice blocks, soft drinks, and sachet water. She makes lovely Nigerian and western designs for her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. Kate is 42 years old, she is married with a child, and her husband is a transporter. She hopes to have more children in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 37-year-old single mother of three school-going children. She has been selling charcoal in Naivasha town for the last five years.

Margaret was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan.  She used the first loan of Kshs 10,000 to buy charcoal for resale and she paid it back well.  Demand for charcoal has increased steadily and she is seeking more funding from KADET to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. 

She plans to open a retail shop and operate it as a second source of income in the near future.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia T. sells local brews and beer from home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Nadia is 39 years-old and is married with a husband that is a nurse . She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar at the market place.

Kiva partner BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City. She is 33 years old. Edna is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business selling barbecue in the local community. Edna is just starting this business.

In 2010, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her child's education. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, Nancy tiene un taller de pintura y fibra en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal, Nancy se encarga de la administración, además tiene una pequeña tienda en el mismo local en donde vende bebidas. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de pinturas. Lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones que recibe. Nancy sueña con ampliar su taller y que todos sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a widow with four children. She runs a paint and body shop in a rented locale; she employs staff to help her with the work. Nancy runs the business. She also has a small place where she sells beverages. She will use the funds to buy paint. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the training sessions she gets. Nancy’s dreams are to expand her shop and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint.

loans.name: Edel Maria

texts.es:
Portoviejo es la capital de la provincia de Manabí, una hermosa ciudad que se destaca sobre todo por estar rodeada de un valle y encontrar en ella gente muy honrada y trabajadora, los manabitas son muy solidarios y dedicados a sus trabajos, es así como podemos definir también a la señora Edel, una mujer dedicada y esforzada.

 Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, es comerciante ambulante hace 14 años, para Edel  la mejor  temporada para el negocio es fin de año, deja muchas ingresos aunque también hay que trabajar más, pero es la mejor época y hay que aprovecharla,  vende pantalones, blusas, ropa para hombre y mujeres.

 Edel tiene tres hijos, vive con uno de ellos,su esposo se separo de ella y se fue a vivir a España, ahora ella vela por el bienestar de su hijo y desea que salga adelante, ha sido padre y madre desde que se quedo sola, ella trabaja mucho y lo hace con orgullo, sabe que es por el bien de ella y de su hijo, su forma de trabajar es recorriendo la ciudad y ofreciendo su mercadería por sectores, tiene clientes fijos;  viaja a Guayaquil a comprar la mercadería, por eso está solicitando un crédito para invertir en su negocio, necesita comprar variadas prendas de vestir al igual que zapatos y carteras.
texts.en:
Portoviejo is the capital of the province of Manabí, a beautiful city that stands out mostly for the surrounding valley and by its honorable and hard-working people. This is how we can also define Edel, a dedicated woman who puts forth a great effort to succeed. She sells shoes and clothing, and has been a street merchant for 14 years. The best season for Edel’s business is year-end, when she brings in a good income even though she has to work more. However, it is the best season, and one must take advantage of it. She sells pants, blouses, and men and women’s clothing. Edel has three children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband left her, and went to live in Spain. Now, she yearns for the well-being of her son and wants him to get ahead. She has played the role of both mother and father since she has been alone. She works a great deal, and does it with pride, knowing that it’s for her own good as well as her son’s. She carries out her work by traveling the city offering her wares in each sector. She has repeat customers. She travels to Guayaquil to buy merchandise, which is why she is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She needs to buy various types of clothing, as well as shoes and purses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, purses, and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Juanita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Juanita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juanita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for livestock

loans.name: Adjéoda

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un  homme marié avec 2 enfants, il vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier de hedzranawoé qui est un quartier de la ville de Lomé. il a appris la menuiserie, il a ouvert son propre atelier dans lequel il fabrique et vend des meubles à partir du bois. actuellement il a reçu des commandes qu'il ne peut satisfaire parce qu'il ne dispose plus de bois, il sollicite chez WAGES un prêt qui puisse lui permettre d'acheter  du bois et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
This gentleman is married with two children, and lives with his wife and children in the Hedzranawoé borough of Lomé. He learned carpentry and opened his own workshop, where he builds and sells wooden furniture. He currently has orders he is unable to honor because he is out of wood. He is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES that will enable him to buy wood and satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy wood and other materials

loans.name: Mercedesa

texts.en:
Mercedesa C. is a 31-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a fish-vending  business. She lives in Brgy. Tan-awan, Oslob, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish-vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP4,000. 

Mercedesa is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she  can purchase more inventory. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Mercedesa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

Photo was taken after she had sold her fish stock early in the morning. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of more stock to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old and married. He sells clothes to earn a living. He is a member of a self-help group called Rohi in Faulu Kenya. He says that his  living standard has improved since he joined Faulu Kenya. So far, he has serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts. He hopes to open a wholesale boutique in five years. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts

loans.name: Mesefu

texts.en:
Mesefu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver by profession and he contributes to the family's needs. She has been operating her retail shop for the past two years. It is located near a school so her potential customers are school-going children. In addition to this shop, she has rental houses that contribute another source of income.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bundle of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and kitchen utensils for sale.

Mesefu faces the major challenge of delays in payments by those who buy goods on credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future and become a wholesaler.

She decided to work with Yehu because of its sustainable financial services for entrepreneurs. She owns a house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of  wheat flour, maize flour, rice and kitchen utensils for sale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo tiene 51 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, tiene 6 años de tener este negocio por lo que no ha sido fácil, pues el combustible está muy caro. Esta actividad nació con fondos propios y con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo. Don Reynaldo ha continuado con este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia, además que es un negocio bastante rentable. El señor solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar llantas para su automóvil entre otras cosas. Su sueño es brindar un mejor servicio y de esta manera, mejorar la casa en que habita.
texts.en: Señor Reynaldo is 51 years old. He is married and is responsible for three minor children. His work is offering transportation services. He has been in this business for 6 years, and it has not been easy, since the fuel is very expensive. He began this business with his own money and with great effort and enthusiasm. Don Reynaldo has continued with this business due to the need to generate income to support his family. In addition, it is a fairly profitable business. He is applying for this loan with the intention of buying tires for his automobile, among other things. His dream is to offer a better service and in this way to improve the house where he lives.

loans.use: Buy tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen K., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. K. sells groceries, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. K. has to spend 75 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 35 USD on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Paola Marily

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Paola, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y en la actualidad está esperando un hijo, está en su segundo mes de embarazo, su marido es chofer y trabaja en Manta.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de la marca Esika (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), trabaja los fines de semana desde las 9am hasta las 16h00, en estos días  enseña la revista, anota los pedidos y luego realiza los pedidos a la empresa, recibe los productos en su casa y entrega los productos a sus clientas a quienes les da facilidades de pago, les cobra por semana o cada quince días, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya 4 años y que le ha ido bien  ya que con esto ha podido aportar a los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido de este mes. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal le gusta porque aquí se cumplen bien todos los reglamentos y normas. Su sueño es tener su propio bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet every fortnight in Los Jazmines, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we find and meet 23 year-old Paola.  Paola lives with her common-law husband and she is currently expecting a baby.  She is two months pregnant.  Her husband is a driver and works in Manta.

Paola sells Esika brand products (beauty products, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works weekends from 9.00am to 4.00pm.  She shows her catalog to her customers, makes a note of their orders and then transmits the orders to the company.  She receives the products at home and then delivers them to her customers who she provides with easy repayment terms.  She collects her money every week or every fortnight.  She tells us that she has been in this business for 4 years and that it has done well and allowed her to help with her household expenses.

This loan will be used to pay for this month's order.  This is the second loan cycle for Paola's community bank.  She likes the bank because all the rules and regulations are properly observed.  Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: To buy beauty products, perfume and costume jewelry

loans.name: Maryuri Yessenia

texts.es:
Maryuri tiene 18 años de edad, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, la Universidad le otorgó media beca y el resto sus padres la ayudan a pagar, su Mamá es Enfermera y su Papá es Agricultor. Le encantan los Cultivos y la crianza de animales domesticos. Su familia tenia un negocio de Crianza, engorde y venta Avicola.

Ella realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Su meta es adquirir conocimientos y tecnicas basicas de su carrera, coronar su carrera, conseguir un trabajo en una empresa y proximamente tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Maryuri is 18 years old.  She is in her second year of higher education in agricultural engineering.  The university gave her a grant for half of the cost, and her parents help her pay for the rest.  Her mother is a nurse, and her father is a farmer.  She really likes growing crops and raising domestic animals.  Her family has a business of raising, fattening, and selling poultry.

She used this loan to buy supplies for a university project of cultivating cabbage.

Her goal is to get the knowledge and basic techniques for her career, to set up her career, and to find work with a company.  Next, her goal is to have her own business.

loans.use: For a student agricultural project of growing cabbage

loans.name: Rosula Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosula es socia del banco comunal Las Perlas de Manantay, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad.  Su esposo es comerciante y la apoya en los gastos de la casa.
Hace algún tiempo estuvo trabajando en la confección de prendas de vestir, con las máquinas que tenía podía trabajar, pero necesitaba capital.  Cuando ingresó al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos le dieron un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 soles, con el cual pudo comprar telas al por mayor.
La señora Rosula trabaja con Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años y medio, gracias a los préstamos otorggados ha podido comprar una maquina más y materiales que necesitaba para confeccionar prendas de vestir.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 soles comprará 15 metros de tela algodón, para la confección de ropas interiores, 2 conos de elásticos, 3 conos de hilo de remalle, 6 conos de hilo de diferentes colores,  3 kilos de  licra para la elaboración de blusas, y 5 metros de tela chalis.
La señora Rosula está muy tranquila y alegre porque puede aportar un poquito de dinero a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosuela is a member of the Las Perlas de Manantay (Pearls of Manantay) communal bank in Ucayali department.  She is 38 years old, married and has four minor children.  Her husband is a merchant and helps her with household expenses.

Some time ago she was working making clothes.  She was able to work with the machines she had but she lacked capital.  When she joined the Manuela Ramos communal bank they gave her an initial loan of 300 soles that she used to buy fabric at wholesale.

Rosuela has been collaborating with Manuela Ramos for two and a half years.  Thanks to the loans she’s been granted she was able to buy another machine and supplies she needed to make the clothes.

With this 2500 sol loan she will buy 15 meters of cotton fabric to make underwear, 2 cones of elastic, 2 cones of mending thread, 6 cones of thread of assorted colors, 3 kilos of Lycra to make blouses and 5 meters of mohair.

Rosuela is content and very happy because she can contribute a bit of money to her home.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and supplies.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. is from the village of Santa Cruz in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Marilyn is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Marilyn plants, harvests, and sells a variety of vegetables. Marilyn is just starting this business.

In 2005, Marilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Marilyn's tenth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Analuz

texts.en:
Analuz M. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Analuz is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living she raises crops, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Analuz joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: San Judas Tadeo X Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama SAN JUDAS TADEO X, debido a la gran fe que le tienen a este Santo, por resolver las causas imposibles. El grupo pertenece a la comunidad de Bosques de Manzanilla, en el Estado de Puebla,  formado por 10  personas.La Tesorera del grupo es Doña Altagracia Reyna, tiene 47 años, es casada, estudio únicamente la primaria, se dedica a la venta de calzado y tiene actualmente 2 depedientes económicos. La Presidenta del grupo es Doña Rosa Hernández Q., quien se dedica a la  venta de ropa, telas y artículos de temporada,  estudio únicamente hasta la primaria, casada y cuenta con tres dependientes económicos, ella  es una mujer que ha salido adelante ante la pobreza y adversidad ante la falta de preparación educativa, nuestro crédito lo ocupa para realizar pedidos por adelantado y obtener mayor ganancia,  sus compañeras la conocen desde hace tiempo, les consta que es  una persona trabajadora y honesta.
texts.en:
This group is called San Judas Tadeo X, because of the great faith that they have in this saint for solving impossible problems. The group belongs to the Bosques de Manzanilla community, in the Puebla state. It is made up of 10 people. The group treasurer is Mrs. Altagracia Reyna. She is 47, married, and has only an elementary education. She sells shoes and has two economic dependents. 
The group president is Mrs. Rosa H. Q., who sells clothing, fabric and seasonal items. She has only an elementary education. She is married and has three economic dependents. She is a woman who has gotten ahead of poverty and adversity despite her lack of education. She will use this loan to fill some orders in advance and make a better income. The members of this group have known her for a long time, and say that she is a hard-working and honest person.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Henrry Victoriano

texts.es:
Don Henrry Victoriano V. P., es trabajadora de una empresa de acueducto y alcantarillado desempeñando el cargo de Jefe de Filial "C", desde hace 1 año y once meses.

Es casado, de 29 años de edad, con 2 personas que dependen de él uno de ellos es menor de edad. Vive en la ciudad de Managua, en el Municipio de Tipitapa, desde hace 9 años.

Este es el primer crédito de CEPRODEL el que lo solicita para Mejora de Vivienda, agradece a CEPRODEL por brindarle este crédito, ya que le permite mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Henrry Victoriano V. P. has worked for an acqueduct and sewer company as a Subsidiary Boss C for one year, 11 months.

He is married and 29 years old. He has two dependents, one of whom is a child. He has lived in the city of Managua, in the Municipality of Tipitapa for nine years.

This is his first loan with Kiva partner CEPRODEL, which he is requesting for home improvement. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving him this loan because it will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Sop Serigne Mansour Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERIGNE MANSOUR est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 24 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce et la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KELLE N.

Madame BATOR D. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a ausii la charge d'un enfant qui lui est confié par un proche. 

Elle fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Elle vend également du mil, du mait et du sucre

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOP SERIGNE MANSOUR was created on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of 24 women who are all from the same village. Their main activity is small-scale retail, and making peanut oil. 

The group belongs to the Kelle N. Banc Villageois. Mrs. Bator D., standing at the far right of the photo, is the group's leader. She is 59 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for the child of a close relative. Mrs. D. makes and sells peanut oil. She also sells millet, milk and sugar. Her goal is to contribute to a higher standard of living for her family and to increase the level of her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: To buy peanuts, sugar, milk and millet

loans.name: Héctor Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Héctor Antonio R. R. él es trabajador activo de una entidad estatal desempeñándose como Técnico Pedagógico  tiene siete    años  de trabajar para esta institución  es casado actualmente, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Hector Antonio R. R. currently works for a state entity serving as a technical instructor.  He has been working for this institution for 7 years, he is married, and has on child of schooling age.  He has had 7 loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been used for construction material such as: sand, cement, stone, purlins, stone blocks, etc.  These have helped expand and improve his home and the loans from CEPRODEL have greatly benefited him because in this way his and his family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials: Sand, Cement, Stone, Purlins, Zinc, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with one child and he inherited a house from his father in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in hardware for five years starting with four million saved from his previous loan and now it is worth six million. His hardship is bad debtors and  his vision is building a commercial house. John is requesting a loan to buy cement, iron bars, nails, and iron sheets to sell.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars, nails and iron sheets.

loans.name: Kheav's Group

texts.en:
There are five people who are forming this group loan. Mrs. Kheav, who was born in 1951, is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the others members. The members of this group will use their portions to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Kheav and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice, but they do not have enough money to grow it. Thus, Mrs. Kheav would like to ask for a loan to pay for hiring laborers to plow her rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice. 

This couple has three children who are employed in garment factories.

loans.use: to pay for hiring laborers to plow her rice field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing rice

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, comida típica a base de cerdo, masa, especies, papa, arroz etc. que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Ella en un principio destazaba pero como vio que era mucho esfuerzo para ella decidió mejor comprar la carne para realizar dicho producto.

G. comercializa sus nacatamales en Tipitapa ya que hay mayor concurrencia y sueña en poner una pequeña venta. Ella tiene cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está a su cargo y es quien le ayuda en sus tiempos libre en el negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina G. is a hardworking, enterprising, woman who puts forth a lot of effort.  She is 43 years old and sells nacatamales, a typical food made from pork, spices, potatoes, and rice, wrapped in dough.  She usually sells these on the weekends.  She used to butcher her own meat, but later decided to buy it instead, to save on work.

G. sells her nacatamales in Tipitapa because many people gather there and she would like to set up a permanent stall.  She has five children , but only one who still depends on her for support.  He helps her with the business in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui, es viuda, tiene 56 años y 11 hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo destinara a la compra de abarrotes en general, verduras y tipos de carnes para la preparación de alimentos, debido a que Cristina tiene un restaurante en San Juan Bautista. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de quesos y decidió abrir un restaurante, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus tiempos libres prepara desayuno y almuerzo. 
Le gusta FINCA Perú por la facilidad de los créditos y puede ahorrar. Con sus ahorros pudo construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
Abrirá un restaurante en distrito de Carmen Alto, donde atenderá sólo en la noches preparará caldos y comida china. Su sueño es seguir creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of Ñahui Yana Community Bank.  She is a 56 year old widow with 11 children.  

The requested loan would be used to buy groceries, vegetables and meats for food preparation, as Cristina has a restaurant in San Juan Bautista. Previously, she worked selling cheese and decided to open a restaurant, working with the help of her children, in her spare time, she began serving breakfast and lunch.

She likes the loan services of FINCA Peru for the easy loan process and that it provides her with the ability to save.
With her savings she could build a house and educate her children.

She would also open a restaurant in Carmen Alto district and only serve soups and chinese food in the evenings.  
Her dream is to continue growing and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy various meats and vegetables

loans.name: Guillermo Asuncion

texts.es: Guillermo Asunción de 45 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador quien se ha esforzado al máximo para contar con su negocio propio. Él vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos. En su negocio Guillermo se encarga de ofrecer el servicio de taxi, el recorre muchos lugares para obtener a nuevos clientes, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Guillermo solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en la compra de llantas, repuestos, focos entre otros.
texts.en: Guillermo Asunción is 45 years old.  He is a very responsible and hard-working father who has made a great effort to own his own business.  He lives together with his wife and three children.  Guillermo's business is offering a taxi service.  He travels through many places in order to gain new customers.  For this reason, he must get up early every day.  He works from 7.00am to 9.0pm.  Guillermo is requesting a loan so that he can invest in buying tires, spare parts, headlamps, etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts, headlamps, etc.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 30 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products.  Kou is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3.63 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 26 on other necessary expenses. 

Kou is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase palm sugar to resell at the market. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy palm sugar to resell

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira and her husband live in village Gomi, Samtredia District, West Georgia. She is 53 years old and heads the family agricultural business. Zaira’s husband Geno works as a trailer driver. He is also involved in the family business. 

Zaira and Geno have three milk cows and 2 calves. Zaira produces cheese and sells it on the local open market, approximately 60 kg of it per month. Also they have 200 hens and sell 400 eggs per month. Along with the above-mentioned, the family sells flour. The monthly turnover in their business is 7500 Laris. There is potential (demand on the market) for increasing the business, but Zaira lacks space for stockpiling the flour, as she keeps it in a separate room of her house, which can’t hold more of the product.  

With one-third of the requested credit, Zaira will purchase an additional milk cow and will be able to produce and sell more cheese and two-thirds of the borrowed amount will be used for construction of a flour storehouse, which will allow Zaira to increase sales made by her business. 

Zaira and Geno plan to reinvest part of their profit in their business and the other part will be used for improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and materials for storehouse construction.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 40 years old lives in the Kakata area. He is married and has four children age 3 to 14. They all live at home and attend school. 

For the past 10 years he has been involved in the sales of used shoes. He started in business by selling cool water in a wheel barrow and learned this business from friends. What he likes about this business is that he makes new friends and meets people each and every day. It makes him proud to have money in his pocket every day.

David has requested this loan to purchase more shoes in order to have his business grow into a bigger one. 

Among his challenges is the changing of US dollars to Liberian dollars. In future he wants to open another shop near the present shop.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Gantsetseg,a 28-year-old mother of a seven-year-old daughter and a one-year-old baby boy, lives with her family in their newly-built house in the outer districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Gantsetseg works as a cashier in the same local food court where her husband is employed as a chef.

Gantsetseg and her husband started building their small house last summer and moved into it in January. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to furnish her home, desiring to make it warm and cozy so that her family can enjoy living there. She is thankful for the lenders and the institute for giving her an opportunity to complete her housing project.

loans.use: to furnish her newly-built small house.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.ru:
Виктория не замужем. Вот уже 5 лет, как она имеет свой бизнес и продает женскую одежду: сарафаны, майки, юбки, брюки и пр. Ее тогровая точка расположена в Тогровом Центре «Юбилейный». Это хорошее, проходное место, где постоянно находится много потенциальных покупателей. 

Виктория всегда старается подбирать ходовой товар хорошего качества. У нее есть постоянные покупатели, которым нравится скупляться у Виктории. Ее бизнес идет хорошо и приносит стабильный доход. 

Виктория просит выдать ей кредит на сумму 10,000 гривен для увеличения ассортимента товара. Она планирует получить дополнительную прибыль и потратить ее на улучшение своих жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Victoria is single.  It is five years since she has her own business selling women’s clothing: sundresses, tops, skirts, trousers etc. Her stall is located in the “Jubilee” shopping center. This is a good location with a lot of shopper traffic, where there are always many potential customers. 

Victoria always does her best to select high-quality goods that are in demand. She has many loyal customers who like to purchase from her. Her business is developing well and bringing her a stable income. Victoria is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH in order to enhance her stock. She plans to earn an additional income and use it to improve her  housing conditions.

loans.use: to increase her stock of summer goods

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 59 years old and is married to Esther; the couple is blessed with children who are all adults. He has been running a retail shop for three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Peter is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase sugar, wheat flour, rice, and maize meal for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, Peter hopes to expand his retail shop. He hopes and dreams to open a wholesale shop, which will help him improve his and his wife's standard of living since their children are adults.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, rice, and maize meal for his shop

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 34 years old and married to Emma. They are blessed with one child, age two years. Michael has been supplying beverages for the past five years with the monthly income of KES 5,000 which he uses to support his family.

Michael is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. He will use the loan to buy soft drinks to increase his stock. With the anticipated profit from the business he will expand his business. 

Michael hopes are to own a big beverage store and be able to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to increase his stock

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis de 41 años vive en San Juan Nepomuceno, en el departamento de Bolívar; desde su casa en esta población,  ha encontrado una forma de generar ingresos a través de un trabajo independiente como la venta de calzado y mercancías en general. Su negocio inició cuando su prima le enviaba calzado de Bucaramanga, ciudad perteneciente al departamento de Santander, caracterizada por la producción de calzado y bolsos de calidad inigualable, para que ella los vendiera en su pueblo. Inició con pocos clientes a quienes distribuía a crédito y gradualmente fue ganando una muy buena clientela, que le permitió diversificar hacia otras mercancías y fue así como con un capital prestado compró directamente bolsos y ropa, para la venta. En su condición de madre cabeza de hogar ha sacado a su única hija adelante mediante su trabajo y en la actualidad vive con su madre y con sus hermanos. Su meta más adelante es tener un punto comercial donde diversifique aún más su oferta de productos, respondiendo así a las necesidades de la población por acceder a lo que requieren. Su mayor desafío es que su clientela se torna cada vez mayor y su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para responder oportunamente y debe esperar recoger sus cuentas por cobrar para lograrlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará en mayor volumen y de contado calzado, ropa y bolsos, garantizados y esto es justamente lo que genera mayores encargos por eso su inversión será exitosa porque responderá a clientes especiales que así lo exigen. Mientras Gladis trabaja por alcanzar sus sueños, maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 11% desde la cual planea su crecimiento, con inyecciones de capital de trabajo que hoy empieza a lograr con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Gladis is 41 years old and lives in San Juan Nepomuceno in the Department of Bolívar. She works independently from home selling shoes and general merchandise so that she can generate an income. Her business started when her cousin sent her shoes from the city of Bucaramanga, which is in the Department of Santander, so that she could sell them in her town. Bucaramanga is known for producing shoes and handbags of unmatched quality. Gladis started out with a few customers who purchased on credit and gradually she built up a good clientele. This has allowed her to diversify into other types of merchandise. Using borrowed capital, she made direct purchases of handbags and clothing that she could sell. As a mother and female head of household, Gladis has worked hard so that her only daughter can get ahead. She currently lives with her mother and her siblings. Going forward, her goal is to have a retail shop where she can diversify her product offerings even more so that she can meet the demands of the local residents. Her greatest challenge is having sufficient capital to respond to her customers in a timely manner because they are placing larger and more frequent orders. Since she extends credit, she has to wait to collect payment before ordering more merchandise.

For this reason Gladis is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy clothing and handbags in bulk and with cash since these items have been pre-ordered. Her investment will be successful because she will generate more orders and be able to respond to her special customers. In the meantime, Gladis strives to fulfill her dreams. She maintains a profitability rate from her sales of 11%. With this injection of capital provided by her Kiva loan, she will be able to carry out her plans for growth.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and handbags that have been pre-ordered.

loans.name: Safiya's Group

texts.en:
Safiya's group is comprised of hard working women. Safiya is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years Safiya has been working hard to manage her clinic which offers health services. 

To help expand her business, Safiya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine and will help Safiya to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Safiya hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse. 

Safiya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Safiya's future prospects by helping her to read educational story books.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Dorcus Mutune

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman.  She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself as creative, jovial, and aggressive. 

Dorcus operates a grocery and retail store where she sells avocados, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, flour, tea and chapati. She has been involved in this business for 1.5 years. Her business is located in a commercial area near a primary school and her primary customers are men. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of food. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase flour, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages.  Her business goal is to have a more stocked retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children to a high level of education.

loans.use: buy flour, tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages

loans.name: Upendo Y/g B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Upendo Y/G B Group in Western Kenya!  Peter is the facilitator of the Upendo Y/G B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With the income from the maize sales, Peter will save for future use by investing in livestock raising.

In 2012, the members of Upendo Y/G B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Peter is pictured with his group members with their Field Officer at the far left in a black/white T-Shirt.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
A sus 22 años de edad Vanesa es una joven muy trabajadora que después de capacitarse como mercaderista comenzó a trabajar como vendedora de una distribuidora de dulces nacionales y americanos, su labor es vender mercancía por catalogo y comisionar con buenas ventas. Es emprendedora y su meta es llegara a tener un punto de venta propio donde pueda generar un empleo y aumentar los ingresos para ayudarle a su familia con los gastos del hogar.

Actualmente, con la ilusión de ir progresando día a día quiere comprar un surtido grande que le deje más utilidades, y adicional a esto una impresora  que le facilite la entrega de informes a la empresa, y le permita tener más orden en sus finanzas con la contabilidad y las facturas. Sin embargo Vanesa no cuenta con este capital para invertirle a su negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a cumplir sus sueños de progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vanesa is a 22 year hardworking young woman. After training as a sales representative she began to work selling sweets from a national and American distributor. Her work is selling merchandise from a catalog and she earns a good commission for her sales. Her entrepreneurial goal is to have her own location where she can hire an employee and increase her earnings in order to help her family with the household expenses.

Right now her dream is to progress day by day and she wants to buy in quantity in order to earn more profit, and in addition to that, to buy a printer that she can use to prepare reports for the distributor as well as allow her to be more organized with her bookkeeping and invoices. However Vanesa does not have the capital to invest in her business, and that is why she is asking for a loan to help her fulfill her dreams of progress and to better her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies and a printer for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: La señora Antonia vive en casa familiar en la zona los andes con su esposo e hijos en la casa de sus suegros hace mas de 25 años. El crédito que solicita es para surtir con variedad de productos como refrescos, dulces galletas su tienda la cual esta ubicada en la zona de rio seco que vende por mayor y menor  su meta  a corto plazo es adquirir la tienda en anticrético ya que por el momento se encuentra en alquiler la señora es antigua clienta  en banca comunal trabajo excelentemente por la cual se animo a solicitar su primer crédito individual  y solo trabaja con emprender su mayor sueño es construir su casita ya que tiene su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Señora Antonia has lived in her in-laws' house, which is located in the Andes area, with her husband and children for the past 25 years. The loan she is applying for is to stock her store, located in the Rio Seco area, with a variety of products, like soft drinks, candy and cookies which she sells at wholesale and retail prices.

Her short-term goal is to obtain the store on an "anticretico" contract (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anticr%C3%A9tico), as at the moment she is renting. This lady is a long-term client of the Communal Bank. She is an excellent worker and is therefore very enthusiastic about applying for her first individual loan. She works to achieve her greatest dream, which is to build her own house as she already has her own plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as soft drinks and candy in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Aggée Plus Group

texts.en:
“Agée Plus” is a Community Bank made up of 21 micro entrepreneurs whose chairman is Bolenge. These members are united for the same goal to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 
Bolenge is 37 years old and single. He has been in business since 1997 selling miscellaneous.  Today, he operates a general store in the mid east of the city of Kinshasa. He likes his business because it makes him become financially independent and has stabilized his life economically. Bolenge has been a loyal client of the MFI HOPE DRC who has already received two different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of his goods by purchasing the store’s items such as some soaps, cans, and toilet papers, sugar, miscellaneous in bulk for resale with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $95. Bolenge has two children aged 3 and 5 years old. One attends school.His ambition is to open a food shop in his environment.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his goods by buying the store's items such us some soaps, cans, toilet papers, sugar, miscellaneous in bulk for resale at a profit

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Matayo is the facilitator of the Imani group. His group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Matayo takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s farm inputs and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Matayo had an excellent maize yield harvesting twelve bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Matayo was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Matayo and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Matayo will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing. In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant maize plots between half and one acre of land.
In the photograph above, Matayo is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Barnee

texts.en:
Barnee is 26 years old and lives in Sinkor. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between the ages of 1 and 7 years. Two are in school and all three of them live at home. 

For the past five years Barnee has been selling charcoal in her community. She has a lot of customers and she makes a lot of profit.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан 28 лет, замужем и воспитывает двух детей. Гулумкан работает учителем в местной школе на протяжении пяти лет. В 2006 году, в поисках дополнительного источника финансирования для своей семьи, Гулумкан начала свой бизнес в разведении скота. Использовав стартовую сумму в 15,000 сом (KGS), Гулумкан смогла развить хозяйство, насчитывающее на сегодняшний день девять коров, приносящее около 10,000 сом ( KGS) от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме  100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного скота. В будущем, Гулумкан планирует увеличивать поголовье скота, чтобы иметь возможность дать образование детям.
texts.en: Gulumkan is 28 years old, she is married and has two children. Gulumkan has been working as a teacher at a local school for five years. In 2006 seeking additional source of funding for her family Gulumkan started her business in breeding of cattle. Using the starting amount of 15,000 soms (KGS) Gulumkan was able to develop her business which at present time amounts to nine cows yielding about 10,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk and dairy products. In order to further develop her business she has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to purchase additional stock. In the future Gulumkan plans to increase the number of cattle to be able to give education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy is married and has two children. Rudy is 60 years old, residing at San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Rudy owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been 18 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this business. 

She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Rudy has been a member of GDMPC for three years. In the future, Rudy wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta is 29 years of age and is married with two children.

Roseta owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Roseta needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Roseta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Roseta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda is married with four adult children. She is 51 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor Province. To earn a living, Leonarda is an iron scrap and plastic materials buyer. She has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase recyclable materials such as iron scrap and plastic materials. Leonarda has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Leonarda hopes to have savings deposits from the income of her business.

loans.use: to purchase recyclable materials such as iron scrap and plastic materials

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a thirty-five-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two to ten. He describes himself as an obedient man. He operates a retail stall where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for twelve years. His business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of charcoal. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old single and blessed with two children.

She operates a shop, a business she has done for eight years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.15,000.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya,she intends to buy more stock of sugar, rice,cooking oils,wheat flour,maize and milk to sell to her customers in the village.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as repay her loan.

Her dream is to own a big shop in the town.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice,cooking oils,wheat flour,maize and milk to sell to her customers in the village

loans.name: José Irene

texts.en:
Don José is a very friendly and very optimistic person. His work is a little strange, but it has allowed him to earn an income over the years and cover his family´s expenses. His work consists of the preparation of spices and condiments for meals; Don José has more than 10 years of experience in the production of these products.

Don José needs a loan of $475 USD to buy the raw materials that allow him to continue making his products. He plans to pay back the loan within 4 to 8 months. This way he hopes to give his business a push by increasing his production. He appreciates your support and kindness.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Don José es una persona muy amigable y muy optimista, su trabajo es algo extraño, pero este le ha permitido obtener un ingreso a través de los años y cubrir con los gastos de su familia. Consiste en la elaboración de especias y condimentos para las comidas, por lo que Don José tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la producción de estos productos.

Don José necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir haciendo sus productos, en un término de 4 a 8 meses planea regresar el préstamo y de esta forma el espera impulsar su negocio con una mayor producción; el agradece tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau was born in 1979. Giau's wife is Nhung who was born in 1987. Now they have one child, aged two. Giau just left his parent's home for the first time, and he does not have enough capital to open a business.

Giau's family owns only a hut which is 30 square meters in area. He repairs bicycles and motorbikes from this home. The family income is about $8 per person/month. Giau needs a loan of $75 for buying tools and parts. Giau will repay monthly.

loans.use: To buy tools and parts for repairing bicycles and motorbikes.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Mrs. Stella A. has done this work for years. She said that LAPO has lifted her up from the grip of poverty. She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria; married with three children and she hope of getting the above loan for business expansion.

loans.use:
To buy more material for soda
making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This is a test.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Mr. Leonardo is 35 years old and has been married to the 26 year-old Mrs. Lidia Osorio for 5 years. Right now, they have no children. Leonardo is a very enterprising person. Seven years ago he began to work with inoculated animals and go door-to-door in the city selling their meat. Back then he didn't own a space for a butcher's shop. Working in the streets of the city, he met Lidia, whom he later married, and together they decided to open a grocery store and butcher's shop in their own home. Today, Mr. Leonardo is in charge of the butcher's shop and Lidia runs the grocery store. They currently both anxiously await the birth of their first child, now that Lidia is two months pregnant. Mr. Leonardo requests a loan to buy some animals to butcher and sell in his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Leonardo tiene 35 años, lleva 5 años casado con la señora Lidia Osorio de 26 años y aún no tienen hijos. Leonardo es una persona muy emprendedora, hace 7 años empezó a faenar animales vacunos y a vender la carne casa por casa por la ciudad, ya que en aquel entonces no contaba con un local propio para instalar su carnicería. Trabajando por las calles de la ciudad conoció a la señora Lidia, con quién después se casó y juntos decidieron instalar una despensa y carnicería en su propia vivienda. Hoy día, Leonardo se encarga de la parte de la carnicería y doña Lidia de la despensa. Ahora juntos esperan ansiosos la venida del primer hijo, ya que Lidia se encuentra con 2 meses de embarazo. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de animales para luego faenarlos y venderlos en la carnicería.

loans.use: The purchase of inoculated animals

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Mrs. Cham-nan C. was married in 1984 and has four children, one daughter and three sons. She learned to weave silk from her elder sister in 1981 and she started her own silk weaving business in the same year. Her husband works growing rice, planting vegetables, and raising cows. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times previously. Now she is asking a loan for the amount of $400, which she intends to use to purchase silk materials and sewing thread so that she can expand her silk weaving business.

loans.use: to purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Maria Onolina

texts.en:
Maria is a lady of 26 years and is married with two kids. She applied for this loan in order to improve and put more effort into her business.

She sells her produce at the market every weekend and makes a profit of $56 USD ($140 ST) per day, but if she needs more money for family commitments, then she delivers her produce around the village. She said that this business of hers is very helpful for earning money for different needs, but especially for her children.

loans.use: To buy tools and chemicals for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Mayra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ms. Mayra C. is a single mother of 3 underage children. It has cost her a great deal to get ahead in life, and she has made many sacrifices in order to be able to start a business in her home. She says that with the help of God, however, she has been able to move forward, and now she has a mini market. Ms. C. would like to offer her children more comfort, which is why she would like to invest in the purchase of grains, beans, and perishable goods in order to boost sales, thus allowing her to save enough money for her biggest aspiration for the moment: renovating her house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mayra es madre soltera y tiene 3 niños menores de edad. Le ha costado mucho poder salir adelante y ha tenido que sacrificar mucho para poder empezar un negocio de ventas de productos varios en su casa, pero ella dice que con la ayuda de Dios ha podido salir adelante y hoy en día su negocio ya es una pequeña tienda. Doña Mayra quiere otorgarle mejor comodidad a sus pequeños, por lo que desea invertir en la compra de granos básicos y productos perecederos para aumentar las ventas de su tienda, para así poder comenzar a ahorrar y poder mejorar la construcción de su casa que por el momento es su mayor aspiración.

loans.use: Purchase of grains, beans, and perishable goods

loans.name: Kilwoowa West C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nusula N.. She is currently in the poultry business and is requesting a loan to buy more chicks. Nusula is 40 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children ranging from age 16 to 24 and her children go to school. Each week, Nusula makes approximately UGX 30000 in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. Nusula has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to buy more chicks and poultry feed and the loan was paid back on time.

Nusula is joined in her small group by Neter N., Aisha N., Regina N., and Sifuna N.. Neter N. has a business in farming and wants to expand the business. Aisha N. is currently operating a business in fish selling and wants a loan to add to the fish business. Regina N. operates a business of a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Sifuna N. is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To expand poultry business and make more profit

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
