Luisa is a 61-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: selling Ready-to-Wear clothes and selling hardware merchandise. She lives in Valladolid, Negros Occidental. Luisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Luisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family.  R. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos ella trabaja de forma ambulatoria a la vez también trabaja en un kiosco escolar en un colegio nacional, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para realizar los desayunos que realiza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This partner belongs to the communal bank ”KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; the bank is located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gladis is 44-years-old. She lives with her partner and 3 children. She alternates between daily chores and her business of selling breakfast. She also works at a kiosk in a public school. She's a pretty happy person and she's eager to get ahead.

She's requesting this loan to buy ingredients for making breakfast. 

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making breakfast

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia V. is 56 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar in the municipality of Cabatuan, a part of Isabela province on the island of Luzon. Nelia makes and sells food and drinks to passersby in the community. Nelia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Nelia joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Nelia is requesting a new loan, her sixth from ASKI, of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make the foods she sells

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Амирхонов Хабибулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Хабибулло занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян для весеннего посева.
texts.en: Habibullo A. lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 45 years old, married and has 4 children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Habibullo is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  The goal of this loan is to purchase seeds for the spring sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Darlyn Yessenia

texts.es: Darling Yessenia es madre luchadora tiene 2 hijos y están estudiando. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 5 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días. Este crédito es para la compra granos básicos, jugos, golosinas, galletas, detergentes, sopas entre otros.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia.
texts.en:
Darlyn Yessenia is a hard-working mother of two school-aged children.  She has been in the grocery store business, which is set up in her home, for five years.  She began selling groceries little by little until she was able to increase inventory.   Despite the many difficulties in her life, she is always struggling to get ahead in order to provide the best she can for her children.

She enjoys her work and knows that, were it not for her business, she would be unable to put food on the table.

This loan is to buy basic grains, juices, sweets, cookies, soups, detergents, etc.  Her dream is to expand her business and become competitive.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, juices, sweets, cookies, soups, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Perla Margarita

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Perla Margarita le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía como es ropa para niños, zapatos y aparatos eléctricos y que este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene a tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. 
Pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio y mas con la nueva inversión que tendrá de mercancía.
texts.en:
Perla Margarita’s business needs a greater variety of merchandise, bus she doesn’t have the necessary capital to invest.

She is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise, such as children’s clothing, shoes, and electronic items.  This business is her family’s source of income.  She is a single mother and has three children to care for.

She will repay the loan with a part of her earnings from her business.  The investment in new merchandise will help.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Lhagvajav lives with his wife and three children in a house in Darhan-Uul Province, Mongolia. His younger two children go to a local secondary school, while his wife is a cook in Haan Buuz cafe, one of the well-known fast food chains in Mongolia. With the help of his older son, Lhagvajav operates an auto repair and welding service which he started in 2006 in his town. He also used to have a pig farm and a coal-trading business in order to supplement his family earnings. He intends to resume his coal operation.

A hardworking man who has been able to expand his business, today Lhagvajav is one of the most successful businessmen in his town. With his earnings he started to build a house on his plot of land and says, "With the loan received from Xacbank I had an opportunity to finish the construction work of my house. Now I want to have a car to use for my business." He is therefore requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Sokhun is 38 years old.  She resides in Prey Veng province, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Sokhun is a housewife.  Her two children are employed at a factory, each earning an income of USD 2 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Sokhun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the family farming. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Maribel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maribel, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, vive con sus padres y sus hijas de 10 y 7 años de edad, ella para el sostenimiento de sus hijos, siembra chile, pepino, pipián, tomates, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para la siembra, como abono y fertilizantes, también semilla, con este financiamiento podrá tener todos los materiales necesarios para dar inicio al cultivo.
El objetivo de ella es tener buenos resultados con sus cosechas, que sean sanos sus productos y que esto le permita tener una buena comercialización.
texts.en:
Maribel grows vegetables such as: chiles, cucumbers, squash, and tomatoes to support her children..  She and her two daughters, 10 and 7,  live with her parents, who taught her this business.  

Maribel is requesting the loan to buy supplies such as manure, fertilizers and seeds.  This financing will give her all she needs to start planting.  Her goal is to have good crops that are healthy and will sell well.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and seeds to plant chiles, tomatoes, cucumbers and squash.

loans.name: Riffat Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Riffat bibi is 34 years old and married with two sons. Her eldest son is eight years old while her younger one is four years old.  

Riffat is an uneducated lady. She couldn’t study because her parents couldn’t send her to school due to financial constraints. But she knows the value of education; that’s why she wants to educate her children. For that purpose, she does a livestock business. She buys young animals from the animal market, raises them up and sells to customers who require them to collect money for her children’s future.  

Her husband is involved in a construction supplies business. Her brother-in-law is also lives with her family and is an electrician by trade. He provides electricity repair services to his customers and earns an income.  

Riffat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her livestock business. With the loan, she will buy goats to resell at a profit.  She has been operating this business for the past 15 years and is hopeful that the loan investment will bring her business to a more profitable position and allow her to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy goats for livestock business.

loans.name: Meach

texts.en:
Meach is a 47-year-old married woman who has been planting rice crops. She lives in the province of Siem Reap, where she also sells a few fish in the local market with her husband for extra profit. 

Meach is married with four young children and currently resides with her husband, who assists her in selling fish and growing crops. To add more income to support her family’s demands, Meach has also raised some piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, Meach has requested a loan of $400 that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Bernice

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Brigada Ramírez” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 47 años, está Casada y tiene 02 hijos que están estudiando en el nivel superior.

Una amiga le pidió que le diera pensión (alimentos) y ella vio la oportunidad de iniciar un negocio propio y ser independiente económicamente, su amiga le recomendó otros clientes y así empezó la venta de comida en su propia casa, actualmente no solo da pensión sino también vende al público en general. Sus clientes la prefieren por su sazón y buen trato que les brinda.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00,  comprará productos al por mayor e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz y azúcar por sacos, aceite, menestras.
 
Gloria  es una mujer trabajadora y creativa,  su sueño es contar con un nuevo negocio de venta de abarrotes que le permita crecer económicamente, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad, a mujeres como ella, de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the “Brigada Ramírez” community bank which is located in Lamas district and province, in San Martín department.  She is 47 years old, married, and has two children who are in college.

A friend asked Gloria to provide her with bed and board and she saw an opportunity to start her own business and become financially independent.  Her friend recommended her to other customers and she thereby started selling food in her own home.  She now not only provides bed and board but also sells food to the general public.  Her customers prefer to buy from her because of the good flavor of her food and the good customer service that she provides.

Gloria will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy products and ingredients wholesale for preparing her food such as rice and sugar by the sack, oil and vegetables.

Gloria is a hard-working and creative woman.  Her dream is to own another business selling groceries which will enable her to grow financially.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for providing women such as herself with the opportunity to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat and groceries to prepare her food

loans.name: Nong Taaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sylvie est la représentante du groupe NONG TAABA. Elle est  mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 7ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 02 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des habits depuis 04ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 04 douzaine d’habits pour adulte; 05 douzaine de soutien gorge et 05 douzaine de complet pour enfants.

Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec ses économies. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique d’habits et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Ms. Sylvie is the leader of the group NONG TAABA. She is married and has two children. The older child is 10 and the younger is 7 years old. Her two children attend school and she has to take care of two people.

She has been selling clothes for four years. She buys her inventory at the market in sector 10. Her clients are women.

She wants to purchase four dozen sets of adult clothes; five dozen bras and five dozen children's outfits.

She wants to improve her familites living conditions with her savings. She strives to open a clothing store and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase four dozen sets of adult clothes; five dozen bras and five dozen children's outfits

loans.name: Mukaushande Group

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Sibongile (raising her hand) from Masvingo, a town in southeastern Zimbabwe. She is married with four children; two attend school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Sibongile runs a flea market business selling clothes and footwear. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of working capital. Sibongile has requested a loan of $400 to buy blouses, tracksuits, bags, and boots. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the family's general welfare. 

In the future Sibongile plans to operate a retail outlet.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bags, and footwear for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 42 años de edad, está casado con delia  de 47 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pichari.Juan  desde muy adolescente incursionó en el negocio de venta de videos, porque sus padres son siempre fueron comerciantes y le enseñaron a ganarse la vida honradamente.
Al principio Juan tenía un poco de temor porque no le iba tan bien en el negocio, pero supo como ponerle fin a esto, gracias a una buena técnica de atención al cliente. Actualmente, Juan cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes.Para realizar su trabajo cuenta con el apoyo de su querida esposa. Juan posee un buen lugar entre sus competidores por ser su negocio uno de los más concurridos por los clientes, todo esto fue un premio a su iniciativa, perseverancia y creatividad.Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el que Juan se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.Juan esta contento con su banco comunal por que todos son perseverantes y solidarios.Con los 1.000 Juan comprara más videos para las venta en su tienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old.  He is married to Delia, aged 47, with whom he has two children.  They live in their own home, located in the district of Pichari.  

Juan has had a business selling videos since he was a teenager, because his parents have always been business people, and they taught him to earn an honest living.

At first, Juan was somewhat concerned because the business wasn't going too well, but he knew how to put an end to that thanks to a good customer service approach.  Today, Juan has a good customer base.  He relies on the help of his beloved wife to make the business work.

Juan has a good position among his competitors, as his business is one of the most popular with the customers.  All of this came about due to his initiative, perseverance and creativity.

This is his first loan with MFP, and Juan promises to be punctual in his repayments.  Juan is pleased with the Communal Bank, as everyone is hard-working and supportive.  With the 1,000 PEN, Juan will buy more videos to sell in his store.

loans.use: to buy more videos to sell in his store.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos Antonio de 63 años de edad, habita en casa propia en una humilde zona del país, junto con su compañera de vida de 60 años y una amiga de 50 años. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Carlos  posee un molino de nixtamal el cual ha instalado en su hogar de residencia. Muchas personas lo buscan para moler el maíz que convertirán en una masa que posteriormente se convierte en ricas tortillas, base fundamental de la dieta alimenticia en este país. Carlos se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona donde habita ya que es un hombre carismático, dedicado y honesto. Carlos ha trabajado toda su vida en este negocio y es el que le ha generado el pan de cada día. Últimamente ha notado que el molino necesita mantenimiento y algunos repuestos ya que por el uso que le dá estos se gastan con facilidad. Es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar repuestos para el buen funcionamiento del molino que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará mejorar el servicio a sus clientes permitiéndole mantener su negocio activo por más tiempo y seguir recibiendo los frutos que por mucho tiempo le ha dado. De esta forma espera continuar llevando el sustento necesario a su hogar.
texts.en:
63-year-old Carlos Antonio lives in his own home in a less well-off area of the country.  He lives with his life partner who is 60 years old and a [female] friend who is 50 years old.  For a long time, he has worked hard to get his beloved family ahead in life.

Carlos own a mill for grinding 'nixtamal' (corn).  The mill is set up in his home.  Many people come to him to grind corn into cornmeal that they later use to make delicious tortillas, a basic foodstuff in this country's diet.  Carlos has gained the trust of many people in his area as he is a charismatic, committed and honest man.  He has worked his whole life in this business and it is how he has earned his daily bread.  Lately, Carlos has noticed that his mill needs servicing and some spare parts because, as a result of the use that it gets, these parts wear out easily.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business and buy spare parts so that his mill works properly as it is his main work tool.  He trusts in God and his work and believes that he will manage to improve his customer service which will enable him to keep his business going longer and continue receiving the rewards that he has been receiving for a long time.  In this way, he hopes to continue providing his household with the support they need.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mill

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has operated this business for seven years. She has retained her business because she has managed to increase her business stock with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. She also does some farming for extra income. Beatrice dreams of expanding into a wholesale business in the future. She needs 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, and maize flour.

loans.name: Jose Faustino

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica desde hace muchos años a la siembra de granos básicos: maíz, frijol, labora todos los días en las actividades agricolas,de lunes a domingo.
El necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como; herbicidas para las plagas y semilla para la siembra, abono para que sus cosechas sean abundantes y estén libres de plagas aunque, sabe que es un trabajo arduo pero al final da buenas cosechas y más ingresos.
El sueño de José es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y a traves de su esfuerzo poder ayudar con los gastos de la casa..
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children. For many years he has worked growing the basic grains of corn and beans. Every day he farms, Monday through Sunday.

He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides for pest control, seeds to plant, and compost. In this way his crops will be abundant and disease free. Although he knows it is hard work, in the end he has good crops and higher earnings. 

José’s dream is that his children continue studying and through his efforts be able to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, seeds, and compost for his crops

loans.name: Enrique Hernan

texts.es:
Enrique Hernán tiene 37 años de edad es divorciado tiene dos hijos vive en el cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos. Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá comprar semillas, abonos,fertilizantes, líquidos para plagas, insumos e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. 

El sueño es seguir trabajando junto a la familia para lograr prosperar  en la familia y en el negocio.
Le gusta las festividades del carnaval y las del sector

"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Enrique Hernán is 37 years old.  He is divorced and lives in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.  

The communal bank "V.R.C. NUEVA UNION" is located in Guamayacu which belongs to the Echeandia canton. This farm group mainly grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Enrique plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He carries out purchases and sales in Echeandia

With his previous loan he was able to buy seeds and agricultural supplies like urea, mate monte (pesticide), fertilizers, and insecticides to maintain his crops in good condition. 

This loan will be a big help because he will be able to plant and harvest corn and rice and make a profit. He succeeded with the help of his prior loan and had no problem making the payments established by the cooperative.  With the money from the prior loan he was able to buy seeds and agricultural resources such as urea, pesticides, fertilizer, and herbicides in order to maintain good conditions for his crops.

Within his family, relationships have improved because now he can contribute a little more towards his family’s wellbeing.  His work is going much better because of increases in production.  His income has improved a lot because of increased sales.  His dream is to continue working with his family in order to succeed with the business.  He is very grateful for the help he has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, liquids to combat plagues, and other materials

loans.name: Diana Araceli

texts.es:
Diana Araceli de 27 años de edad, casada, vive en la aldea Naco Cortes con su esposo y un hijo de 1 año de edad.  Su esposo  se dedica  a la actividad de enderezado y pintura automotriz.

Diana es muy trabajadora se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de maíz desde las 10:00 a.m  a 1:00 p.m y de 4:00 a 6:00 p.m todos los días.  Debido a la necesidad de obtener mas  ingresos para el hogar, se motivó  a establecer este negocio y lo logró con la ayuda de su madre y  el apoyo de su esposo.  Ahora tiene buena demanda de tortillas, su negocio a crecido ya tiene algunos contratos con los comedores de las maquilas cercanas.

Ha solicitado un  préstamo a ODEF para invertirlo en compra de materia prima (Harina de maíz) y otra parte para compra de materiales  para enderezado y pintura del negocio del esposo.  
Su plan es seguir adelante con su negocio y cuidar su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Araceli is 27 years old and married.  She lives in the village of Naco Cortes with her husband and their one year old son.  Her husband does automotive bodywork and painting.

Diana is very hard-working.  She makes and sells corn tortillas from 10:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m. and from 4:00 p.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day.  Due to the necessity of getting more income for the household, she was motivated to establish this business.  

She managed to do so with her mother’s help and her husband’s support.  Now she has a good demand for tortillas.  Her business has grown, and she has some contracts with the dining rooms of the factories that are nearby.

She has requested a loan from ODEF to buy raw material (corn flour).  She will use part of the loan to buy materials for bodywork and painting for her husband’s business.

Her plan is to get ahead with her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn flour for tortillas and material for painting automobiles.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr:
Emefa est une femme  âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en douane. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Emefa travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend également des mèches et des défrisants dans son salon de coiffure  situé dans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule dans son salon. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir d’employées pour satisfaire au mieux ses clientes quand elle est débordée.
Emefa  a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des défrisants. Elle veut réaménager son salon avec les profits obtenus.
texts.en:
Emefa is a 26-year-old woman who is married to a customs officer. They have no children. Emefa has been working as a hairdresser since 2010. She also sells hair extensions and relaxers at her hair salon in a local district. She buys her products in Lomé and she works alone. Currently, her main challenge is to work without any employees to help her meet the needs of her customers when demand is high.

Emefa is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions and relaxers. She will use her profits to revamp her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and relaxers

loans.name: Mar

texts.fr: Monsieur Mar habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de famille. Il est âgé de 44ans et s’active dynamiquement dans le commerce de  produits diversifiés (fruits de mer,  habits, produits locaux, poulets de chair, moutons, etc.). Il pratique en meme temps l’aviculture. Il a une expérience de plus de 15 ans dans son activité qu’il a choisie  par nécessité dans le but de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. C’est un ancien membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000frs prévu pour l’achat de moutons qu’il va revendre. Monsieur Mar compte sur ses revenus pour gérer son environnement social et c’est ainsi qu’il est parvenu a s’équiper en mobilier de maison et a subvenir correctement aux besoins de sa famille et a ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Mar is married and a father, and lives in Senegal. He is 44 years old and is dynamically active in trading diverse products (seafood, clothing, local products, broiler chickens, sheep, etc.). At the same time he is a poultry farmer.

He has accumulated experience over the past 15 years in business activities he has chosen out of the necessity of providing for his family.

He is a former member of one of the U-IMCEC branches in the locality where he resides. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs he will use to buy sheep for resale.

Mr. March relies on his income to manage his social environment. This was how he was able to equip his home with furnishings and provide adequately for his family's and his own personal needs.

loans.use: buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermin nació en la comunidad de Paucarbamba y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 62 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos.

Fermin desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Paucarbamba, él se dedica a la construcción de obras y casas, él también se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Ya son varios años que se dedica al  negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Fermin requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes. 

Fermin se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Fermin pertenece al banco comunal “Inmaculada Concepción de Pachar” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Fermin was born in the community of Paucarbamba and lives in the same community, he is 62, has common-law partner and three children. 

Fermin performs his daily and economic activities in the city of Paucarbamba, he works in the construction of houses and other projects, he also works in agriculture and raising livestock. It's been a few years since he started this business and he does well thanks to the effort he puts in his work.

Fermin needs the loan to buy more small animals like cuyes.

Fermin is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and commits to make the repayments according to schedule. Fermin belongs to the community bank "Immaculate Conception of Pachar" from the Arariwa Association in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to buy small animals like cuyes.

loans.name: Marily

texts.en:
Marily is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Marily has a shop that sells fish, such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Marily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Nida is 50 years old and lives in Cantabon, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She is separated from her husband and has 4 school-aged children. Nida operates a grocery store, earning approximately PHP 7,000 each month.  She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock for her store. Nida has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Nida hopes to have enough savings to provide her children with a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Doris Xiomara

texts.es:
Doris, vive con su esposo en casa familiar, ella tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad como: aceite, arroz, jugos, gaseosas, gatorade, churros, galletas, el negocio lo inicio junto a su madre, trabaja de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar la mercadería necesaria para surtir su negocio como: jabón, detergentes, champoo,entre otros que de esa manera podrá mejorar su inventario y sus ventas cada día serán mejores.
La aspiración de Doris es que cada día atender mejor a sus clientes brindarles los productos que más necesitan y ayudar para los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Doris lives with her husband in the family home.  She has a store where she sells products of basic necessity like: oil, rice, juice, soft drinks, Gatorade, churros, and cookies.  She started the business along with her mother and they work from Monday to Sunday.  
The loan will be used to purchase merchandise necessary to stock the business, like: soaps, detergents, shampoo, amongst others.  This way she will be able to improve her inventory and her sales will improve daily.  Doris aspires to improve her customer care and offer them the products they most need and to be able to provide for her own household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, detergents, shampoo.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 27-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. His education background is up to secondary. 

He started his business by opening an office supplies store which provided good services for customers. In addition, he has purchased a document printer He is totally dependent on the income from this business to feed his family and to cover their living expenses. Most of his clients are students so he behaves with them as his children and works hard to provide them with all their requirements.

Recently, Osama`s business has faced a financial challenge leading to a decrease in his profit and he has had to stop providing all people's requirements because of the current bad situation which Yemen has been facing.

Osama is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to expand and purchase goods for his business so that he can again make students happy by providing  their supplies.

In the future, he hopes to buy another shop to sell stationery and buy a car.

loans.use: to expand and purchase stationery supplies for his business.

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is a local farmer from the district of Moung Koul Borey in the province of Banteay Meanchey. She is a widow with five children. Currently, two of her children are under her dependency, as they are still in school. Vanna grows rice paddies on two hectares of farmland, from which she is able to earn about 13,200 KHR. She has been in this business for quite some time. Vanna's group consists of two members. As first-time borrower, she is seeking for a new loan in the amount of 100,000 KHR. Vanna, the group leader, will use her portion to purchase two sacks of fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes that this purchase will help her earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Condokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe CONDOKPO est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église. Marcelle Afiavi, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marcelle Afiavi  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Marcelle Afiavi a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison depuis douze  ans, Marcelle Afiavi  vend de la pâte de maïs fermenté accompagnée de sauce dans sa région. Marcelle Afiavi  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Marcelle Afiavi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe CONDOKPO, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, des condiments et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 29 years old, married to Sarah and supports a family of two children. 

He has been operating his barber shop for the last five years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Justine has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a new shaving machine for use in his business to attract more customers and to earn more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his business. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a new shaving machine for use in his business to attract more customers and earn more income.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud countrywoman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, which is in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Sarah is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 7 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps cows. Sarah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states: "I have to do something for my family." 

Sarah joined Juhudi Kilimo which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Sarah is from a remote village that has poor roads and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Sarah to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

For smallholder women in Kenya, accessing a financial solution is an uphill battle, but Sarah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women to gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are many because Sarah will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase. 
Sarah is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Sarah will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Millicent started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Kerugoya, a remote town in Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Taking care of her farm is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her livestock is her hobby. Rice farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kerugoya area. Millicent has good knowledge of the market and wants to take advantage of the ready market. She is seeking a loan to plant rice.
Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, enterprising women like Millicent can achieve their dreams and goals. Millicent believes that the key to increased rice production is proper farming methods and irrigation of the rice. In addition to selling rice, she will also sell rice husks which will be used as fertilizer. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

Kindly lend to Millicent to keep her big smile!

loans.use: To plant rice

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kigamboni area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with two children. She keeps chickens (layers).It is now a sixth year since she started this business.She recently managed to get a tender to supply eggs to various kindergartein schools in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.From her own business she can not have enough eggs  to supply these schools.In order to keep her customers Rose buys these items from other poultry keepers and resell them to these schools,out of which she earns a small margin of profit.She realized that if she could produce herself these eggs she could earn super profit. She is in need of USD 1000 to expand the business to meet the demand from these schools.From the loan amount she will add a flock of chickens,expand chicken hut,add more trays and medicines for chickens especially in this rain season.

loans.use: Increase chickens number and expanding chicken hut

loans.name: Kelin Marinela

texts.en: I have been offering secretarial, photocopying and editing services for three years. I have various clients, lawyers and people from schools whom I help with papers and other projects. I also have Internet access, which I rent by the hour. My business is profitable and it is the only one of its kind in this part of the city.

loans.use: Purchase of paper, printer toner, tape, typewriter, envelopes, etc.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en: A dedicated client of LAPO who specializes in the sales of wood, Pius A. hails from Uromi of Edo State, Nigeria. He wishes that the above amount specified come to him for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more woods for sale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen S. Carrillo is a mother of two school-aged children. She is married and lives on Kollasuyo Avenue in the city of El Alto. Six years ago she started selling compact discs, movies, and music at the 16th of July fair. She is a member of Pro Mujer and a part of the Comunal Las Rosas Association. With her first loan, she purchased merchandise, like MP3 discs, that she sold at the city fairs. This allowed her to provide for her children, who were very young then, and to help her husband with the househould income. Currently, Carmen is the owner of 4 booths at the 16th of July fair where she sells DVD movies, MP3 music, etc. However, this business has a very short life span. This is why Carmen asks for a loan to invest capital in a new product and obtain a booth at the Huyustus market in the city of La Paz where she will sell computer accessories, recorders, as well as compact discs, disketes, and DVDs. This will allow her to forward her family, principally her two young children and herself, a very young and determined woman.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen S. Carrillo es madre de dos niños en edad escolar, casada, vive en la Av. Kollasuyo de la ciudad de El Alto. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de discos compactos, películas y música, en la Feria 16 de Julio de esa ciudad. Es socia de Pro Mujer, pertenece a la asociación Comunal Las Rosas, y con su primer desembolso logro la compra de mercadería consistente en discos de música MP3, con los cuales deambulaba por las Ferias de la ciudad, intentando dar sustento a sus niños, que en ese entonces eran muy pequeños, y el esposo carecía de fuente de trabajo. Actualmente Carmen es dueña de 4 puestos de venta en la Feria 16 de Julio, donde se dedica a la venta de películas en formato DVD, música MP3 y otros, pero es conciente que este negocio tiene poco tiempo de vida. A tal efecto, Carmen necesita de capital para poder cambiar de rubro, y lograr la compra de un puesto en el mercado Huyustus de la ciudad de La Paz, donde se dedicará a la venta de accesorios para computación, y soportes de grabación, como ser discos compactos, disketes, y DVD’s, de esta forma no quedarse sin fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia, principalmente a sus dos hijos que son muy pequeños y ella una mujer muy joven y decidida.

loans.use: To invest capital in a new booth and additional product

loans.name: Siti Yuliani

texts.id:
At 38 years old, Siti Yuliani is still faithfully selling salad and tidbits in front of her house to supplement the family’s finances, as her husband’s income being a chauffeur is inadequate to cover living expenses and the cost of her 4 children’s education. The family’s daily expense is approximately Rp 50.000 (about USD6), while her husband’s daily earnings is the same amount. Thus to improve the family’s financial situation, she sells salad and tidbits and from her effort generate income of between Rp 20.000 to 50.000 (USD3-6) daily.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 38 tahun Siti Yuliani masih setia dengan usahanya menjual rujak dan tipat didepan rumahnya untuk membantu perekonomian keluarganya, maklum pendapatan suami sebagai seorang sopir belum mampu mencukupi biaya hidup dan sekolah keempat anaknya. Dalam sehari mereka mengeluarkan biaya sekitar 50.000 rupiah untuk kebutuhan keluarga, sedangkan penghasilan suaminya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari. Untuk itulah Siti berjualan rujak dan tipat guna menopang perekonomian keluarganya, dan dari usahanya itu Siti memperoleh keuntungan antara 20.000 – 50.000 rupiah perharinya.

loans.use: Additional funding for her business (Tambah modal untuk usaha dagang)

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke A., is 51 years old, married with six children, and lives in Lagos. She sells drinks and is also  a hairdresser. She has been in business since 1989. She is currently a LAPO member and LAPO has helped ease her  financial stress. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more drinks, hair cream, weaves, and other products to help increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, hair cream and weaves for sale.

loans.name: Faatamalii

texts.en: Faatamalii is a fouty five year old lady who is married and has children. Her husband is an engineer and he runs his own taxi business. They have three children and one of them is staying in New Zealand and the other two are going to school. This is Faatamalii’s first loan and she is happy running her own business. She sells her goods from the front of her house and her customers are the traffic passers, the general public, and the village people. She is looking forward to earning more and expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy boxes of turkey tails, mutton flaps, chicken legs, and tomato sauce for her barbecue business

loans.name: Sundayah

texts.en: Sundayah, 35, together with her husband, P., raise ducks at their house. They sell their duck eggs, earning USD17 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to buy more ducks to raise. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more ducks

loans.name: Saom

texts.en: Mrs. Saom Y., 55, works as a farmer and purchases rice and resells it for profit, which everyday makes her on average $3 a day in profit. Mrs. Saom has seven children. Three of her children work in garment factories and one other works as a farmer. To improve their living condition, Mrs. Saom is requesting a loan from Kiva of about $500 to breed pigs and resell them when they grow up.

loans.use: Saom would like to breed pigs and sell them when they grow up.

loans.name: Salome

texts.es:
Salome has belonged to the Obreras Community Bank for 7 years now. Through this bank, she has learned to save and be financially disciplined.

Salome is divorced, she 62 years old, and has 3 children. She sells propane gas at wholesale and retail prices and distributes to homes. She buys her products in the city of Lima. Besides this business, Salome and her children run a poultry shop (which they call Faco's) located on a main street in the city of Ayacucho. Her oldest daughter is in charge of the administration of this business.

Salome needs a loan of 2000 suns (Peruvian currency) - about $725.00 (USD) which she plans to invest in the purchase of propane gas.

Their savings will be used to buy a refrigerator. Salome's dream is to improve their business, and to have additional savings in order to build onto their home and extend their poultry store.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Salome pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 7 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y ser disciplinada.

Salome es divorciada, tiene 62 años y 3 hijos, Salome vende gas propano al por mayor y menor y reparte a domicilio, sus productos lo trae de la ciudad de Lima. Además Salome junto a sus hijos tienen una pollería llamada Faco’s ubicada en una calle principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, la encargada de la administración de este negocio es su hija mayor.

Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas propano.

Sus ahorros son para comprar una refrigeradora. Los sueños de Salome son mejorar su negocios, tener otro deposito y construir mas pisos en su casa para ampliar su pollería.

loans.use: Loan will be used to purchase propane gas for her business. (Salome necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas propano.)
